loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice  is married with three children and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. 

Eunice has a business selling used shoes and has been in this business for 8 years. She works 6 days a week.  Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but no piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent, school fees, and medication.

Eunice has applied for a loan of 900,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used shoes. She sells her products from the market and on retail. She hopes to see her business grow so that she can rent a shop for her business.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used shoes.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en: Ann is 33 years old and married and with two children who are in school. She operates a grocery store to earn a living. She has been in this business for five years and employs one person. Previously, she had acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya, which helped her to grow her business. She dreams of expanding her business and supplying different institutions. She needs a loan of 50,000 KES to buy twenty-seven bags of potatoes.

loans.use: To buy bags of potatoes

loans.name: Judith Milagros

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  es la señora Judith, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los Lideres” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. Nuestra socia trabaja como secretaria en la administración pública. Judith en esta oportunidad invertirá el préstamo solicitado para comprar alimentos como arroz, azúcar, leche entre otros productos de primera necesidad para la mantención de sus hijos, ademas de pagar algunas deudas propias del hogar.
Judith está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Sra. Judith is a member of the Los Lideres Community Bank in the city of Cusco, Peru. She works as a secretary in public administration. She wants to use this loan opportunity to buy food such as rice, sugar, milk and other basics for her children and to pay off certain household debts. 

Judith is very grateful to Kiva for allowing her to provide her family with a better standard of living. She says thank you for the loan and promises to make the repayments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: buy food such as rice, sugar, milk etc. and to pay off  household debts.

loans.name: Mdzara

texts.en:
Mdzara is 48 years old and lives with her life partner and their four children. They live in their own home. Mdzara owns a cafe where she sells a variety of foods. Her business is located in a very busy main street, which is a very strategic location for making sales. In addition to this business, she also has other sources of income, which help her with her household expenses. Mdzara has a business selling second-hand clothes. 

She is very well-known in her area, because she always has what people need. She also sells good-quality food at affordable prices and provides excellent service. Mdzara is a woman who is committed to her work and has a great desire to do well in life. She is always waiting for new opportunities that will allow her to reach her goal of achieving success. The demand for her foods has increased over recent months. She does not want to let people down, and so she has decided to increase her food varieties.
 
Mdzara is requesting a loan from Yehu that will allow her to purchase wheat, sugar, and cooking oil. Mdzara has good credit references and is very responsible. She is certain that she will be able to repay her loan, and at the same time, provide her family with a better life.

loans.use: To purchase wheat, sugar, and cooking oil

loans.name: Edwina

texts.en:
Edwina is 55 years old and lives in Pangi, Siquijor, Siquijor. She is married with four children. To earn a living, Edwina has a general store business. She earns about PHP 2,000 each month from her work. Edwina has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase more stock for her general store business.
Edwina has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for more than one year. In the future, she hopes to succeed and sustain her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store business.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es: El socio Alberto nació en el departamento de Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, él tiene 68 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos, él pertenece al banco comunal “Los Comerciantes De Virgen Asunta” y le va muy bien gracias a los pagos puntuales de sus cuotas, él se dedica a la confección de zapatos y tiene un pequeño taller en su domicilio. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Alberto requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales como por ejemplo cueros, pegamento, hilos, agujas, cremas y otras cosas más.  El socio agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Alberto was born in the department of Cusco and still lives in the same town where he was born. He is 67 years old  and lives with his common-law wife with whom he has two children. He belongs to Los Comerciantes De Virgen Asunta Community Bank, and all is going well as he makes his loan repayments punctually. 

Alberto makes shoes and has a small workshop in his home. He's had the business for several years and is doing well. This time Alberto needs a loan to buy supplies such as leather, glue, thread, needles, polish etc. He is grateful for the loan and promises to make the repayments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: buy supplies such as leather, glue, thread, needles, polish etc.

loans.name: Genie

texts.en:
Genie is 43 years old and lives in Olo, Siquijor, Siquijor.  She is married with two children.

She sells fresh fish for a living and has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase orders of fresh fish to sell.

Genie has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for one year, and she hopes to grow her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase orders of fresh fish to sell

loans.name: Dora

texts.es:
La señora Dora es socia del banco comunal ”Nuevo Edén” del Distrito de Yarinacocha, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 46 años de edad, está casada y tiene seis hijos.
Son dos años que viene trabajando con Manuela Ramos y se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles y su negocio en la chacra (cosecha), viene a la ciudad cada semana a llevar sus productos para surtir su bodega.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,200.00 nuevos soles comprará: 2 sacos de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, 1 caja de aceite, 2 paquetes de fideos para sopa, 1 paquete de fideos para tallarín, 1 paquete de sal, 1 caja de leche chica, 10 casilleros de huevo, 1 paquete de harina.
Su negocio le genera buenos ingresos que le alcanza para poder seguir surtiendo su negocio y poder atender a sus clientes con todo lo que necesitan y que no tengan que ir a compara a  la competencia.
texts.en:
Sra. Dora is a member of the Nuevo Edén Community Bank in the District of Yarinacocha, Ucayali Department. She is 46 years old and married with six children. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos organization for two years. Dora earns her living selling groceries and from the produce she grows on her small farm. She goes to town every week to buy supplies for her grocery store.

With this new loan of S/. 1,200 she plans to buy two bags of rice, one bag of sugar, a box of oil, various types of noodles, a packet of salt, a box of small milk cans, ten cartons of eggs, and a packet of flour. Her business provides a good income, and she is able to keep her store well-stocked and provide her customers with all they need so they don't have to shop elsewhere.

loans.use: Buy rice, milk, sugsr, oil etc.

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es:
Zoila tiene 69 años, ella es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de alegre y dinámica. Está casada con Gabriel, quien se dedica a la construcción civil y es el padre sus hijos. Actualmente viven con su hija y sus dos nietos. La casa donde viven es propia.

Su actividad es la venta de gaseosas y golosinas de diversos sabores y marcas. Para eso cuenta con una refrigeradora para mantenerlas heladas, debido a la zona calurosa donde vive. A su misma casa llegan lo proveedores, ella les compra a precio por mayor para luego venderlo al menudeo. Lleva dedicándose a este negocio más de 36 años y es muy conocida en su zona, hasta el momento  cuenta con el apoyo ocasional de su pareja para la atención. Considera rentable su negocio, pues le genera buenas ganancias que le permiten solventar los gastos de su hogar y la apoyar en la educación de sus nietos. Por lo contrario, antes de iniciar con esta actividad el ingreso económico de su esposo no les alcanzaba para pagar y solventar todos los gastos de su hogar. 

Este es el préstamo número 9 que tiene con la institución MFP. Se siente contenta con la oportunidad de contar con una línea de crédito para avanzar con su negocio. Y además se siente bien con su banco comunal, pues los considera personas amables y responsables.
Con el monto solicitado, de 2000 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de más gaseosas y golosinas en mayor volumen.
texts.en: Zoila is 69 years old; she is a very dedicated and hard-working woman, as well as a cheerful and dynamic one. She is married to Gabriel, who works in civilian construction and is the father of her children. They are currently living with their daughter and their two grandsons. They own the house they live in. Zoila's business consists in selling soft drinks and sweets of various flavours and brands. She has a refrigerator in order to keep her wares cool, since the weather is very hot where she lives. Providers deliver to her home, and she buys the merchandise from them at wholesale prices before retailing it. She has been in this business for 36 years and is very well-known in the area. For now, her husband helps from time to time with manning the counter. Zoila considers her business to be profitable, since it generates a good income that enables her to pay for household expenses as well as help with her grandsons' education. Quite the opposite to their situation before starting her business, since the husband's income alone was not enought to pay for all the household's expenses. This loan is her ninth with field partner MFP. She is happy about having this opportunity to take out a loan in order to help her business move forward. Moreover, she feels at ease with her communal bank, because she thinks of the members as kind and responsible people. Zoila will invest the 2,000 new soles she asks for in buying more soft drinks and sweets in greater quantities.

loans.use: Compra de más gaseosas y golosinas para seguir vendiendo

loans.name: Cinthia

texts.es:
Cinthia tiene 25 años, es una mujer buena y amable. Su pareja es Iver, quien es electricista y con quien tiene una hija, Halen de 4 años de edad. Viven en la casa que le fue heredada a su pareja, allí comparten la alegría de criar a su menor hija, por quien trabajan mucho para poder brindarle una mejor calidad de vida.

Ella se dedica a la venta de pescado fresco y salado. Para ello, se levanta  muy  temprano para ir al puerto y comprar lo que necesita. Empezó con esta actividad desde muy joven, ya que su padre se dedicaba a lo mismo y viendo que es rentable se animó a continuar en el mismo rubro. Lo realiza independientemente, con la ayuda de su tío, desde hace más de 2 años. Adicionalmente, también se dedica a dar servicio de manicure y pedicura, en las tardes, desde hace 10 años. Le gustan sus negocios porque le brindan una ocupación y le generan un ingreso económico para poder apoyar a su pareja con los gastos de su hogar y la educación de su hija. Además, viendo los buenos resultados que está teniendo con su negocio tiene planes de continuar e incluso hacerlo crecer.

Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, por tanto espera continuar con sus objetivos. Está  muy comprometida, una vez más, a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas como en los anteriores créditos que tuvo. Y está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos son muy buenos, amables y solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado, 1200 nuevos soles, comprará pescado fresco y salado, en mayor volumen, para atender los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Cinthia is 25 years old and is a nice friendly woman. Her partner is Iver, who is an electrician and with whom she has a 4 year old daughter, Halen. They live in a house that her partner inherited and there they share the joy of raising their little girl for whom they work very hard to be able to provide her with a better quality of life. 

She works selling fresh and salted fish. To do this, she gets up very early to go to the port and to buy what she needs. She began this activity when she was very young, because her father worked doing the same thing, and seeing that it is profitable she decided to continue doing the same work. She started working independently, with the help of her uncle, over two years ago. Additionally, she has also performed manicures and pedicures in the afternoon, for over 10 years. She likes her businesses because they provide her with a job and they generate an income so that she can support her partner with the household expenses and the education of her child. Moreover, seeing the good results that she is having with her business, she has plans to continue them and make them grow.

This is her third loan with MFP, through which she hopes to continue with her goals. She is very committed, again, to complete the payment of her loans, like the two loans she had in the the past. She is very content belonging to her community bank because everyone is very nice, friendly and works in solidarity. 

With the amount solicited, 1200 nuevos soles, she will buy fresh and salted fish, in a larger volume, to  meet the demands of her customers.

loans.use: to buy more fresh and salted fish to continue her sales

loans.name: Abdulkosim

texts.ru: Абдулкосим родился 1986 году в районе Кумсангир. Он холост. Живет вместе с родителями. Его брат находится на заработках за рубежом. Сам Абдулкосим имеет высшее педагогическое образование, но он не работает по профессии. Абдулкосим работает таксистом. Он развозит пассажиров по маршруту Кумсангир-Душанбе. В этой области Абдулкосим работает четыре года. Он просит кредит для приобретения запчастей и ремонта мотора автомобиля, чтобы продолжит свою деятельность.
texts.en: Abdulkosim was born in 1986 in the Qumsangir. He is single and lives together with his parents. His brother temporarily works abroad. Abdulkosim has a college degree in education, but doesn’t work in his profession. He works as a taxi driver. He transports passengers between Qumsangir and Dushanbe [the capital city]. He has been in this field for four years. He is requesting a loan in order to buy spare parts and repair his car engine and continue his business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and repair his car engine.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en: Marissa is 20 years old and single. She is from San Miguel, Bohol. She wants to help her family, especially her brothers and sisters, to improve their lives. She is asking for a loan to buy pesticides, fertilizers and seedlings to continue rice farming on their land. This will serve as additional capital so she can proceed with land tilling and rice planting for an income. Her profit will then be used to provide a healthy diet for her family and reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy pesticides, fertilizers and seedlings

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly is 54 years old and lives  in South Poblacion, Siquijor, Siquijor.  She is a widowed mother of four children.

To earn a living, Beverly has a business selling frozen goods. She earns about PHP 1,800 each month from this work. She is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase orders of frozen goods to sell in the market.

Beverly became a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative on June 22, 2012, and she hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase orders of frozen goods to sell

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is a hardworking business lady who operates a beauty salon to earn a living. She operates her business in a good environment with reliable customers. She has been in the business for three years. Since she became a client of Faulu Kenya, she has improved on her saving culture because she has been trained in financial management. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. She needs a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy hair braids and oil.

loans.use: to buy hair braids and oil.

loans.name: Lina

texts.es:
Lina tiene 68 años, es una mujer buena, amable y muy perseverante. Está casada con Hildebrando, el padre de sus dos hijos, a quienes crio y educó hasta el momento que decidieron independizarse. Ahora vive al lado de su esposo, de 78 años, quien la acompaña y comparten momentos felices. Tienen una casa propia, la cual construyeron en el terreno que compraron juntos.

La bodega de Lina es una de las más concurridas de su zona, está ubicado en su misma vivienda y siempre está ella esperando a sus clientes para atenderles de manera amble. Su actividad empieza cuando se levanta muy temprano y se dirige al mercado en busca de los abarrotes y comestibles variados, de primera necesidad para vender en su bodega, es por eso que sus clientes siempre acuden a su bodega, ya que tiene lo primordial, fresco y del día. También vende gaseosas de diversas marcas y sabores. Su negocio empezó hace más de 20 años y hasta el momento cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo. Le gusta mucho su trabajo, se divierte y la pasa muy bien, cuando empezó tuvo algunos altibajos, pero con bastante empeño pudo superarlos y ahora está muy contenta. 

Este es el crédito número 19 que tiene con MFP y está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, así se sentirá más segura de avanzar con su trabajo. Por otro lado, se compromete, una vez más, a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en los anteriores créditos. Y le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal, del cual tiene el gusto de decir que es fundadora y aportar a que todos sus integrantes sean personas responsables y muy solidarias.

Con el monto solicitado, 2000 nuevos soles, comprará más mercadería y productos para ofrecer a sus clientes, como arroz, azúcar, leche, conservas y otros. También gaseosas, buscando los precios más bajos para aumentar su margen de ganancia.
texts.en:
Lina is 68 years old, is a nice and friendly woman and very perseverant. She is married to Hildebrando, the father of her two children, who she raised and educated up to the moment they decided to be independent. Now she lives at her husband's side, who is 78 years old, accompanies her and with whom she shares happy moments. They have their own home which they constructed on the land that they bought together.

Lina's store is one of the busiest in her neighborhood, it is located in her home and she is always awaiting her clients to attend to them in a friendly manner. Her work begins when she gets up very early and she heads to the market in search of the various goods and groceries that she needs to sell in her store. It is because of this that her customers always go to her store, she has the most elementary and fresh goods of the day. She also sells diverse brands and flavors of soda. She began her business over 20 years ago and up to this moment she has always counted on the support of her husband. She enjoys her work a lot, she has fun and it goes very well. When she started she had some ups and downs, but over time she was able to overcome them and now she is very content. 

This is her 19th loan that she has had with MFP and she is very happy to know that she has financial support. This way, she will feel more secure continuing her work. She endeavors to, once again, complete the payment of her shares like with the prior loans. She likes being a part of her community bank, which she is happy to say she was a founding member of, and she supports all of its members who are responsible and supportive. 

With the amount sought, 2000 nuevos soles, she will buy more merchandise and products to offer to her clients, like rice, sugar, milk, preserves, among others, as well as sodas, while seeking the lowest prices to increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To buy more groceries (rice, sugar, noodles, preserves, milk, etc.) for her store

loans.name: Ninive Abihail

texts.es:
Ninive es una mujer de 24 años, es soltera, vive con sus padres y hermanos en la ciudad de Ica; ella es una persona muy alegre, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación, gracias al apoyo de sus padres Ninive pudo estudiar la carrera técnica de Enfermería, en sus ratos libres le gusta cantar y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Pollo al Horno para compartir con su familia.
Gracias a su espíritu emprendedor y a su gran deseo por salir adelante, día a día Ninive trabaja vendiendo combustible en un grifo de su ciudad, ella labora un aproximado de 10 horas diarias y se siente a gusto realizando su labor, ya que sus jefes la consideran mucho por su buen desempeño y trato amable.
Ninive se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de un pequeño horno, una batidora y licuadora; de esta manera Ninive contará con las herramientas necesarias para adicionalmente poder poner en marcha su pequeño negocio de postres y pastelillos; así ella espera poder obtener mayores ingresos económicos, los cuales en un futuro no muy lejano desea poder utilizar para poder tener su casa propia y seguir ayudando a sus padres.
texts.en: Ninive is a 24 years old woman; she is single and lives with her parents and siblings in the city of Ica. She is a very happy person, she is hard working and enthusiastic, and has a great desire of self-improvement. Thanks to the support of her parents, Ninive was able to study the technical career of nursing. In her spare time, she likes to sing, and in some occasions she cooks a delicious baked chicken to share with her family. Thanks to her entrepreneurial spirit and her desire to get ahead, Ninive works everyday selling gas at a gas station in her city. She works about 10 hours a day and feels comfortable doing her job, since her bosses have her in great esteem because of her good performance and kind disposition. Ninive is very thankful to Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help provided she will be able to buy a small oven, a mixer and a blender; in this way Ninive will have the necessary tools to additionally set up a small desserts and baked products business. She hopes this will help her to get a higher income, which she hopes she will be able to use in the near future to buy a house of her own and keep helping her parents.

loans.use: to buy a small oven, a mixer and a blender

loans.name: Scholar

texts.en:
Scholar is 50 years old, married and blessed with three children that she supports. She has sold tea leaves for the last three years, making a monthly income of 8,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). 

She applying for her first loan of 30,000 KES from KADET LTD. She plans to purchase more tea leaves to restock her shop. 

The anticipated profits will support her business and buy her a residential plot. Her future dream is to develop the plot.

loans.use: To purchase more tea leaves for resale

loans.name: Kassim

texts.en:
Kassim has owned a retail shop since the year 2002. He has been in this business for 10 years and has loyal customers in his neighborhood.

Kassim is a married man with four children. For this reason, he works to ensure he provides for his family and gets a better ability to invest more in his business.

Kassim would like to invest the loan he has requested from Yehu Microfinance in buying wheat flour, maize flour, soda, sugar and other products to sell in his business.

Kassim is grateful to Yehu Microfinance for the support they have provided which will give him the opportunity he needs to provide his business with another boost and make his story known to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, maize flour, soda, sugar and other products.

loans.name: Kevin

texts.en:
Kevin is a very clever man. He is very hardworking and always works hard to ensure that he earns a good income. For five years he has been operating a meat-goat business, selling at the market. He likes his work and works with pleasure. He is single but supports his siblings who are in school. Kevin has many customers, the majority from slaughter houses, and all of them are glad for his work. 

He is a very determined person who started with only one goat after getting a loan from his uncle. Thanks for his work, he can now purchase up to five goats. He is asking for a loan to buy goats for sale.

loans.use: to buy goats for sale.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
María, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para poder fortalecer el negocio, en la compra de los insumos para elaborar las pupusas, como son el aceite, quesillo, chicharrón, gaseosas, entre otros productos que son parte del proceso y que le permite cada día poder realizar su venta.

Con el préstamo anterior compro una buena parte de materiales para el negocio, consiguio que su familia a través de los ingresos por las ventas, cubriera mejor su necesidades, ofrecio a sus clientes una mayor producción, hasta el momento ella considera estar progresando todo a través de la ayuda de los préstamos.
texts.en:
María is requesting a new loan so that she can strengthen her business. She will purchase supplies for making “pupusas” such as oil, cheese, pork skins, sodas, and other items that are part of this process. This will enable her to make sales each day.

With her previous loan, María was able to buy a good supply of materials for her business. She was able to provide for her family with the income from her sales and also do a better job of covering their needs. María also produced more products to offer to her customers. At the moment, she believes all of the progress she has made was a result of the help from the loans.

loans.use: to buy oil, cheese, pork skins, sodas, and other supplies.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is 52 years old and married. He sells natural medicines to make a living. He has been in the business for five years and has employed one person. He also operates a taxi transport business to generate extra income. Through Faulu Kenya, he has become knowledgeable on saving because he has been trained in financial management. He dreams of opening more outlets in different locations in the future. He needs a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy natural medicine for resale.

loans.use: to buy natural medicine for resale.

loans.name: Ia

texts.en:
Ia is 41 years old. She lives in a small village of Martvili District with her family: her parents, who are pensioners, a brother and a sister. Her brother works in construction and gets service fee for the work. Ia and her family members run an agricultural business. They have two milking cows, a bull, a calf and a pig. Ia milks cows twice in a day and produces cheese. The family sells milk and cheese on the local open market. They also own a vineyard and a plot of land where nut and maize are grown. They work hard on their plot during the spring and summer seasons to get a good harvest. They pick grapes in late summer and produce wine. They sell harvested nuts, maize, produced wine and other vegetables and fruits on the local open market. The total average monthly income of the family is 900 Georgian lari (GEL). The family members work hard; they still don’t have enough income to make some savings for purchasing additional needed household goods or renovation of the house.

Ia requested a loan to increase the stock-in-trade. This will increase the sales from their business and will positively impact the income of the family. With increased income they will be able to renovate the house, because the existing house is old and uncomfortable. After renovation, they will be able to spend their evenings after hard working days in more comfortable environment.

loans.use: to increase the stock in trade.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary has been able to do tailoring and sell clothes thanks to her previous Yehu loans with which she bought cloth material for tailoring and bundles of wheat flour and maize flour in large quantities for her retail shop. Currently she is applying for a new Kiva loan with which she will buy fabrics, thread, and supplies in bulk. She will be able to save on the cost of these products, thereby allowing her to generate more profit from her sales. She can benefit from buying the materials with cash and in larger quantities than usual. She sends the following message to the Kiva backers: "I am very grateful for the financing of my project since you have given me the opportunity to increase my production and my income."

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread, and supplies in bulk.

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet is 43 years old and single with two children. She runs a nutritional supplements business. She has been in this business for years earning a monthly income of 10,000 Kenyan shillings (KES).

This will be her first loan from KADET LTD and she plans to use it to purchase herbal products such as soaps, oil. and medicinal herbs.

She plans to use the anticipated profit to educate her children to the highest level. She hopes to buy a plot and expand the business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase herbal products such as soaps, oil. and medicinal herbs.

loans.name: Felister

texts.en: Felister is 33 years old and married with three children who are in school. She operates a retail shop to earn a living. She also operates a grocery store and does farming to generate extra income. She has been in this business for three years and has one employee. She dreams of operating a wholesale business in the future. She needs a loan of 70,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy sugar, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.use: to buy sugar, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is a 62-year-old married woman from Bohol, Philippines. She has been engaged in buying and selling of coconut fruit for about 11 years now. Mature coconut fruit is sold for cooking oil purposes. The young coconut fruit is valued as an ingredient in making fruit salads and other desserts. Julia will buy coconut from the farm and sell it to the market at a higher price.

Julia works hard in order to earn a living so that she can help her husband in meeting the needs of the family, especially for the education of her children.
Julia is asking for loan of 4000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to be used as additional capital for her business. The loan will give her the opportunity to buy coconut in bulk.

Julia dreams of improving her business to augment her income. With the revenue generated from the business she will be able to send her children to college to earn a degree. She also plans to save some of the money for future use and reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy coconut fruit in bulk.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is 35 years old and married with three children. He operates a retail shop to earn a living. He has been in the business since the year 2009 and has employed two people. He runs his business in a conducive environment with reliable customers. He dreams of operating a wholesale business in the future. He needs a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy sugar and maize flour for resale.

loans.use: to buy sugar and maize flour.

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en: Jeremiah is a 35-year-old married man. He has 2 children, ages 4 and 7 years old. He describes himself to be a kind and patient man. He operates a retail store where he sells metal. He has been involved in this business for 6 years and employs 3 staff members. His business is located in a hot, dry area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high prices of electricity. He will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) loan to buy metal. His business goal is to run a big welding retail store within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will have built a house for his family with the profits generated.

loans.use: to buy metal.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is single and lives in a rental house alone but says that he supports his parents who are in his rural home. He operates a cereal-selling business, selling at the market in a small store. He has been in this business for the last two years. Patrick narrates that he was previously employed in a shop where he gained experience on how to manage a business and relate to customers, before deciding to open his own business. Thanks to his effort, his business is doing well. However, he faces a major challenge of lack of enough capital to fund his business. This is why he is requesting a loan from Yehu and Kiva. Patrick will use this loan to buy sacks of maize and beans so as to increase his inventory.

In the future, he hopes to expand to a bigger store, and later construct a house as he plans to have a wife soon. To do this, he promises to make his payments on time so he can request more loans. His other challenge is the elevated cost of living and access to financing.

loans.use: to buy sacks of maize and beans.

loans.name: Japheth

texts.en: Japheth is a 42 year old married man. He has 3 children with ages ranging from 1 year to 12 years. He describes himself to be aggressive and honest man. He operates a retail store where he provides services of motorcycle and bicycle repair. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located at a busy business environment  and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be high cost of maintenance. He will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy motorcycle and bicycle spare parts. His business goal is to run a fully stocked motorcycle spare parts retail store within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will educate his children using the profits generated from the business.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle and bicycle spare parts.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is seventy two years old, married to Grace and blessed with four children. He practices dairy farming and owns rental houses, for the last fifty two years earning monthly income of KES. 45,000.

This will be his seventh loan with KADET LTD and he plans to use the loan to purchase a dairy cow to rear for more milk production.

He also plans to use the anticipated profit for expanding the business. His hopes and dreams to have a herds of cows in future.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow to add stock.

loans.name: Jumber

texts.en:
Jumber is 26 years old.  He lives in a small village of Tskaltubo District with his family: wife – Tamta and their 1-year-old daughter. Jumber and Tamta earn their living through agricultural business. They have a milking cow and produce cheese, which is sold on the local open market. They also, have a pig and Jumber sells piglets in nearby villages. Jumber and Tamta are busy with farming also; they have two greenhouses, where they grow tomato and greens. They sell harvested product on the local open market as well. Total average monthly income of the family is 700 Lari.

Jumber requested a loan to make an additional greenhouse. Thus, he will be able to sow more vegetables. He will work hard on his plot and after properly done seasonal agricultural works, he hopes to get more and better quality harvest, which will be sold for a good price. This will increase the income of the family. With increased income, Jumber will be able to create better living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to make a greenhouse

loans.name: Karen

texts.es:
Karen tiene 19 años, ella es una mujer alegre y amable, además de ser trabajadora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Es soltera y todavía no tiene hijos. Vive en la casa que compró con sus ahorros, en compañía de sus padres, su hermana y un sobrino.

Se dedica a la venta de gaseosas y golosinas, las cuales compra en los centros comerciales de la ciudad. Tiene más de 2 años dedicándose a este negocio y por el momento cuenta con el apoyo de su madre y hermana quienes atienden a los clientes cuando ella está fuera de casa.
Le gusta lo que hace, pues obtiene buenos ingresos económicos y se siente una persona productiva. Para el futuro desea convertirse en una prospera empresaria, por lo que tiene planes de empezar a vender abarrotes y otros comestibles.

Este es el tercer préstamo que tiene con la institución MFP. Por otro lado, comenta ser responsables con sus compromisos y pagará puntualmente sus cuotas como en los créditos anteriores.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1200 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de mercadería para surtir su bodega con golosinas y gaseosas de diversas marcas y sabores.
texts.en:
Karen is 19 years old.  She is a happy and kind woman, as well as being hardworking with a great drive to get ahead.  She is single and she does not have any children yet.  She lives in the house she bought with her savings, along with her parents, her sister, and a nephew. 

She sells soft drinks and candy for a living, which she buys in the city's shopping centers.  She has had this business for over two years and she currently has the help of her mother and sister to rely on, as they tend to customers when she is not home.

She likes what she does, as she earns good income and it makes her feel like a productive person.  In the future, she wants to become a prosperous businesswoman, which is why she has plans to start selling groceries and other foodstuffs.

This is her third loan with MFP.  She tells us that she is responsible when it comes to her commitments and that she will make her payments on time, as she did with her previous loans. 

She will invest the requested 1,200 nuevos soles in the purchase of merchandise to stock her store with different kinds and flavors of candy and soft drinks.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and candy to keep her business up

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married woman with three children who all attend school. She has ten years’ experience running a fruit and vegetable store in the market of the community of Msambweni. She is a hardworking person, keen to overcome any difficulties. She starts work very early since she has to find fresh produce for her store.

Rose wants to expand her business so she is seeking a loan to buy vegetables such as tomatoes, onions, hot peppers, and potatoes to stock her store and respond to her customers’ requests. One of her goals is to have a spacious store where she can display all the produce.

loans.use: to buy vegetables such as tomatoes, onions, hot peppers, and potatoes

loans.name: Mamuka

texts.en:
Mamuka is 56 years old. He lives in a small village Tskaltubo District with his family: wife – Natuli, mother and two children (5 and 6 years old). The family runs agricultural business. They have a milking cow and produce cheese. They sell produced cheese on the local open market. They also, have 4 greenhouses, where they grow greens in winter and tomato and cucumber in summer. They work hard on their plot to get good harvest. They sell harvested product on the local open market. Total average monthly income of the family is 800 Lari.

Mamuka requested a loan to build an additional greenhouse. Thus, he will be able to sow more vegetables. After properly done seasonal agricultural works, he hopes to get more and better quality harvest. Mamuka hopes to sell it for a good price. This will increase the income of the family. With increased income, he will be able to improve living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to build an additional greenhouse

loans.name: Omari

texts.en: Omari is a forty-seven-year-old married man with 8 children living in Tiribe, Kenya. Six of his children are still in school while the first two are adults and independent. He has been operating a meat goat business for over 15 years. His hardships are disease outbreak, theft and price fluctuations. His personal goals are educating his children and building a permanent home. His business goals are to open a whole sale, hiring employees to help expand his business, and expanding business into new markets. Omari is requesting for a second loan to expand his business. With this loan, he intends to buy two cows.

loans.use: to buy two cows.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline  is a single mother of nine children and six of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family member’s (one of late brother‘s child).  She has a business of a pub and has been in this business for 20 years. She has applied for a loan of 700000 Uganda shillings from MCDTSACCO to buy more crates of beer and soda, boxes of mineral water and jerycans of local Gin. She works from her home and sells on retail basis seven days a week.  She doesn’t have any other income generating activity. Her major business challenges are seasonality and defaulters.  She is aspiring of seeing her business grow big so that she owns a fully stocked pub and also to build her own house. Caroline resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and no piped water.  Her monthly expenses includes rent, feeding the family and school fees

loans.use: To buy more  crates of beer and soda, boxes of  mineral water and jerycans of local Gin.

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine is 54 years old she lives in a small village of Martvili District with her father – Miriane. Marine and her father are busy with agricultural business. They have 2 milking cows and a pig. They own a plot of land, where persimmon is grown. In addition, to their agricultural activities they are busy with trading. They sell their produced cheese, piglets, persimmon together with other agricultural products on the local open market. Total average monthly income of the family is 500 Lari.

Marine requested a loan to increase stock-in-trade. She will diversify the products, attracting new customers and increasing sales. With this loan, the average income of the family will increase. As a result, of the above-mentioned, Marine and her father will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase stock for trade

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is forty two years single and blessed with five children that she supports.She runs second hand clothes business for the last eighteen years earning a monthly income of KES. 13,000

She has applied for her first loan of KES 20,000 from KADET LTD, which she plans to purchase more stock of second hand clothes both children and adult clothes for sale.

The anticipated profit she will invest into the business.Her future dreams are to have a stable business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of second hand clothes both children and adult clothes for sale.

loans.name: Wayua

texts.en:
Wayua is 60 years old, married, and has five adult children with their own careers and on their own.

Wayua sells fruits and vegetables, a job which thankfully allows her to support her family with what they need to have a dignified and respectful life.

She says that she has good customers because she has always sold good quality products. She is asking for this loan so that she can buy more fruits and vegetables to stock her business and meet her customer demand.

She is grateful for the opportunity given to her and it will be of great help to her small business.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki has been able to continue providing her beauty services thanks to her previous Yehu loans with which she bought hair weaves, gel and hair food oil in large quantities.

She is now requesting a new Kiva loan to buy flour, eggs, baked goods, beverages, candy, and other products to establish a grocery shop. She can benefit from buying them with cash and in larger quantities than usual.

Riziki sends the following message to Kiva backers: "I am very grateful for the financing of my project since you have given me the opportunity to increase my production and my income."

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs, baked goods, beverages, and candy.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana, who is married but has no children, is a dressmaker with a small sewing workshop where she works hard every day. She started in this line of work with a friend who taught her how to sew. Now she is a professional, making all types of garments. 

Nana is requesting a loan to buy fabric, thread, buttons, sewing needles and other supplies so that she can continue to work and fill her customer's orders. She thanks Kiva and Yehu Microfinance for the opportunity she is receiving, because it will be a great help to her.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, buttons, sewing needles and other supplies

loans.name: Odilia

texts.es:
La señora Odilia tiene 56 años de edad, es casada, tiene 3 hijos y vive en cuna colonia suburbana de la Ciudad de San Pedro Sula, Cortes.
Doña Odilia  cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien la ayuda cubrir los gastos del hogar. Anteriormente, Doña Odilia era comerciante ambulante, ella tenía la necesidad de cuidar de sus hijos  y seguir  teniendo  una fuente de ingreso. Así que ella decidió establecer una  pulpería en donde  vende productos de consumo como  granos básicos, condimentos, carnes, refrescos, jugos, pan, huevos y productos de abarrotería. Odilia se siente motivada con su negocio ya que con la ayuda de los financiamientos que Odef le ha brindado a logrado mantener su negocio estable y bien surtido. atiende a su clientela 16 horas al día. 
Solicitó su tercer crédito de L25, 000 para surtir el negocio con la compra de carnes, granos básicos, condimentos, lácteos, embutidos, refrescos, pan y productos de abarrotería como papel, jabón de lavar, de baño, pasta dental, etc. Ella espera cumplir con este compromiso con ODEF y hacer crecer su pulpería y atender mejor a sus clientes.
Ella agradece de antemano por creer en ella y por la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en:
Sra. Odilia is 56 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in a suburban neighborhood in the city of San Pedro Sula, Cortes.

Doña Odilia has the support of her husband, who helps with covering the household expenses. She previously worked as a street vendor, but she needed to take care of her children and continue generating income. Therefore, she decided to open a grocery store where she sells consumer goods such as basic grains, condiments, meats, soft drinks, juices, bread, eggs, and grocery products. Odilia is motivated to continue her business with the help of the loans from ODEF. She will be able to maintain a stable and well-stocked business. Odilia attends to her customers for 16 hours a day.

She is requesting her third loan in the amount of 25,000 HNL so that she can restock her business by purchasing meats, basic grains, condiments, dairy products, sausages, soft drinks, bread, and other grocery products such as paper, dishwashing soap, bath soap, toothpaste, and other items. Odilia hopes to fulfill her commitment with ODEF so that she can grow her grocery store and better serve her customers. She wants to thank in advance those who believe in her and are providing her this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy  meats, basic grains, condiments, dairy products, sausages, soft drinks, bread, and other grocery products.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  es la señora Elena, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los Lideres” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. Nuestra socia se sigue dedicando a la docencia de educación inicial. Elena en esta oportunidad invertirá el préstamo solicitado para invertir en la educación de sus hijos y pagar sus estudios.
Elena está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en: Elena, is a member of the communal bank 'Los Lideres', from Cusco city - Perú. Elena is still working as a pre-school teacher. This time, Elena will use the loan requested to invest it in her children's education and pay for them to be able to study. Elena is very thankful to Kiva for allowing her to provide a better standard of living to her family. Elena is thankful for the loan and commits to keep the repayments on time according to the repayment schedule.

loans.use: to pay for her children's education

loans.name: Dona

texts.es:
Dona tiene 49 años, es una mujer trabajadora y decidida con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Su pareja es Ricardo, quien es soldador y el padre de sus dos hijos; Carlis de 13 años y Kevin de 9 años. Juntos, viven en la casa que compraron con el fruto de sus ahorros de varios años.  

Ella se dedica a la venta de gaseosas y abarrotes de primera necesidad. Para eso cuenta con un ambiente amplio donde instaló su bodega en su misma vivienda, donde también tiene una refrigeradora y una congeladora para mantener heladas sus bebidas. Se inició hace más de 10 años  con un capital propio, comprando en pequeñas cantidades, que fue aumentando viendo la demanda de sus productos. Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por las ganancias que le deja, logrando tener una buena demanda y siendo muy conocida en su localidad. Antes de empezar con este negocio tuvo dificultades económicas ya que los gastos aumentaron con la llegada de sus hijos, y ella tiene el deseo de brindarles una mejor calidad de vida, una buena educación para que logren su realización personal, además de apoyar a su pareja con los gastos del hogar.

Este será su préstamo número 10 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, le gusta el trabajo que viene realizando en su banco comunal, apoyando a las personas en avanzar con sus negocios.
Con el monto solicitado, de 3000 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de gaseosas y abarrotes para incrementar el stock de su tienda.
texts.en:
Dona is 49 years old.  She is a hardworking and determined woman with a great drive to get ahead.  Her partner is Ricardo, who is a welder and the father of her two children, 13-year-old Carlis and 9-year-old Kevin.  They all live together in the house they bought with the return on several years' savings.  

She sells soft drinks and essential grocery items for a living.  She has a spacious area in which to do this where she set up her store in her own home and where she also has a refrigerator and a freezer to keep her beverages ice-cold.  She started out over ten years ago with her own capital by buying in small quantities, which she gradually increased after seeing the demand for her products.  She thinks her business is pretty profitable based on the earnings she makes, as she has been able to maintain a good level of demand and she is well-known in the area.  Before starting this business, she had financial problems, as her expenses went up after she had her children.  She wants to offer them a better quality of life and a good education so they can achieve personal fulfillment, and she also wants to help her partner out with the household expenses.

This will be her tenth loan with MFP and she hopes to continue to pursue her objectives.  She also likes the work she has been doing in her communal bank supporting people as they make progress with their businesses. 

She will use the requested 3,000 nuevos soles to buy soft drinks and groceries to increase her store's inventory.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and foodstuffs to stock her store

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino is 44 years old. She lives in Khoni District with her mother – Eter, who is a pensioner. They are refugees and get social assistance from local government. They earn their living through agricultural business with 1 milking cow and 13 turkeys. They produce cheese and sell it on the local open market. They grow turkeys and sell them for a good price. Total average monthly income of the family is 280 Lari, which is hardly enough for food. 

Nino requested a loan to repair the cattle-shed. In a new cattle-shed she will be able to keep more livestock and take good care of them. This will help her to increase her agricultural business and improve living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to repair the cattle-shed

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki, 39, is from Tiribe, Mombasa city. She’s a merchant; she has a store she has three years’ experience working with. She is a very hardworking, enterprising person who always strives to the maximum degree to be able to help her family members and to give them everything they need to have a life with no privations or unmet needs.

She’s asking for the loan to buy supplies to stock her store with beverages, canned goods, baked goods and others to continue having it well-stocked.
She is grateful for the support Yehu Microfinance and Kiva give her.

loans.use: to stock her store with beverages, canned goods, baked goods

loans.name: Sasha

texts.en:
Sasha is 53 years old. He is married and lives in a small village of Khoni District with his family: wife – Lali, a mother and 7 years old daughter. His wife is an accountant and gets service fee for the work. Sasha runs agricultural business. He has 3 milking cows, bull and a calf. He produces cheese and sells it on the local open market. He owns a plot of land, where nut, maize and laurel are grown.  He works hard on his plot to get good harvest. He sells harvested product on the local open market as well. Total average monthly income of the family is 600 Lari.

Sasha requested a loan to repair the roof of the house. After repairing it, the family will not be afraid of snow and rain. Due to the above mentioned, the living conditions of the family will be improved and they will be able to spend their evenings after hard working days in more comfortable environment.

loans.use: to repair the roof of the house

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is 50 years old, married and raising a big family; his wife and eight children. His wife is a farmer. As the main source of income for his family, Julius operates a meat goat business selling at the market mostly to people buying for slaughter, after having started this business last year with only two goats Thanks to persistent work, Julius currently has increased his purchase and he can now buy up to five goats. With an aim to further develop his business, Julius turned to Yehu for a loan in the amount of 40,000 KES for the purchase eight goats. He plans to invest the income from the loan in further expanding his business, and he dreams of owning a rental house in future.

loans.use: to purchase eight goats.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is twenty seven years old single blessed with two school going children.She is a horticulture business lady for the last three years earning monthly income of KES.6,500.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our credit officer, and is applying for her first loan KES.20,000 from KADET LTD, she plans to purchase farm inputs e.g. fertilizers, pesticides and seedlings to use in her farm for good harvest.

The anticipated profits she will invest back into her business.Her future dreams are to have a happy family and buy a plot.

loans.use: she plans to purchase farm inputs e.g. fertilizers, pesticides and seedlings

loans.name: Shalva

texts.en:
Shalva is 30 years old. He lives in a small village in Martvili District with his mother – Zhuzhuna. Shalva is busy with agricultural business. In particular, he has a livestock and a plot of land, where nuts are grown.  He is very hard working man and takes good care to his livestock and agricultural land. Along with his agricultural activities he is busy with production of furniture. He produces sofas and arm-chairs and sells them in Kutaisi and Khoni. Total average monthly income of the family is 400 Lari. 

Shalva requested a loan to expand his business. He wants to purchase necessary materials and will produce sofas and arm-chairs. This will increase the income of the family. With increased income he will be able to reinvest in his business in order to expand it and make more profitable. As a result of the above mentioned activity, Shalva will be able to create better living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to purchase necessary materilas for production of sofa and arm-chairs

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married. She’s 60 years old and lives in Msambweni neighborhood in the city of Mombasa where she owns her house that has all basic conditions required for fish sales.

She’s been in this line of work for about four years. She has the necessary infrastructure to continue with the work, that is, a canoe and nets.

Fatuma is very well known in village because of the great variety of fish she has. Because of this she hopes to have this support to continue improving the quality she offers her customers and is asking for a loan to buy raw materials like a fishing pole, fishing line and bait, among others, to continue working.

loans.use: to buy raw materials like a fishing pole, fishing line and bait, among others, to continue working.

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is 26 years old. She is single and lives in her own house though it lacks both electricity and piped water. She is engaged in buying and selling of different consumer products in a kiosk.
It has been two years since she started this business and it was a great help to improve her lifestyle. Umazi tells us that she is a pre-primary teacher and that her cousin helps her when she is away for her official duties.
She is aiming for higher income but she lacks capital to buy additional products. So Umazi is asking for a loan of KES 20,000 to purchase additional stock of maize and wheat flour, rice, and sugar.
She hopes that through her availed loan, she could gain higher proceeds to save for her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of maize and wheat flour, rice, and sugar.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali, a 46-year-old married father of seven who lives in his own house that has neither electricity nor piped water, has been a tailor for over ten years, having learned the business from his father. He begins his daily activities at around 8 a.m. and goes through until about 6 p.m.

Ali is requesting this loan through Yehu to buy clothing materials. His goal is to increase both his sales and his income so that he can open a retail shop.

loans.use: to buy clothing materials.

loans.name: Leila

texts.en:
Leila is 48 years old. She lives in a small village of Tetritskaro District with her family: her daughter-in-law and two grandchildren (5 and 6 years old). 

Leila is busy with agricultural activities. She has a milk cow, a pig, and 20 hens. She produces cheese and sells it on the local market. The family's  average monthly income is 400 Lari.

Leila requested a loan to expand her agricultural business. She will purchase calves and raise them. After a year, she will be able to double production and sales of cheese, and the income of the family will significantly increase. Thus, she will be able to create better living conditions for her family. 

Leila hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase calves to raise for their milk.

loans.name: Verginia

texts.en:
Verginia, a 38-year-old mother of four young children from Panglao, Bohol, Philippines, has been operating a hog-raising business for about nine years now. Her husband is a fisherman.

Verginia is requesting a loan from CEVI to buy feeds for the hogs that she is raising. With the loan, she will be able to raise healthy pigs, thus giving her greater opportunity for more profitable sales. Verginia wants to develop and improve her business to augment her income. She believes that you only have to be hardworking in order to succeed in life.

loans.use: to buy feed for the hogs.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married and has five grown-up children. For the past 2 years, she has been selling basic household products. She would like to increase her stock by investing the loan that she has requested in buying rice, cooking fat, sugar, noodles, soda, etc. She has a sales location in her own home from which she supplies the whole neighborhood.

Fatuma has a lot of merchandise owing to the number of customers that she has right now. She hopes to be able to further overcome the poverty in which she lives.

loans.use: to purchase rice, cooking fat, sugar, noodles, soda, etc.

loans.name: Sofio

texts.en:
Sofio is 32 years old. She is married and lives in a small village of Khoni District with her family: husband – David, parents-in-law and two children (8 and 10 years old). Both of the children go to the local school. Her father-in-law is a construction worker and gets service fee for the work. Sofio and David are busy with agricultural business; they have a milking cow and a pig. Sofio milks the cow twice in a day and produces cheese. They also, have an agricultural land, where nut and maize are grown. They sell cheese, harvested products and pigs on the local open market. Along with agricultural business Sofio is busy with sewing. She has her own sewing workshop and gets orders. Total average monthly income of the family is 750 Lari. They work hard, but their income is hardly enough for food for six members of the family.

Sofio requested a loan to expand her agricultural business. She will purchase pigs and will grow them. Grown pigs will be sold for a good price. This will increase the income of the family. The profit earned from the business will be used for further expansion of the family’s rural activities. Taking into account the above mentioned, living conditions of the family will improve.

loans.use: to purchase piglets

loans.name: Nani

texts.en:
Nani is 43 years old. She lives in a small village of Tetritskaro District with her family: her two children (17 and 18 years old) and her mother-in-law, who is a pensioner. Both children study in the village school. 

Nani is busy with agricultural business. She has a small dairy farm with 9 milk cows and 13 calves. She produces dairy food -- cheese, curds and yogurt -- and sells it in Tbilisi (capital of Georgia). Total average monthly income of the family is 900 Lari.

Nani requested a loan to purchase hay to feed the cows during the fall and winter seasons. Hay is cheap now, but the price increases by 30% to 40% in the fall months. Nani can significantly save on the costs of feeding the cows. Since the cows will be fed properly in winter, they will give a planned amount of milk to the family. The income of the family will increase accordingly. Thus, Nani will be able to increase her agricultural business and improve living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase hay to feed her cattle while it's cheap.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is lives in Panglao, Bohol, Philippines. She is in the fishing business since her husband is a fisherman. They've been in the fishing business for some time now.  Victoria gives her best to help and support her husband in their needs. 

Victoria is requesting a loan to buy new fishing nets and fish hooks for her husband. This would be a great help in increasing his catch.
 
Victoria dreams of nothing but to expand their business and earn more for the family. She also wants to give her children a better education.  This loan would be a great help in making her dreams real.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and fish hooks and increase the catch.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of sorghum to make local drinks for resale.

loans.name: Alodia

texts.en:
Alodia is a 32 year old married woman and a mother of two young children ages 8 and one years old. She is in the fishing business since her husband is a fisherman.
They sell their catch to the people in their place. The business provides them the income that they need for their daily expenses.
Alodia is applying for a loan from CEVI to buy new fishing nets to replace the worn out ones. With it, her husband will have a better chance of increasing his daily catch.
Alodia hopes to improve their livelihood in order to give their children a better future.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a large quantities of meat for resale.

loans.name: Teofana

texts.en:
Teofana is a 36 year old married woman and a mother of three young children ages 15, 11 and nine years old. They live in the town of Panglao, Bohol, Philippines. Her husband is a fisherman.
Teofana and her husband are in the fishing business for some time now. This is the source of their income which they used for their daily needs such as food and for the education of their children. 
Teofana is requesting a loan to buy new fishing nets for her husband. They sell the catch to the people in their community. With the loan, they will be able to improve the quantity of their catch and profit.
Teofana wants to improve her business so that she will be financially capable of sending her children to school for better learning. Any additional income will be used for reinvestment of the same business and for savings.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a large quantities of beans for resale.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a 51-year-old married woman with five children from Panglao, Bohol, Philippines. Delia is in a hog raising business for two years now. 
Delia works hard to support her husband in meeting the needs of the family especially for the education of their children. She takes every opportunity to earn a living.
As of this time, Delia lacks the financial resources to improve her hog raising business. She is requesting a loan to buy feed for the pigs and additional piglets to raise. 
Delia dreamed of expanding her venture to generate more income so that she will be able to continually send her children to school for better learning and education. Moreover, she wanted to let her family experience fullness of life. Any additional revenue will be used for reinvestment of the same business and for savings.

loans.use: to buy feed for the pigs

loans.name: Mauro

texts.es: El socio Mauro nació en el departamento de Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, él tiene 52 años de edad y es casado y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene cuatro hijos, él pertenece al banco comunal “Los Comerciantes De Virgen Asunta” y le va muy bien gracias a los pagos puntuales de sus cuotas, él se dedica a la venta de pasamanería de forma ambulatoria. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Mauro requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo jaboncillos, relojes, pinzas, pasadores, peinetas encajes, flecos, galones y otras cosas más.  El socio agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en: Communal bank member Mauro was born in the department of Cusco and he lives in the same city in which he was born.  He is 52 years old, married, and he has four children from his beautiful relationship.  He belongs to the Los Comerciantes de Virgen Asunta Communal Bank and it has been going very well for him thanks to his punctual payments.  He is a street vendor who sells personal accessories for a living.  He has had his business for many years now and it is going very well for him.  Mauro currently needs a loan to buy merchandise, such as small soaps, watches, tweezers, bobby pins, decorative combs, fringes, shoulder patches, and other things.  He is thankful for the loan and promises to make his payments on time.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, such as small soaps, watches, tweezers, bobby pins, decorative combs, fringes, shoulders patches, and other things.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia, a 63-year-old married mother of two grown children from Loboc, Bohol, Philippines, has operated a hog-raising business for more than five years now. The enterprise provides her with the income that she needs to help in supporting her family.

Aurelia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services the organization offers and is now requesting a loan to buy pig feed and additional piglets to raise. She hopes to make her business more profitable and lucrative in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Efigenia

texts.en:
Efigenia, a merchant, has owned a small grocery store for more than 15 years now. She lives in Panglao, Bohol, Philippines, with her nine grown children. 

Her business consists of selling food and personal products rice, sugar, oil, beans, soda, and other snack foods. The business is the source of her daily income. 

Efigenia needs to make further investments in her store, but she lacks the funds to do so.  She is requesting a loan to buy additional items or merchandise to sell, like rice, sugar, canned goods, sodas, and other snack foods. With the loan, Efigenia will be able to augment her stocks to attract more customers, thus giving her the chance of increasing her sales.

Efigenia hopes to make her business grow and become more sustainable.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, like rice, sugar, canned goods, sodas, and other snack foods.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is a 51-year-old married woman from Loboc, Bohol, Philippines. She has been raising hogs for years now. 

Rita works hard to earn a living through hog raising. This business provides her the income she needs for her family's expenses. 

Rita is asking for a loan from CEVI to buy feed for the pigs she is raising. She also wants to buy additional piglets to raise. 

She believes that if she is provided support through loans, she will be able to improve her business to generate more revenue. 

Rita dreams of seeing her family experiencing the fullness of life.

loans.use: to buy feed and additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Ofelia Maribel

texts.es:
Ofelia, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para poder continuar en la venta de jugos y refrescos, se comprara un pedido de jugos de diferentes sabores, tambien frutos para elaborar jugos naturales, agua en bolsa, gaseosas y refrescos naturales, para poder invertir y aumentar su pequeño negocio.

Ella manifiesta que con estos préstamos está logrando mantener el negocio con un nivel adecuado de su inventario y ha logrado también ayudar a su familia de las ganancias que le quedan por sus ventas.
texts.en:
Ofelia is requesting a new loan so that she can continue selling juices and soft drinks. She will buy an order of juices in different flavors, as well as fruits for making natural juices. Ofelia will also buy bags of water, sodas, and natural soft drinks so that she can increase and invest in her small business.

She says that these loans have helped to maintain her business with an adequate level of inventory. The earnings generated from her sales have also helped her family.

loans.use: to buy juices, water, sodas, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Gulsun

texts.ru: Гульсун  49 летняя женщина, мать четверых детей, муж работает по сбору урожая риса. Она сама работает контролёром в водоканале. Она имеет маленький доход, но их семейное дехканское дело даёт хороший доход, с помощью которого она без проблем погашает займ. По словам Гульсун можно убедится, что прежние её кредиты помогли  решить некоторые   семейные проблемы как учеба детей,покупка бытовой техники.Теперь же она на полученный кредит планирует отремонтировать свой дом так как дом нуждается в обновлении.Гульсун хочет улучшить свои условия проживания и заранее благодарит за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Gulsun is 49-year-old married mother of four children. Her husband has a job harvesting rice and she works as a water canal controller. They can't boast of high salaries but their "dekhan" farm business is able to efficiently supplement their income and allows them to pay back their debts. With the aid of some previous loans Gulsun was able to solve some family issues, like their children's education and buying various household appliances. 

Currently, her house is in need of some repairs and she's asking for a loan in order to fix it up. She wishes to improve her housing conditions and thanks you in advance for your generosity and financial assistance.

loans.use: to conduct some home repairs.

loans.name: Nazia's Group

texts.en:
Nazia, who has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah, will utilize the loan for her husband’s screen printing business. With the loan investment her husband will buy printing screens and will also repair his printing machine. This will help him fulfill client orders on time and improve his work quality. He has been operating his business for many years and Nazia is very confident that after investing the loan, his business will get more profitable.

Nazia is a housewife, remaining at home and doing her household responsibilities. She has given birth to a daughter and two sons. All of them are enrolled in a nearby school and getting their education.

Nazia wants to provide her children good quality education and she is confident that she will be able to do so once her husband’s business gets improved.

loans.use: To buy screens and repair printing machine for screen printing business

loans.name: Paciana

texts.en:
Paciana is a 48-year-old woman from Bohol, Philippines. She has six children and her husband is a farmer. Paciana has been in the hog raising business for years now. 

Paciana wants to improve her business but she needs funds to do so. She is requesting a loan to buy feed for the hogs. Paciana also wants to buy additional piglets to raise. 

With the loan, Paciana will finally be able to make plans for expanding her business. 

Paciana hopes to see her family live a bountiful life. And she believes that this would be possible if she will be provided with financial support through loans. 

Any additional revenue will be used to finance the family's daily consumption and the educational expenses of her children.

loans.use: to buy feed for the hogs

loans.name: Rosaly

texts.en:
Rosaly lives in Bohol, Philippines together with her husband and two young children. She has been in the business of hog raising for ten years now. 

Rosaly does her best to earn a living in order to provide support for the needs of the family. Her business provides her the income that she needs. 

Rosaly wants to expand her business to generate more income but she needs funds to do so. She is requesting a loan to buy feed for the hogs that she is raising. With the loan, Rosaly will be able to make her business sustainable and productive. 

Rosaly wants to earn more so that she will have the financial capacity to send her children to school. She believes that education is important for a bright future.

loans.use: to buy feed for her hogs

loans.name: Cate

texts.en:
Cate is married with four children, three of whom go to school. She takes care of her old mother. She has a business of selling fish and bananas. 

She has applied for a loan of 600,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more baskets of fish and bunches of bananas. She has been in this business for 10 years. She generates additional income through rental rooms. She sells to all categories of people both on retail and wholesale. She works six days a week. Her major business challenges include transport and thieves. She  aspires to see her business grow big so that she only sells on wholesale and also to educate her children up to the university level. 

She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school and paying for utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas and baskets of fish

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mom is aged 46 and married. She lives in a rural area located in the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She has four children. Two of her sons depend on her and are in school. 

Mom and her husband have been involved in bean and corn planting to earn a living for two years. The current business earns them about KHR 30,800 per day to meet the family’s need and she can manage to save about KHR 4,900 per day.

This is the second loan for Mom with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. The past loan has helped her with a better living. She is requesting a loan of KHR 1,200,000 and she will use this loan to buy fertilizer and to plow the farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to make more income from her current business so as to achieve a standard lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to plow the farmland.

loans.name: Teimuraz

texts.en:
Teimuraz is 32 years old. He lives in a small village in the Martvili District with his family – a father, who is a pensioner, and a sister. The family runs an agricultural business. They produce cheese, and they also own a plot of land where nuts are grown. They sell cheese and nuts on the local open market. Teimuraz purchases grapes and sugar in the fall and produces wine. He sells wine in nearby villages. Along with the agricultural business, Teimuraz’s sister works as a cleaner and gets a service fee for the work. The family’s total average monthly income is 650 GEL.
Teimuraz requested a loan to purchase agricultural products to sell. He has a minibus, and he plans to sell seasonal agricultural products from his minibus in nearby villages. He thinks that it will be a profitable business. As a result of this Kiva loan, the family’s income will increase, which will enable them to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural products to sell.

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en: Teopista is married with four children, all of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (mother). She has a business of selling charcoal and sells to all categories of people at retail. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. She generates additional income through selling used clothes at her home. She works six days a week. Her monthly expenses include school fees, feeing the family and paying for electricity bills. Her major business challenges include transportation and thieves. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity but not piped water.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more household items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more beverages for selling such as tea bags etc

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is a 37-year-old married man. He has a son who is three years old. He describes himself to be an honest and aggressive man. He operates a taxi and retail shop where he sells household items and provides transportation services. He has been involved in this business for three years and employs two staff members. His business is located within a viable area with potential clients and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be frequent city council harassment. He will use the 12,000 Kenyan Shilling (KES) loan to buy household items for the retail shop. His business goal is to be a wholesaler within five years.
