Deidy tiene 48 años, es una mujer amable, buena y trabajadora. Junto a su pareja tiene tres hijos de 20, 14 y 13 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Actualmente vive junto a su familia en la casa de su madre, donde también viven sus tres hermanos. 

Su trabajo consiste, principalmente, en la venta de comida, considera que tiene un negocio muy rentable desde su casa, ya que afirma que siempre tiene clientes que acuden a ella fielmente para deleitarse con su exquisita sazón. Su especialidad es la comida rápida regional, ya sean “tamales” o “humitas” elaborados principalmente con maíz y carne, acompaña sus potajes con deliciosas bebidas de frutas o gaseosas. Lleva realizando este trabajo por 2 años, desde las 3 de la tarde, hasta las 10 de la noche. Recibe, generalmente, la ayuda de su hija de 13 años y su actividad le permite generar buenos ingresos a su hogar. Adicionalmente, durante el día, vende frutas de la región, mientras comparte su faena en la preparación de la comida que pondrá a la venta. Le gusta mucho lo que hace, ya que siempre le ha fascinado la cocina. Fue muy complicado poder establecer su negocio, ya que antiguamente vendía golosinas caminando por las calles, pero no le generaba buenas ganancias, a pesar de ello nunca se rindió y hoy tiene muchos planes con su actual negocio.

Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, por tanto espera continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, se compromete a seguir siendo una socia puntual y cumplida como en los créditos anteriores. Además desea seguir trabajando con los socios de su banco comunal, ya que todos son muy amables y solidarios.

Con el  monto solicitado, 1500 nuevos soles, comprará maíz por kilos, carne de pollo y cerdo, aceite por litros, maní, aceitunas y condimentos para continuar con la preparación de sus potajes; también renovará algunos de sus utensilios, haciendo un total de 500 nuevos soles. Invertirá otros 500 en comprar frutas por sacos y con el monto restante comprará gaseosas y cervezas.
texts.en:
Deidy is 48 years old and a kind, good, and hard-working woman. With her partner they have three children of 20, 14, and 14 years of age to whom she desires to give a better quality of life. Currently she lives with her family in her mother's home where her three siblings also live.

Her work mainly consists of selling food. She considers herself to have a very profitable business from her home since she affirms that she always has customers that faithfully come to her to take delight in her food's delicious flavors. Her specialty is regional fast food, whether it be "tamales" or "humitas" made mainly with corn and meat, accompanied by her stews with delicious fruit drinks or soft drinks. She has been doing this job for two years, from three in the afternoon until ten at night. She generally receives help from her 13-year-old daughter and her work allows her to generate good earnings for her home. Additionally, during the day she sells fruit from the region while she shares her work preparing the food that she will sell. She likes what she does a lot as cooking has always fascinated her. It was very complicated for her to be able to establish her business since in the past she used to walk through the streets selling sweets. However, this didn't generate good earnings for her. Despite this she never gave up and nowadays has many plans for her current business.

This is her third loan with MFP. Therefore she hopes to continue with her objectives. On the other hand she commits herself to continue being a punctual member as with her previous loans. Moreover, she desires to continue working with the members of her communal bank since all of them are kind and supportive.

With the requested total of 1500 nuevos soles she will buy corn by the kilogram, chicken and pig meat, oil by the liter, peanuts, olives, and sauces in order to continue with the making of her stews. Also, she will update some of her utensils, making a total of 500 nuevos soles. She will invest another 500 in buying fruit by the sack, and with the total that's left she will buy soft drinks and beer.

loans.use: to buy the ingredients she needs for her meals and some drinks, to update her utensils, and to buy the fruit that she sells in the morning.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Salvador De Jesus

texts.es: El Sr. Salvador de 32 años de edad es casado y tiene 4 hijos que dependen de él económicamente. El trabaja en un puesto de tacos y gorditas y su esposa es ama de casa juntos se han siempre esforzado por sacar adelante a su familia siendo siempre un ejemplo para sus hijos de superación y esfuerzo, el quiere brindarle a sus hijos y esposa un mejor futuro económico es por eso que en esta ocasión pide de nuestra ayuda para compra de materia prima e instalación ya que el quiere iniciar su propio negocio de comida.  Agradecería la ayuda que se pueda brindar.
texts.en: Señor Salvador is 32 years old. He is married and has four children who depend on him economically. He works at a taco and gordita stand, and his wife is a housewife. Together they have always striven to raise their family, always being an example for their children of effort and overcoming. He wants to offer his children and wife a better economic future. It is for this reason that he is now asking for our help to buy basic ingredients and pay for setup, since he wants to begin his own food business. He will be grateful for the help that can be offered.

loans.use: to pay for basic ingredients and setup expenses for his business.

loans.name: Cristina Alicia

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  es la señora Cristina, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los Lideres” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. Nuestra socia se sigue dedicando a la elaboración y  comercialización de muebles para el hogar y la oficina. Cristina en esta oportunidad invertirá el préstamo solicitado comprar material como madera prensada para la elaboración de sus muebles.
Cristina está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y ayudarla a mantener y desarrollarse en sus actividades económicas.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Cristina is a member of communal bank "Los Lideres" (The Leaders) located in Cusco, Peru.  She continues to make a living in the creation and sale of home and office furniture.  In this instance, Cristina will invest the loan to purchase material such as plywood to build furniture.  

Cristina is very grateful to Kiva for allowing her to provide a better quality of life for her family and helping her maintain and develop her trade.  She is grateful for this loan and promises to repay in accordance with the loan agreement.

loans.use: to purchase plywood

loans.name: Zenda

texts.en:
Zenda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a flower shop business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 10,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy floral supplies, tools and equipment for her flower shop business.

Zenda has been in this business for 23 years. Zenda earns more income from selling personal products.

Zenda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy floral supplies, tools and equipment.

loans.name: Argentina

texts.en:
Argentina is married with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Argentina is 32 years old and has four children who are in school.

Argentina has an abaca (fiber) weaving business in the Philippines. Argentina requested a 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan amount through NWTF to buy materials for her abaca weaving business.

Argentina has been in this business for two years. In the future, Argentina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials for her abaca (fiber) weaving.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  es la señora Luisa, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los Lideres” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. Nuestra socia se sigue dedicando a la venta de productos de belleza como perfumes y maquillajes, actividad que viene realizando hace mucho tiempo y con la cual saca adelante a su familia. Luisa en esta oportunidad invertirá el préstamo solicitado para comprar productos de belleza y cumplir con las solicitudes de sus clientes, que son mujeres en su mayoría.
Luisa está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y por ayudarla con el crecimiento y fortalecimiento de sus actividades.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Luisa is a member of the communal bank "Los Lideres" (the leaders) in Cusco, Peru.  She continues to make a living selling beauty products such as perfume and makeup which she has been doing for a long time and with which she supports her family.  In this instance, Luisa will invest the loan to purchase beauty products to fulfill customer requests which are mostly women.  

Luisa is very grateful to Kiva for allowing her the opportunity to give her family a better quality of life and for helping her grow and strengthen her business.   She appreciates this loan and promises to repay the loan in accordance with the loan agreement.

loans.use: to purchase women's perfume and makeup.

loans.name: Abraham

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de comida,el socio hace desayunos,almuerzos y cenas,el socio da pension familiar,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,elsueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de venta de comida.El socio solicita el credito para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz,verduras,pollo y carne.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This communal bank member continues to work in his food business. He makes breakfasts, lunches, and dinners. He has a boarding house. He works from 8:00 am until 6:00 pm. His dream is to expand his business of selling food. He is applying for the loan to buy products for cooking, such as rice, vegetables, chicken, and meat.

This communal bank member is happy because of the loan and promises to make his payments.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients such as rice, vegetables, chicken, and meat

loans.name: Jannet

texts.es:
Jannet tiene 27 años, es una mujer amable, buena y muy trabajadora. Su pareja desde hace 7 años es Denis, con quien tiene dos hijos, uno de 4 años y un pequeño bebé de tan solo un mes. Viven en la casa de los padres de su pareja, donde también están sus cuñados. Ella desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos en base a mucho esfuerzo y trabajo.

Su trabajo es la venta de bebidas (gaseosas y cervezas). Su zona es muy calurosa, por eso la demanda y el consumo de bebidas heladas es mayor, ella aprovecha muy bien esta oportunidad implementando su negocio con una gran variedad de marcas de bebidas para que sus clientes tengan más opciones qué escoger. Vende sus gaseosas a cualquier persona, pero las cervezas sólo a mayores de edad, pues es consciente que tiene que ser muy responsable con este tipo de consumo. Lleva realizando este trabajo por 4 años y lo hace sola, cuando se inició no le iba tan bien, ya que tenía que atraer clientes, pero con el tiempo, gracias a los buenos precios y al trato especial que brinda supo ganarse la preferencia de su público y ahora es muy visitada. Vende muy bien, su promedio de venta es de 15 cajas de cerveza y 10 cajas de gaseosa a la semana.

Este es su crédito número 5 con MFP y está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, ya que así se siente más segura de avanzar con su trabajo. Por su parte, se compromete, una vez más, a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas, así como lo hizo en sus créditos anteriores. Y está muy feliz de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus integrantes son muy amables y solidarios.

Con el monto solicitado, de 1000 nuevos soles, comprará más cajas de cerveza y gaseosas para estar preparada para la temporada de verano. Cada caja de cerveza cuesta entre 35 a 40 nuevos soles y la caja de gaseosa cuesta entre 10 a 15 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Janet is 27 years old. She is a friendly, good, and hardworking person. Her partner for the past 7 years is Denis, with whom she has two children who are 4 years old and a new baby that is just one month old. They live in Denis’ parent’s house, where his siblings live too. She wants to give the best quality of life to her children, based on effort and hard work.

Her work is sales of drinks (soft drinks and beers). The area where she lives is very hot, so that is why there is a lot of demand for and consumption of cold drinks. She takes advantage of this opportunity by stocking her business with a large variety of brands of drinks so that her customers have more options to choose from. She sells her soft drinks to anyone, but she only sells the beers to people of legal age. She is conscious of the fact that she has to be very responsible with this type of consumption. She has been doing this work for 4 years and she does it by herself. When she started out, things didn’t go so well because she needed to attract customers. However, over time, thanks to her good prices and good customer service, she was able to gain the preference of her customers and now her business is very frequented. Her sales are very good. Her average sales are 15 cases of beer and 10 cases of soft drinks per week.

This is her 5th loan with Microfinanzas Prisma and she is very happy to know that she has financial support because this helps her to feel more secure in advancing in her work. She pledges, once again, to make her repayments punctually, as she did with her previous loans. She is happy to belong to her communal bank because all of the members are very friendly and mutually supportive. 

With the requested amount of PEN 1,000.00 (nuevos soles), she will buy more cases of beer and soft drinks so she can be prepared for the summer season. Each case of beer costs between PEN 35.00 and 40.00 (nuevos soles) and a case of soft drinks costs between PEN 10.00 and 15.00 (nuevos soles).

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and beer to stock her business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Reina Patricia

texts.es: Reina vive en el sector sur de Guayaquil conocido como Isla Trinitaria, su casa está ubicada en la zona regenerada por lo que cuenta con los servicios de agua, luz, alcantarillado y camino pavimentado. Está separada de su esposo pero le ayuda con la mantención, tiene dos hijos los cuales asisten a la escuela fiscal. En su casa ella tiene una tienda de víveres muy surtida la cual es su sustento ya que no puede trabajar en una empresa porque cuida de sus hijos. el negocio lo empezó hace 8 años cuando en el sector no había tiendas por lo que tiene muchos clientes quienes la conocen desde hace tiempo. La atención la realiza sola así como el trato con los proveedores, el estar en zona regenerada la ha ayudado a minorar sus gastos ya que los proveedores le dejan los productos en su tienda sin tener que pagar valores adicionales por el transporte. Para Reina una de sus mayores preocupaciones es la delincuencia porque su sector si es peligroso y es por este motivo por lo que cierra a las 7 de noche. Con el crédito comprar panes, arroz, azúcar, atún, harina, aceites, productos para el hogar etc. una de las metas que se ha impuesto a futuro es poder arreglar la segunda planta de su domicilio.
texts.en:
Reina lives in the neighborhood of Guayaquil known as Isla Trinitaria. Her house is located in the renovated area, so she has the basic services of running water, electricity, sewer, and paved roads. She is separated from her husband but he helps out economically. She has two children who attend the local school. 

In her house she has a small grocery store that is very well stocked, and it is her source of income since she can’t work at a business because she takes care of her two children. She started the business 8 years ago when there weren’t any stores in the neighborhood, which is why she has many customers who have known her for a long time. She tends to her store by herself, and she also deals with suppliers herself. Living in a renovated area has helped her minimize her costs, since the suppliers will deliver products to her store without charging extra transport fees. For Reina, one of her biggest worries is crime because her neighborhood is dangerous, and this is why she closes at 7:00 at night. 

With the loan, she will buy bread, rice, sugar, tuna, flour, cooking oils, and products for the home, etc. One of her goals for the future is to build a second floor onto her house.

loans.use: to buy bread, rice sugar, tuna, etc.

loans.name: Bonifacia

texts.en:
Bonifacia works hard to support her family. She is married and has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines.

Bonifacia requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for her abaca weaving.

She has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future, Bonifacia would like to save money to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her abaca weaving.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.en:
Agustina is 58 years old and married with four children.

Agustina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more grocery products like snacks, sardines, soft drinks and beverages.

Agustina has borrowed and repaid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Agustina aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery products like snacks, sardines, soft drinks and beverages.

loans.name: Saturnino

texts.en: Saturnino, 46 years old, is a married entrepreneur of Panduma, Tukuran with 4 children and is earning money from his transport service business. It has continued for almost 8 years now and he earns 3,000 PHP a month. To improve business, he is borrowing the amount of 4,000 PHP from GDMPC micro credit which he just joined recently to obtain accessories and tires. Before long, Saturnino’s hopeful of the possibility of expanding his business.

loans.use: to obtain accessories and tires.

loans.name: Gracemary

texts.en:
This is 53-year-old Gracemary.  She is married and has two children aged 10 years old and 14 years old.   In 1999, Gracemary established her pharmacy business. She began her business just after she graduated from  school of Nursing as a trained and qualified Nurse . Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. 

Gracemary requires a loan in order to buy pharmaceutical drugs costing le 3,000,000. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 700,000. In the future, Gracemary plans to open another pharmacy and deploy her brother there. Honest and hardworking, she thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy pharmaceutical drugs costing le 3,000,000.

loans.name: Florinda

texts.es:
Florinda tiene 48 años, es una mujer con mucha experiencia en los negocios, además de ser alegre y amable. Está separada del padre de sus hijos. Actualmente vive con sus dos hijos; Darwin de 17 años y Lety de 26, y un sobrino.

Ella se dedica a la cosmetología hace más de 20 años. Tiene un salón de belleza en un local que alquilado, donde brinda diversos servicios como corte y tinte de cabello, ondulación, pedicura, manicura y otros. Ahora cuenta con tres personas que la ayudan y les paga diariamente. Considera que su negocio es bastante rentable por las ganancias que le deja, las que usa para pagar los gastos de su hogar y dar una buena educación a sus hijos, además que le gusta socializar y hacer nuevas amistades. Antes de iniciar esta actividad tenía muchos problemas económicos, pues tenía que criar sola a sus hijos.

Este es su préstamo número 7 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera continuar con sus objetivos. Además se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, como en los créditos anteriores. Y por otro lado, comenta sentirse tranquila y cómoda con su banco comunal, pues conoce a sus miembros y los considera buenas personas y responsables.
Con el monto solicitado, de 800 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de artículos para la mejora de su local, como un espejo, tijeras, tintes y además productos de belleza. De esa manera podrá seguir brindando un buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Florinda is 48, and a woman with a great deal of experience in business, besides being cheerful and friendly. She is separated from the father of her children. Currently she lives with her nephew and her two children: Darwin, 17 and Lety, 26. 

She has been a cosmetologist for more than 20 years. She has a beauty salon in a shop she has rented, where she provides various services, such as haircuts and hair coloring, waves, manicures and others. Now she has three people who help her, whom she pays on a daily basis. She considers that her business is quite profitable because of the earnings it provides. She uses these to pay her household expenses and to give her children a good education.

Besides, she likes to socialize and make new friends. Before starting this business she had many financial problems, as she had to raise her children on her own. 

This is her seventh loan with the MFP institution, so she hopes to continue toward her objectives. In addition, she promises to be on time with her installment payments, as with her previous loans. 

Moreover, she says she is happy and comfortable with her communal bank, as she knows the members and considers them good, responsible people.  

With the requested amount of 800 nuevos soles, she will purchase items for improving her shop, such as a mirror, scissors, hair coloring, and other beauty products. That way she will be able to continue offering good service to her customers.

loans.use: To buy a mirror, scissors, hair coloring and other beauty products.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Clemencia

texts.en: Clemencia is from San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 56 years old, married, and has two children. Clemencia prepares and sells cooked food for daily meals for a living. She's been in business for 21 years and earns 10,000 PHP each month. In 2010, Clemencia joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 63 years old and lives in the town of Fort Portal in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. He is married and has five children with one of them currently in school. For the past fifteen years, John has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand his business, John has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities like milk, bread, sugar, and soap for resale, and will help John to generate greater profits and add more profits to attract customers. 

John hopes that in the future he will be able to own a big shop and get more profits. 

John is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like John who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities like milk, bread, sugar, and soap for resale.

loans.name: Charlse

texts.en:
Charlse is 32 years old and lives in the town of Kititale in the Kampala south region of Uganda. He is married and has 4 children with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 4 years, Charlse has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand his business, Charlse has requested a loan of 2000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities like cooking oil, rice and salt for resale, and will help Charlse to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Charlse hopes that in the future he will be able to expand business into whole sale. 

Charlse is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Charlse who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities like cooking oil, rice and salt for resale,

loans.name: Frances

texts.en:
Frances is 40 years old and married with four children, two of whom are currently in school. She lives in the town of Kasangati in the Kampala East region of Uganda. For the past five years, Frances has been working hard to manage her retail shop which sells essential commodities like sugar. 

Frances is requesting a 2,000,000 UGX loan from BRAC Uganda to purchase for more essential commodities like maize flour, beans, cooking oil and sugar for resale. and help her to generate greater profits. In the future, she hopes to expand her business into a whole sale shop with the goal of reducing poverty. Frances is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  This program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Frances who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro loans.

loans.use: to purchase for more essential commodities like maize flour, beans, cooking oil and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
This is 50-year-old Kadiatu from Waterloo in the eastern area of Freetown, Sierra Leone. She is married with six children between the ages of 11 and 30 years old. She began her business because her husband is an old man. She wanted to generate income to support her family.

Aminata runs a general merchandise store within a busy market. She sells rice, Maggie,onions,and palm oil. She has been running this business for 25 years. She works at the business 7 days per week and 12 hours a day. She says that the main challenges to her business are the high rate of theft and the poor road network.

Aminata has requested a loan in order to buy more rice, Maggi, onions and palm oil. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and have a shop structure of her own. In the future, she plans to build her house and increase her business. She appreciates your support.

video.title: Kiva Borrower Kadiatu from Sierra Leone

loans.use: To buy more rice, Maggi, onions and palm oil.

loans.name: Justiniano

texts.es:
Justiniano tiene 55 años, es un hombre bueno, amable y muy trabajador. No tiene ninguna relación conyugal, pero tiene dos hijas de 15 y 14 años. Junto a ellas vive en la casa de su hermana, en compañía también de sus sobrinos.

Su trabajo es la fabricación de muebles para el hogar y la construcción de casas. Trabaja en un taller de carpintería de un amigo, al que acude todos los días, desde muy temprano, para empezar con su faena. Mientras que el trabajo de construcción de viviendas lo realiza solo de manera eventual, cuando sus familiares, vecinos o cualquier cliente ocasional solicite su mano de obra; para ello trabaja con dos personas cuando necesita ayuda. Lleva en esta actividad (la carpintería) 20 años y la seguridad económica que este trabajo le ha brindado ha hecho que su familia pueda contar con los servicios básicos en su hogar. Le gusta mucho plasmar su creatividad en los muebles y accesorios que crea con sumo cuidado, teniendo siempre en cuenta que la calidad de los mismos es el principal requisito que demandan sus clientes; sin embargo, este trabajo le exige ocupar gran parte de su tiempo durante el día, lo que le impide disfrutar de su familia como realmente lo desearía. A pesar de esta dificultad, nunca ha pensado en dar marcha atrás y lo que ahora quiere es tener su propia carpintería, ya que ha venido postergando este sueño y ahora espera concretarlo.

Este es su crédito número 5 con MFP y está muy contento de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, pues así se siente más seguro de progresar con su trabajo. Se compromete, una vez más, a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como lo hizo en los anteriores créditos que tuvo. Del mismo modo, se siente aliviado de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus integrantes son muy responsables y solidarios.

Con el monto solicitado, de 1000 nuevos soles, comprará algunas herramientas que necesita para iniciar su taller de carpintería como cepillo de madera, galopa, serrucho y martillo.
texts.en:
Justiniano is 55 years old. He is a good, friendly, and very hardworking person. He is not married, but he has two daughters who are 15 and 14 years old. He lives together with them in his sister’s house, where his nieces and nephews also live. 

His work is making furniture for the home and building houses. He works in the carpentry shop of a friend, where he goes to work every day. He begins his workday very early in the morning. He builds houses on his own, from time to time, when a family member, neighbors, or any occasional client requests services. He works with two additional people when he needs help. He has been doing this work (carpentry) for 20 years and the economic stability that this job has provided has allowed his family to have basic utilities in their house. He likes to express his creativity in the furniture and accessories he makes with the utmost care. He always has in mind that fact that quality is the highest demand of his customers. However, this work requires most of his time during the day, which prevents him from enjoying time with his family as much as he would like. Despite this difficulty, he has never regretted it, and now what he wants is to have his own carpentry workshop. He has been putting off this dream for a long time and now he is hoping to make it into reality.

This is his 5th loan with Microfinanzas Prisma and he is very happy to know that he has financial support because this makes him feel more confident in making progress with his work. He pledges, once again, to make his repayments, as he did with the previous loans he’s had. He also feels glad to belong to a communal bank because all of the members are very responsible and mutually supportive. 

With the requested amount, PEN 1,000.00 (nuevos soles) he will buy some tools that he needs to start this carpentry workshop, such as planes, hand saws, and hammers.

loans.use: to buy some tools to start his own carpentry workshop

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Abavandimwe Group

texts.fr:
Aziza  fait partie du groupe  Abavandimwe  et  habite à Bujumbura. Elle a  33 ans et est mariée à  Ciza, un réparateur des radios. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants, âgés de  4  à 13 ans, tous étudient.
Elle prend soin de sa mère.

Elle fait le commerce de petits sacs en plastiques depuis  4ans. 

Elle est à son huitième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de  petits sacs en plastique,  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait    acheter sa propre parcelle, y construire une maison. En plus elle voudrait voir ses  enfants arriver à l’université.
texts.en:
Aziza is a member of the Abavandimwe group and lives in Bujumbura. She is 33 ans and is married to Ciza, a radio repairman. They have 4 children between the ages of 4 and 13, all of whom attend school.

She takes care of her mother.

She has been selling small plastic bags for 4 years.

This is her 8th loan with Turame. With this KIVA loan, she will increase her working capital and will buy lots of small plastic bags which she will resell in order to earn more.

In the coming years, she would like to buy her own plot and have a house built on it. She would like to see her children make it to university.

loans.use: to increase her working capital and buy lots of small plastic bags which she will resell in order to earn more.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 24 years old.  He is married and has one child.

He runs a video shop where he provides a place for people to watch them.  He has employed one person.  In addition, he operates a mobile phone-based money transfer business (M-Pesa) to earn extra income. Since he became a client of Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to expand his business because he has received training on business management. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES in order to buy seats for his video shop.

loans.use: to buy seats for his video shop.

loans.name: Earnest

texts.en: Earnest is 40 years old and has three children. He operates a retail shop and also offers mobile phone-money transfer (M-pesa) services in the same shop. He has been in this business for two years. In addition, he sells spare parts to earn extra income. He previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya, which has helped him grow his business. He hopes to have another outlet in a different location and to own a piece of land in the future. He needs a loan of 20,000 KES to boost cash flow in his mobile phone money transfer business.

loans.use: to boost cashflow in his mobile phone money transfer business

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is 36 years old, married and with three children. He does electronic repairs to earn a living. He has been in the business for seven years and has one employee. Also, he generates extra income from his rental houses and sells fish. He had acquired several loans from Faulu Kenya, which helped him expand his business. He hopes to enlarge his business in five years. He needs a loan of 100,000 KES to buy electronic spare parts.

loans.use: To buy electronic spare parts

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is 39 years old, married, and the father of four children, who are in school. He is a dairy farmer. He practices farming in a productive environment and has readily available customers. Through Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to plan and budget for his money because he has been trained on financial management.  He dreams of buying a pick-up  for easy transportation of his products in the future. He needs a loan of 70,000 KES to buy two dairy cows.

loans.use: To buy two dairy cows

loans.name: Purity

texts.en: Purity practices dairy farming to earn a living. Through the loan that she previously acquired from Faulu Kenya, she was able to buy animal feeds for her livestock. She wants to become a milk wholesaler in the future. She needs a loan of KES 35,000 to buy animal feed.

loans.use: To buy animal feed for her dairy farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy items like, onions, oil, sugar, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Mary Lupai

texts.en:
Mary is a 35 yr old  businesswoman who lives in Juba.  She is married and has 4 children between the ages of 5 and 12. All of them go to school. 

Mary  runs a food store, and has been in business for 3 years.  She has no employees.  She heard about Finance Sudan through  promotions by their officers. She is requesting a loan of  2000 SDG to purchase tomatoes and other items for sale at her store. This store is her only source of income.

In 5 years, Mary  would like to open many branches of her store and expand her business.  Her  major challenges include high prices in the market. 

Mary  says she is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through Kiva.

loans.use: for buying tomatoes, onions, sweet bananas etc. for her food store.

loans.name: Joy Nyoka

texts.en:
Joy is a 42-year-old  businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has 6 children between the ages of 8 and 19, all of them go to school. Joy  runs a general store and has been in business for 6 years. She has no employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. She is taking a loan of 900 SDG to purchase maize, cassava and other items. This business is Joy's sole source of income.

In 5 years, Joy would like to open a depot. Her major challenges include high prices in the market. Joy says she is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through Kiva.

loans.use: for buying items like, cassava, maize etc

loans.name: Anderson

texts.en:
Anderson is 29 years old. He is married to Purity, and together they have one child who is three years old.
He owns a retail shop and also operates a motorcycle transport in the area.
He has been in this business for eleven years and earns a monthly income of 35,000 Kenyan shillings. The loan will be used to buy spare parts for his motorbike. The anticipated profits will be used to expand the retail shop.

This is his fifth loan from KADET LTD, and he successfully repaid his previous loans.  His hopes and dream are to buy more motorbikes.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his motor bike.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 40 years old business man. He is blessed with two children aged three and two years respectively. He runs a clothing business in Marigat town. He has been in the business for the last ten years. From this business he gets an average monthly income of KES. 30,000. 

Paul has borrowed his first loan of KES. 50,000 from KADET LTD, and he intends to use the loan to purchase different types of clothes for men and women as well as children.

His hopes and dreams are to expand his business in the future to other nearby towns and give his children the best education.

loans.use: To purchase different types of clothes for men and women as well as children

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru for the last six years. She is 32 years old, married, and a mother of two children.  

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and this is her second loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy farm inputs as well as pay for labor.

In the future, Teresia hopes to expand her farming skills and become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs as well as pay for labor

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael is 51 years old, married to Kiplagat and blessed with four children. She has been running a food cafe business for the past five years, earning a monthly income of KES. 10,000.

She has applied for her third loan of KES. 80,000 from KADET LTD  which she intends to use to purchase a deep freezer for storing perishable foods which are to be used in the cafeteria.

She intends to use the profits gained to reinvest and grow the business. Her future plans is to become a large scale outlet.

loans.use: to buy a deep freezer for storing perishable foods.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 29 years old and married. She runs a motorbike transport and also keeps security dogs. She has been in these businesses for eight years, earning a monthly income of sixty thousand shillings. 

This will be her first long with KADET LTD and she plans to purchase one domestic dog for security purposes. She plans to use the anticipated profit for diversifying the business. She hopes to complete a rental house in future.

loans.use: to purchase one security dog.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is 38 years old, married, and has been blessed with six children that he supports. He has been a wheat farmer for the last four years, getting a monthly income of KES 12,000. 

He is applying for his second loan of KES. 30,000 from KADET which he intends to  use to acquire farm inputs for better yields.


He plans to use the anticipated profits to increase his farm acreage. His future dream is to have a sustainable business.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Duncan

texts.en:
Duncan is a resident of Changamwe, Kenya.  Duncan is married and has one child in school. 

Duncan runs a retail shop that has been in operation for ten years. His business is located in the area normally visited by truck drivers linking two cities in Kenya.  He employs one person.  Besides this business, he also runs a video show and mobile-phone-charging and transport businesses.

Duncan was introduced to Milango by his friends.  He is applying for a loan of 83,500 Kenya shillings to purchase retail stocks, e.g., rice, sugar, and maize flour, for his shop.
 
The only challenge in the business has been the high cost of his stocks and the price fluctuations. He believes the business will grow, and he will soon have a chain of businesses.

loans.use: To purchase stocks, e.g., rice, sugar and maize flour, for his shop.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a single mother of three children and only one of her children goes to school. She also takes care of additional family members (cousins). She has applied for a loan of 800,000 Ugandan shillings to buy more bales of used clothes.

She has a business selling used men’s shirts and has been in this business for 10 years. She sells to all categories of people but on retail.  She generates additional income through rental rooms and works six days a week.  Her monthly expenses include seasonality and transportation of bales of clothes from Owino market to her stall in the market.

She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Esther‘s monthly expenses includes school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is married with five children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (mother and sister's children).

She has a business stall selling Irish potatoes and sweet potatoes. She has been in this business for ten years and sells to all categories of people but on retail. She has applied for a loan of 800,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of sweet potatoes and Irish potatoes. She doesn’t have any other income generating activity. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality.

She aspires to see her business grow so that she becomes a wholesaler and also to build rental rooms on her plot of land. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent, school fees and paying utility bills.

loans.use: to buy more bags of sweet potatoes and Irish potatoes

loans.name: Munga

texts.en:
Munga lives in the Changamwe area of Coast province. He is married and has six children, of whom three attend school. He owns a green grocer which he has now been operating for one year. Apart from this, he earns income through farming.

Munga learned about Milango through a friend with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. In his business, he faces the challenge of unfavorable weather conditions.

Munga is applying for a loan of 41,900 Kenyan shillings to purchase additional stock of groceries e.g. cabbages, kale, spinach, carrots, tomatoes, bananas, etc. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to expand the business. His future plan is to expand the business and become one of the biggest suppliers known.

loans.use: to buy more stock of groceries e.g. cabbage, spinach, carrots, tomatoes and bananas.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en: Annet is married with four children and none of her children goes to school. She doesn’t take care of additional income. She has a business of selling used clothes. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes and has been in this clothing business for 10 years. She moves door to door selling used clothes and at times works from her home. She sells both for retail and wholesale and works six days a week. Her monthly expenses includes  food and paying for electricity. Her major business challenges are transportation and the rainy season. She is aspiring to getting a permanent business premise and also to start selling wholesale only. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en: Rehema is married with five children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She has a business of poultry farming and has been in this business for five years. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDTSACCO to buy more bags of chicken feeds. Besides this poultry farming, she generates additional income through selling piped water. Rehema sells to all categories of people but on wholesale only and works seven days a week. Her major business challenges include thieves and poultry diseases. She is aspiring to own a chicken hatchery and also to build rental rooms. She resides in her own house and the family has no access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school and feeding the family

loans.use: to buy more bags of chicken feeds.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine lives Changamwe area of Coast province. She has four children who all attend school. She owns a tea-leaves business which has been operating for two years now. Besides this, Christine also runs a handicraft business.

She learnt about Milango through a friend with the aim of accessing credit to improve the operation of the business. The challenges she is facing are rent, debt and seasonal weather. Christine is applying for a loan of 41,900 Kenya shillings to buy bags of tea leaves and packaging packs. Her extra income from the loan will be added to savings to expand the business and pay school fees. Her future plan is to expand the business so that she can be a large-scale supplier.

loans.use: To buy bags of tea leaves and packaging packs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase retail stock in order to start a retail shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cereals

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is a 40-year-old single woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 4 to 10 years. She describes herself as a social and talkative woman. 

Pauline operates a beauty salon where she provides hair services. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located within a busy town and her primary customers are women. She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the KES 15,000 loan to pay for a permanent business premises. Her business goal is to run a well-stocked salon within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children with the profits she generates.

loans.use: to pay for a permanent business premises.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a 42 year old married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 5 years to 12 years. She describes herself as determined and focused woman. 

She operates a farm where she sells tomatoes, onions and kale. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located near a market and her primary customers are local residents. 

She describes her biggest business challenge as stiff competition within the area. She will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy fertilizers and seeds of tomatoes, onions and kales for sowing.  

Her business goal is to improve her business within five years. She hopes that, in the future, her business will have been successful.

loans.use: to buy farm products like fertilizer and seeds of tomatoes, onions and kales for sowing

loans.name: Amilcar

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al trabajo de fisioterapias,el hace fisioterapias a diferentes personas que lo requieren,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,el sueño del socio es ampliar su centro terapeutico.El socio solicita el credito para comprar instrumentos de fisoterapia.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member continues working in the field of physical therapy, offering services to the different people requiring his treatment.  He works from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. and dreams of expanding his therapeutic businessr.  He is requesting a loan to buy physical therapy instruments.

He is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy physical therapy instruments.

loans.name: New London Traders Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “New London” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Waterloo, a small town in Western Sierra Leone. Together, they have requested for a loan of 2,400,000.00 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL). With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve on their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Kadiatu.  Kadiatu is age 40; she was born in Bo district but she is currently residing in Waterloo, together with her husband and four children. Her husband is a businessman and her children are attending secondary school. For 12 years now, Kadiatu has been selling groundnuts (peanuts). With this loan, she will buy groundnuts at wholesale to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts at wholesale to add to her business

loans.name: Herrine

texts.en:
Herrine is taking out another loan to expand her existing business. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a retail shop in Mombasa, Kenya, and has requested a KES 50,000 loan through Kiva partner Yehu in order to buy more stock to sell. She plans to purchase stock of maize flour, beans, rice, and sugar.

Herrine has borrowed and paid two loans from Yehu before this loan. She has been running the retail shop for over five years.Thanks for the previous loans which have enabled her to increase her monthly income and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase stock of maize flour, beans, rice, and sugar.

loans.name: Tsuma

texts.en:
Tsuma is 50 years old and lives in the town of Kaloleni, in the coastal region of Kenya. He is married and has seven children, the oldest being 23 years and the youngest six months. For the past four years, Tsuma  has been working hard to manage his guest house business, which he owns.

To help expand his business, Tsuma has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenyan Shillings from from Yehu. The loan will be used to buy more bedding and furniture. This will help Tsuma to generate greater profits and improve his standard of living. He hopes that, in the future, he will be able to establish another guest house to increase his income.

loans.use: to buy more bedding and furniture for his guest house.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi used her previous Kiva loan to buy merchandise such as wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and salt to stock into her retail shop. She’s now applying for a Kiva loan to expand her range of retail items and once again stock her display case. With the remaining amount, she intends to purchase iron sheets, roofing nails and timber to put up her permanent house. 

Her message to Kiva lenders is the following: “I am very grateful for the opportunity you gave me to invest in my business; it’s something one wants you to be aware of and that you continue supporting us so that we can get far. I know that’s what I will accomplish.”

loans.use: to add stock of items in her shop, and buy iron sheets , nails, and timber.

loans.name: Washington

texts.es:
Nuestro socio  es el señor  Washington, él pertenece al banco comunal “Los Lideres” de la ciudad del Cusco - Perú, nuestro socio sigue dedicándose al transporte público urbano, por ello invertirá el préstamo solicitado para comprar llantas para su unidad vehicular y darle mantenimiento para dar un mejor servicio a sus pasajeros.
Washington está muy agradecido con KIVA por permitirle mantenerse en su actividad y por apoyarlo con su familia.
El socio agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
This member's name is Washington and he belongs to the communal bank "Los Lideres" in the city of Cusco - Perú.  He works in urban public transportation and plans to use the loan to buy tires for his vehicle, for maintenance purposes and to offer better customer service.

Washington is very grateful to KIVA for allowing him to keep his business running and supporting his family.  He is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy tires for his vehicle.

loans.name: Rito

texts.es: El Sr. Rito de 63 años es casado además de ser un gran esposo es un hermano ejemplar el  no tiene dependientes económicos solamente su esposa. Rito es chofer de camiones el cual se encarga de transportar personal o trabajadores de maquiladora en nuestra ciudad y su esposa es ama de casa. El esta pidiendo de nuestra ayuda porque su hermano requiere de una operación urgente de la vista y Rito se comprometió de manera solidaria apoyar a su hermano para que se pueda realizar esta operación.
texts.en:
Rito, 63, is married and, besides being a great husband, he is also an exemplary brother.  He has no dependents other than his wife.  

Rito is a bus driver and transports people and factory workers in our city.  His wife is a homemaker.  He is requesting our help because his brother needs an urgent eye operation and Rito has committed his support to his brother so he can have the operation.

loans.use: To pay for an eye operation.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is 57-year-old married man. He has seven children and three are enrolled in school. His wife's name is Esha and she is a businesswoman. Ali operates a kiosk and sells retail. He's worked in this business for one year. His primary customers are the community. Ali's other source of income includes his salary. 

Ali describes his  greatest business challenge to be debt defaulters  and his highest monthly expense is spent on food. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Ali will use the KES 30,000 loan to add stock,  i.e., buy  maize and wheat flour, sugar, and rice . Ali  aspires to open a wholesale business in the future. He joined Yehu because of their  various financial products.

loans.use: to add to his stock, i.e., buy  maize and wheat flour, sugar, and rice

loans.name: Isaiah

texts.en:
Isaiah  is a 36-year-old married man. He has five children and three are enrolled in school. His wife's name is Mary and she is a businesswoman. Isaiah  is a farmer and sells his produce from home. He's worked in this business for  over 15 years. His primary customers are the community. 

Isaiah's other source of income includes his  motorbike business. He describes his  greatest business challenge to be seasonality due to lack of rain and his highest monthly expense is spent on food. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Isaiah will use the KES 50,000 loan to  start up a kiosk. He joined Yehu because of their financial product varieties and their policies.

loans.use: to  start up a kiosk

loans.name: Zoila Rosa

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de artesania,la socia vende gorros,mantas,polos y chompas y tambien la socia hace trabajos de arcillas,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia quiere salir adelante,el sueño de la socia es ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de artesania.La socia solicita el credito para comprar arcilla,chompas,polos y guantes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member continues with her craft business, selling caps, blankets, polo shirts and sweaters, and also making clay crafts.  She works from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. and through her business is able to get ahead.

Her goal is to expand and improve her craft business; and she is requesting a loan to buy clay, sweaters, polo shirts and gloves.  

She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy clay, sweaters, polo shirts and gloves.

loans.name: Narciso

texts.es:
Nuestro socio  es el señor  Narciso, él pertenece al banco comunal “Los Lideres” de la ciudad del Cusco - Perú, nuestro socio se dedica a la artesanía, principalmente a los elementos bordados  y adornos, con esta actividad que realiza hace muchos años a podido mantener a su familia y brindar educación a sus hijos, por ello invertirá el préstamo solicitado para comprar telas, encajes e hilos para la producción de sus bordados y continuar asi con su actividad.
Narciso está muy agradecido con KIVA por permitirle mantenerse en su actividad y por apoyarlo con su familia.
El socio agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Our member's name is Narciso and he belongs to the communal bank "Los Lideres" in the city of Cusco - Perú.  He earns a living in the craft business, mainly with embroidery and frilly elements.  He has been in business several years, being able to support his family and give his children an education.  Therefore he is requesting a loan to buy fabric, lace and thread for his embroidery production and be able to continue his activity.

Narcisco is very grateful to KIVA for allowing him to stay in this activity and be able to support his family.

He is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy thread, lace and fabric.

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.en:
Hermelinda is from Maquilao, Tangub City. She is 34 years old, married and has 2 children. To make a living, she manages a fish vending business. She has been engaged in her business for 5 years and earns 5,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2009, Hermelinda joined GDMPC. 

Hermelinda is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets

loans.name: Mwanamkuu

texts.en:
Mwanamkuu is from Mwambalazi district, Kenya. She is in the business of selling food stuffs in a food stall that is located in a strategic point along a busy street. She is 33 years old and has two school-aged children aged 8 and 6 years. She has been in this business for 3 years.
She is a very hardworking woman who always wants to try whenever opportunities arise. She is requesting a loan of Ksh 20,000 to buy wheat flour, sugar, and cooking oil. 

In the future, Mwanamkuu hopes to upgrade her living standards and achieve her business goal. This will be her first loan. She would appreciate it if she can get the loan to develop her family.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, sugar, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Kijole

texts.en:
Kijole is 28 years old, married, and the mother of two children. Her husband works as a driver. As an additional source of income for the family, she has been engaged in operating a food stall since 2004, after having started this business with the selling of dumplings, tea, and flat breads. Thanks to Kijole's persistent work, she currently sells a variety of foods, hence increasing her clientele.

With an aim to further develop her business, Kijole turned to Yehu for a loan in the amount of 20,000 Kenya shillings for the purchase of wheat flour, sugar, rice, and cooking oil. Kijole plans to invest the income from the loan to further develop her business in order to be able to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase of wheat flour, sugar, rice, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Bakari

texts.en:
With his previous Kiva loan, Bakari bought another motorcycle for his transport business thus increasing his working capital slightly. Now he is applying for a new Kiva loan, to do plumbing in his house, purchase pipes and pay for labour charges. 

This is the reason why he is requesting for another loan to improve his family's living standard. Bakari tells the lenders that his Kiva loans have been very useful to him. He says thank you, and may they continue helping him.

loans.use: to purchase pipes for plumbing and pay for labour charges.

loans.name: Aloys

texts.en:
Aloys is a 67-year-old man who is married and has eight children, four of whom are in school. For the past two years, he has operated a dried fish selling business.He packs the dry fish in small plastic bags before selling them. In addition, he sells chicken mostly to cafes and restaurants. It has been a profitable project, but he needs more support to cover the costs.

Aloys is requesting a 30,000 KES loan from Yehu to help him cover the costs of purchasing more stock of dried fish and chicken for sale. This will improve the quality of his work, satisfy his customers, and improve his income.

Aloys dreams of opening a shop in the near future. He lives in his own house that has electricity but no piped water.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of dried fish and chicken for sale.

loans.name: Selestine

texts.en:
Selestine is married.  Her husband is a driver, and they live in their own house. She has two children who are still under her care. She has been a sand vendor for more than one year. 

Selestine has had to make many sacrifices to satisfy the needs of her children, and thanks to her commitment they are all attending school. She says that she sells her products to house builders in areas of her town. Nowadays she can count on established customers she has gained thanks to her good service and to the good quality of her products. She is requesting a loan to buy more sand to supply to more customers.
She is grateful for the support she is receiving from Kiva and Yehu Microfinance.

loans.use: to buy more sand

loans.name: Njira

texts.en:
Njira is a retailer and she runs a kiosk which is her source of income for herself and to provide for her family. She works there every day of the week and she can count on a good number of customers who choose her for the products she provides.

She is requesting a loan to invest it in the purchase of more stock for sale. She intends to purchase flour, sugar, and other small commodities such as soaps, cigarettes, sweets, etc. This loan will give her the economic resources she needs to stock up her inventory, thus granting her a better profitability.

She wants her activity to grow, as this will provide her with more money for herself and for her family; she hopes to have a good experience with the current credit and to be able to improve her standard of living.

Njira lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, and other small commodities such as soaps, cigarettes, sweets, etc.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is a hardworking mother who raised her children while she was working to bring income to her house, which she is still doing for her livelihood in her small and slum community on the outside of Santo Domingo's north. Francisca has been taking loans with Esperanza for almost 3 years, belonging to the group Mount of Blessing 1. She is accessing this loan to give her four children a new home. They live in deteriorated housing, and she is requesting a loan which she will use to improve her house by purchasing building materials to change her weakened walls made of wood, for concrete blocks. She will also be doing different changes to the roof and floor.

Francisca is one of Esperanza Internacional's entrepreneurs. She came to Esperanza Internacional almost three years ago for a loan to expand her business. She joined the group Mount of Blessing in one of the rural villages in Santo Domingo, where she has received loans to invest in her business selling used clothes.

Esperanza Internacional is running a program where most of their clients pay back their loans, fulfill their commitment to expand their businesses, and show fidelity in their groups. They can request loans to improve their house structure, while running their businesses loans and attending groups meetings.

loans.use: To buy construction materials like concrete blocks and cement

loans.name: Naangou Liggey Group

texts.fr: Le groupement "NAANGOU LIGGEY " se compose de cinq femmes qui pratique l'agriculture.Elles cultivent sur des parcelles de terre, non loin du village, de l'arachide et du mil.Elles vendent une partie de la production pour obtenir de l'argent.Toutefois, une grande partie de la production est destinée à la consommation.Le chef de groupe ( main levée, au milieu),est ménagère.Elle est mère de quatre enfants.Elle cultive de l'arachide, du mil et de l'oseille.Cette activité lui permet d'améliorer l'alimentation de la famille et de subvenir à certains de ses propres besoins.Afin de préparer la campagne agricole de cette année, le groupement sollicite un pret de 500000f pour acheter des semences et de l'engrais.
texts.en:
The NAANGOU LIGGEY group consists of five women involved in farming.  They grow groundnut and millet on plots of land located not far from the village.

In order to make some money, they sell part of their crop.  However, a large part of their crop is used for consumption.

The group's leader (raising her hand, in the middle of the group) is a homemaker and the mother of four children.  She grows groundnut, millet and sorrel.

Thanks to this activity, she is able to improve her family's diet and to meet some of her own needs.  

In order to prepare for this year's farming season, the group is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs for the purchase of seeds and fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter has a tailoring business in Olkalau town, a business he has been in for the past two years. In addition to his tailoring business, he also practices farming.

He plans to use this loan to buy four sheep for rearing as well as a spraying machine for crops. With the anticipated income, he plans to pay school fees for his children.

In the future, Peter hopes to increase both his tailoring and farming businesses as well as to start dairy farming.

loans.use: to buy sheep for rearing and also a spraying machine for crops.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana, 44, is a married mother of three living in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines, where she runs a retail store to earn a living. She has been engaged in this for 10 years and earns 10,000 PHP each month from this work. 

Susana has requested a loan of 13,400 PHP from GDMPC to purchase new items to expand her product offering. She became a member of GDMPC in 2011. In the future, Susana hopes to expand her retail business and to gain more profits.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Thorn

texts.en:
Thorn, 38, works as a farmer growing rice in a suburban area of a major city. Rice farming is the primary source of income for her family, from which she is able to cover her household expenses. She has been in this business for over 10 years. 

Thorn is married and has four children – three dependent children and one employed child. Thorn’s husband works as a paid worker in an animal-feed factory, earning around 2.00 USD per day to support the family.

Now, Thorn is asking for a loan of 300 USD to pay the labor costs for her farming and to buy fertilizers and herbicides for the care of her crops. She hopes that this loan will be a great support, allowing her to improve her farming business, and she hopes to have a fruitful harvest in the following season.

loans.use: to pay labor costs and to purchase farm supplies for her rice crops.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her agriculture business.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Thanks to her previous loan from Kiva, Fatuma was able to increase the variety of foods in her food stall. Those foods sold very well and Fatuma profited more than usual.

She's asking for another loan of 10,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) in order to invest in her newly established grocery store. With this loan, Fatuma plans to purchase potatoes, tomatoes, and other fruits and vegetables so as to increase the assortment of items she has for sale. She is so grateful to Kiva and Yehu for the support given. Since the previous loan, her living standards have improved.

She hopes that this loan will assist her in attracting new customers and increase her sales and profits.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes, tomatoes, and other fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Emilienne

texts.fr: Emilienne est une femme de 42 ans, mariée,mère de 04 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 06 et 18 ans et tous vont à l'école.Elle est couturière et a ouvert un atelier depuis 15 ans déjà qu'elle gère.Grâce à son savoir faire et son expérience,elle a conquise une clientèle au fil du temps. La couture etant une activité qui a des périodes vives(pendant les fêtes) et creuses(dû à la rareté des clients),elle aimerait pour éviter cette période qui la met souvent en difficulté s'acheter avec ce crédit des tissus pagnes qui lui permettront de confectionner différent vêtements selon les goûts et les âges qu'elle pourra exposer à la devanture de son atelier pour attirer la clientèle et augmenter ses ventes.Elle économisera les bénéfices que lui apportera ses ventes en partie pour subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants et réinvestira le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Emilienne, age 42, is married and the mother of four children, aged 6 to 18, who all go to school. She's a seamstress and, fifteen years ago, she opened the workshop she's now running.

Thanks to her know-how and experience, she won over her clientele over time. Sewing is a business that's at times very busy (during the holidays) and, at others, very calm (very few customers).

To avoid this period of time, which often puts her in difficulty, Emilienne would like to use this loan to buy "pagnes" fabrics (colorful African cloth) that will enable her to make various clothes for different ages and tastes. She will display them in the window of her workshop, in order to attract customers and increase her sales.

She will put away the sales profits, in part to provide for her children's needs, and reinvest the remainder in her business.

loans.use: to buy fabrics

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen, a skilled seamstress for her community clients, earns a reasonable income every month which helps her to pay utility bills and her children's school fees. Her husband operates a donkey cart business, working very hard to deliver goods throughout the community.

Nasreen has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah to buy a new sewing machine because her current machine has become unreliable and she is unable to meet deadlines. She is confident that by purchasing a new sewing machine she will be able to complete her orders on time and increase her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her sewing business.

loans.name: Mbaruku

texts.en:
Mbaruku, a 55-year-old married father of four children who all attend school, lives in Msambweni district. He and his wife have been earning a living buying fish for resale.

This will be Mbaruku's fourth loan with Kiva's field partner, Yehu Microfinance, which he will use to buy construction materials such as cement, bricks, sand, wood, etc. for his house construction. His previous loans have improved his living conditions, and this one will enable him to have a decent house to live in.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for building a house.

loans.name: Gie Juboo De Médina Fass Group

texts.fr: Le groupe "Gie juboo de médina fass" se compose de cinq femmes, toutes mariées.Certaines d'entre elles vendent des denrées alimentaires alors que d'autres tiennent des boutiques de vente de produits agricoles comme le mil, l'arachide...Le chef du groupe (en foulard jaune, main levée au milieu du groupe) est une mère de famille qui a cinq enfants.Elle tient devant son domicile une table sur laquelle elle vend des denrées alimentaires.Le commerce qu'elle exercent permet aux femmes de subvenir à certains de leurs besoins et à ceux de leurs enfants.Afin de renforcer leurs fods de commerce, elles sollicitent un pret de 500 000f pour acheter de l'arachide, du mil et d'autres denrées diverses.Leurs ambition est de toujours élargir leur activité.
texts.en:
Gie Juboo De Médina Fass Group is made up of five married women. Some of them sell food products, whereas others run shops selling agricultural products, such as millet, peanuts, etc.

The leader of the group (wearing a yellow scarf and raising her hand in the photograph) is the mother of five children. She sets up a table in front of her home, on top of which she sells food products.

The businesses they run enable the members of the group to provide for their own and their children's needs. In order to bolster their working capital, they are seeking a loan of XOF 500'000, to buy peanuts, millets, and other food products.

They ambition to keep on expanding their businesses.

loans.use: to buy peanuts, millet, and other food products

loans.name: Joram

texts.en:
Joram is 30 years old and married. He is the father of two children. For the last six years, he has earned a living by selling goods from his retail shop. He earns a monthly profit of KES 20,000. 

Joram was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer and is applying for his second loan of KES 50,000 to buy additional stock of soft drinks, cooking oil, flour and other foodstuffs to sell to his customers in Mpeketoni, Lamu.

Joram will use the profits he earns to pay the school fees for his children as well as continue looking after his family. His goal for the future is to continue sustaining and growing his business so that he can give his family a good and stable life.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of soft drinks, cooking oil, flour and other foodstuffs.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Mujeres Emprendedoras”, nuestra socia sigue dedicándose al comercio de verduras en un mercado importante de la ciudad, la cual le va muy bien, y es esta actividad la que le permite sacar adelante a su familia y seguir creciendo, por ello invierte todos sus préstamos para capitalizar su actividad y compró productos como zanahorias,tomates,cebollas entre otras verduras, tambien cumplió con algunas responsabilidades adquiridas como el pago de algunas deudas y gastos de su hogar.
La socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle mantenerse en su actividad y apoyar a su familia.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the 'Mujeres Emprendedores' community bank.  She continues selling vegetables in a large market in the city and her business is going very well.  It allows her to provide for her family.  For this reason, she invests all her loans in capitalizing her business.  She will use her loan to buy carrots, tomatoes, and onions, among other vegetables.  She will also meet some responsibilities such as paying off some debts and covering some household expenses.

She is very grateful to Kiva for enabling her to keep her business running and support her family.

loans.use: to purchase carrots, tomatoes, and onions

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Mujeres Emprendedoras”, nuestra socia sigue dedicándose a su tienda de Abarrotes, el cual le va muy bien, y es esta actividad la que le permite sacar adelante a su familia, por ello invertirá el préstamo solicitado para capitalizar su actividad y comprar mercadería como arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche etc. para surtir su comercio.
La socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle mantenerse en su actividad y apoyando a su familia.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
The group member is a part of the community bank “Mujeres Emprendedoras.”  She continues to dedicate herself to her grocery store, which is doing very well, and this work helps her to help her family get ahead, for which reason she will invest her loan in capital for her business and to buy merchandise like rice, sugar, noodles, milk, etc. for her business.

She is very thankful to Kiva for helping her maintain her business and helping her family.

She thanks the lender and promises to complete her payments in accordance with the agreed upon schedule.

loans.use: to purchase products such as rice, sugar, flour, noodles, and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Mujeres Emprendedoras” de la ciudad del Cusco - Perú, nuestra socia sigue dedicándose a la confección de prendas de vestir como chompas, chalinas, guantes etc. a base de fibra de lana, y es esta actividad la que le permite sacar adelante a su familia, por ello invertirá el préstamo solicitado para capitalizar su actividad y comprar la materia prima como lana de alpaca e hilos para la producción de sus prendas.
La socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle mantenerse en su actividad y apoyando a su familia.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
This member is a part of the community bank “Mujeres Emprendedoras” from the city of Cusco, Peru.  She continues to work in the creation of clothing items such as jackets, scarves, gloves, etc. made from wool fibers, and it is this activity that allows her to help her family succeed.  Thus, she will invest her loan money in her activities and buy prime materials, like wool and threads.

Sonia is very thankful to Kiva for helping her to sustain her business and support her family.

She thanks the lender and promises to complete the payments of her loan at the agreed upon times.

loans.use: to buy alpaca wool in order to make her textiles.

loans.name: Petronila

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS SOLIDARIOS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia se dedica al trabajo como docente,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia tambien se dedica al negocio de crianza de animales como cuyes y gallinas,la socia los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en los diferentes mercados,el sueño de la socia es ampliar y mejorar el negocio de crianza de animales.La socia solicita el credito para comprar cuyes y gallinas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Introducing Petronila, a member of the “Los Solidarios” (The Caring), a Communal Bank located in the district of Urubamba, province of Urubamba, department of Cusco.

She is a teacher, working from 8 am to 6 pm; she also breeds animals such as “cuyes” (“cuy” is Quechua for Guinea pig) and chickens. She fattens them and let them grow until she sells them in different markets. Her dream is to expand and improve her animal husbandry activity. She is requesting a loan to buy cuyes and chickens.

She is happy about the loan and she commits to complying with the repayment of her dues.

loans.use: To buy guinea pigs and chickens

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es:
