Nuestro socio  es el señor  Ruben, él pertenece al banco comunal “Mujeres Emprendedoras” de la ciudad del Cusco - Perú, nuestro socio sigue dedicándose a la actividad turística trabajando como agente de viajes y vendiendo paquetes turísticos, y es esta actividad la que le permite sacar adelante a su familia, por ello invertirá el préstamo solicitado para implementar su agencia y compró mobiliario como implementos de oficina.
Ruben está muy agradecido con KIVA por permitirle mantenerse en su actividad y apoyando a su familia.
El socio agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Ruben belongs to the Mujeres Emprendedoras communal bank in the city of Cusco, Perú.  He continues working as a tourist agent and selling tour packages.  This activity allows him to get his family ahead.

Therefore, he will use the requested loan to upgrade his agency.  He bought furnishings like office equipment. Ruben is very grateful to Kiva for allowing him to maintain his business activity and support his family.

He is grateful for the loan, and he pledges to make his payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy office supplies like stationery and desk supplies.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 30 years old and married. He runs a general shop business. He has been in this business for three years and earns a monthly income of 24,500 KES.
 
This will be David's first loan with Kadet. He plans to use it to purchase more stock of sugar for his business. He plans to use the anticipated profits to buy a plot of land on which to construct rental houses. He hopes to expand his business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of sugar for his business.

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en:
Mbeyu is married and has two children, ages 2 and 6. She has always wanted to provide them with a good education, and since her husband's income is not enough to provide the family with a good quality of life, Mbeyu decided to start working.

About four years ago, Mbeyu began selling consumer goods in a small kiosk in order to generate an income for her family's needs. Thanks to the increasing number of customers due to the good service and products she provides, Mbeyu is looking for a loan to buy more stock of soaps, detergents, flour and cooking oil. This will allow her to increase her inventory and offer better service to her customers. 

In this way, Mbeyu will continue to increase her customer base and her business will continue to be a source of income. Because of this, her family can have a better standard of living and continue getting ahead.

loans.use: to buy more stock of soaps, detergents, flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Cate

texts.en:
Cate is married with five children, all of whom attend school. She also takes care of additional family members. 

Cate has a restaurant business and has been in this business for eight years. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 UGX from MCDTSACCO to buy more bunches of bananas, beef, rice, chicken and beans. She works six days a week from her home. 

Besides this restaurant business, Cate is also a peasant farmer. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She aspires to see her business grow into a fully stocked restaurant and also to build her own premises.  She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but no piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent, school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more stock of bananas, beef, chicken, rice and beans.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is 22 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Cheryl has a store that sells meat, vegetables and spices. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy stock of meat, spices and vegetables.

Cheryl has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Cheryl hopes to improve her business for the education of her child.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables and spices to sell.

loans.name: Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
El comité Oñondivepa  nace mediante la gestión de una de las miembros, quien con la esperanza de ayudar a sus amigas y vecinas las incentivo a formar el grupo.
La Sra Paola, tiene 28 años, es una mujer emprendedora, trabajadora y por sobre todo muy optimista e inculca a las integrantes de su comité a salir adelante. Ella es la presidenta del grupo  y comenta que se dedica a las ventas varias de todo tipo de productos, como ser sabanas, edredones, calzados y demás, en lo cual ya tiene muy buena clientela.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas, edredones, calzados y demás insumos con los cuales podrá seguir trabajando y ayudando a su familia.
texts.en: The Oñondivepa committee is born thanks to the actions taken by one of the members who, hoping to help her friends and neighbors, motivated them to create the group. Paola is 28 years old, she is an entrepreneurial, hard working and above all, optimistic woman. She instills the members of her committee to pull through. She is the president of the group and says that for a living she sells all kinds of products, such as, sheets, quilts, footwear and others, for what she has a very good customer base. She requests the loan to buy garments, quilts, footwear and other supplies that will allow her to continue working and helping her family.

loans.use: to buy garments, quilts, footwear and other supplies

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
15 mujeres de la ciudad de Luque se han unido con el proposito de ayudar a sus familias por medio del trabajo en conjunto. Ellas con mujeres jefas de familia que desean crecer y ser grandes microempresarias.
La sra. Catalina tiene un almacen esta acompañada con el señor Salustiano y tienen 2 hijos. Catalina tiene como meta agrandar su negocio y combertirlo en un autoservice para dar asi un mejor estilo de vida a su familia y tambien poder seguir ayudando a su familia con los gastos de la casa, ya que quiere poder darle lo mejor a sus hijos.
Ella solicita el crédito para comprar azucar, leche, pan, fideos, yerba, carne, bebidas y demás insumos para poder surtir su local y poder ofrecer a sus clientes una buena variedad siempre
texts.en:
Fifteen women from the city of Luque have come together with the goal of helping their families by working together.  They are heads of family who want to grow and be great micro-entrepreneurs.

Catalina has a grocery store.  She is involved with Salustiano and they have two children.  Her goal is to expand her business and turn it into a supermarket to give her family a better lifestyle.  She also wants to be able to continue helping her family with the household expenses and give her children the best.

She is requesting the loan to buy sugar, milk, bread, noodles, yerba mate, meat, beverages, and other supplies to supply her store and always be able to have a good variety for her customers.

loans.use: to buy sugar, milk, bread, noodles, yerba mate, meat, beverages, and other supplies.

loans.name: Celia Sabas

texts.es:
Celia tiene 35 años de edad, es una mujer muy trabajadora y sobre todo muy optimista ya que es madre de un pequeño que actualmente tiene 10 años de edad, por quien Celia trabaja muy duro para darle una vida digna y llena de ejemplo, de que cuando se trabaja de manera honrada se puede lograr mucho. La vivienda de Celia se ubica en el distrito de Chincha. Ciudad donde alberga la mayor población afroperuana de nuestro país y es la cuna de grandes glorias del deporte peruano, asimismo sus pobladores tienen un don particular, cocinan de manera deliciosa y sobre todo son personas muy carismáticas y amables. 

Con mucha dedicación Celia trabaja en su negocio de venta de abarrotes y comida, ella trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 20 clientes diariamente, Celia cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los cliente se ofrece productos de calidad a bajos precios.

Celia está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que es la segunda vez que le brindan su gran y valioso apoyo, ya que gracias a ello, Celia podrá comprar mercadería para su negocio como golosinas al por mayor, aceite, leche, jugos envasados, azúcar, entre otros. De esta manera ella podrá seguir creciendo cada día y poder seguir trabajando y luchando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño: “Darle una buena profesión a su hijo y tener una gran tienda y poder ampliar su negocio de venta de comida”.
texts.en:
Celia, 35, is a very hardworking woman who above all is very optimistic since she’s the mother of a 10-year-old son for whom Celia works very hard in order to provide him with a dignified life and to set a good example for him that when one works in an honest way one can accomplish much.

Celia’s home is located in Chincha District, a city with the country’s largest Afro-Peruvian population; it’s the birthplace of great Peruvian sports heroes.  The residents here possess a very special gift: they are delicious cooks and above all are charismatic, kind people.

With much dedication, Celia works selling groceries and food.  She works about 10 hours daily and can tend to up to 20 customers per day.  She believes she does well in business because she’s kind to her customers and sells quality products at low prices.

Celia is very grateful to Kiva lenders because this is the second time they’ve provided their great and valuable support.  Thanks to it Celia will be able to buy merchandise for her store like snacks at wholesale, oil, milk, packaged juice and sugar, among others.  In this way she will be able to continue moving forward growing every day able to continue to work and strive toward making her greatest dream a reality: to give her son a good profession and to have a great store and to be able to expand her food business.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Mujeres Solidarias Group

texts.es:
Mujeres solidarias es el grupo formado en la ciudad de Luque, el cual con mucho esfuerzo ya esta en el sexto ciclo. Como dice el nombre del grupo, ellas son mujeres solidarias, ya que siempre se ayudan las unas a las otras.
La Sra Maria tiene 38 años de edad es soltera, tiene una Despensa bien surtida, en la cual trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas. Maria es una persona con ganas de salir adelante y quiere poder superarse día con día. La  Sra Maria tiene una meta que es ampliar su negocio dentro de su hogar.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas, leche, carne, verduras, y demás productos, con lo que quiere poder surtir su local y seguir dando una buena atencion a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mujeres Solidarias is a group that was formed in the city of Luque.  Having made a great deal of effort, they are already in their sixth loan cycle.  As the name of their group suggests, they are a group of women who value solidarity, and they always are helping one another.

Maria is 38 years old and is single.  She has a well-stocked store, in which she works every day starting very early in the morning.  She is a highly motivated person who wants to be able to make progress day after day.  Her goal is to grow her business, which is located in her home.  She is seeking this loan in order to buy beverages, milk, meat, vegetables and other products, so that she can restock her store and continue to provide good service to her customers.

loans.use: to buy beverages, milk, meat, vegetables and other products.

loans.name: Maria Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 30 years old, single, and does not have children. She has proven to be an independent and hard-working woman. Indeed, she has previously taken a loan with Edpyme Alternativa with the help of kiva to expand her business, demonstraing responsibility and punctuality. She now lives in her own house, which is located in the District of Tambogrande, Northern Peru. Milagros lives in the rural part of the district and does not receive basic services. 

She sells cosmetics through catalogs. Milagros sells these products to her neighbors and friends. Every day she strives to attract more customers and generate more orders for her products so that she can earn a better income. This business helps her with covering her personal expenses and assisting her parents with the household finances. Indeed, thanks to the previous credit she is has has established a shop in her house and is now also selling beverages. Milagros wants to consolidate her business' new approach as a retail outlet for selling cosmetics out of her home. Hence, she is looking to take a loan of 3000 soles, to buy more cosmetics merchandise and bevarages.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics and bevarages, to consolidate her business at home.

loans.name: Bacilisa

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  es la señora Bacilisa, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Reyna de los Angeles” de la provincia de Urubamba en Cusco – Perú. Nuestra socia se sigue dedicando al comercio abarrotes en su tienda. Bacilisa invertirá el préstamo solicitado para comprar mercadería como arroz, azucar, leche, fideos y bebidas gaseosas, para surtir su tienda.
Bacilisa está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y por ayudarla con el crecimiento y fortalecimiento de su actividad.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Introducing Bacilisa, a member of “Reyna de los Angeles” (Queen of Angels), a Communal Bank located in the Urubamba province in the department of Cusco, Peru. Bacilisa keeps on running her grocery store, and she will invest the loan she is requesting in the purchase of more products to stock up her inventory such as rice, sugar, milk, noodles and drinks.
Bacilisa is deeply grateful to KIVA for having allowed her to grant her family a better standard of living and for helping her in strengthening her activity and in making it grow.
She is grateful for the loan and she commits to complying with the repayment of her dues according to schedule.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, milk, noodles and drinks.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El  Sr.  Carlos  tiene 37, el trabajo desde  hace 15 años en las ventas, ya que tiene una despensa bien surtida, en la cual trabaja todos los días.
El Sr. Carlos es una persona muy trabajadora que se esfuerza siempre al máximo para poder salir adelante y de esa forma ir creciendo como profesional, como así también como persona.
Cuenta que su sueño es poder tener un gran supermercado, y de esa forma seguir ayudando a su familia y darles todo lo que necesitan para una vida mejor.
Solicita el crédito para poder surtir su negocio con bebidas, lácteos, comestibles, carnes y demás insumos con los cuales podrá seguir ofreciendo variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Carlos is 37 years old.  He has been working in sales for 15 years.  He has a well-stocked grocery store that he works in every day.

Carlos is a very hard-working person who always puts in maximum effort in order to get ahead in life.  He wants to grow as a professional and also as  a person.

Carlos says that his dream is to own a large supermarket so that he can continue helping his family and providing them with everything they need to live a better life.

Carlos is requesting this loan to stock his business with drinks, dairy products, food products, meat and other supplies so that he can continue offering a good variety of products to his customers.

loans.use: to buy products for his grocery store

loans.name: Rajabgul

texts.en: Rajabgul is a wonderful mother of three children.  She is a woman who likes children very much. She wants all children to live happily and wear beautiful clothes. With this aim, she began her own business selling children's clothes seven years ago. She has a growing business because she has a wide assortment of goods and this attracts many customers. Rajabgul has a careful husband and he helps her with the business. She is asking for a loan to buy goods for the new season and to develop her business. She awaits your help.

loans.use: To buy goods for the new season

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Touch is 38 years old and a married woman who happily lives in Baray district with her spouse and her five single children. 

She is involved in a farming business to make a livelihood and provide daily sustenance for the family. She manages two hectares of farmland, on which she grows and harvests rice, potatoes, beans, and vegetables. She has been in this along with her spouse for over 20 years.

Touch would like to maintain her farming business and make a consistent income, so she is requesting a loan of KHR 2,500,000 to purchase farm supplies, pay for labor costs in transplanting rice, and to rent a tractor to till the land for planting potatoes. 

In the future, Touch aspires to save money to purchase extra plots of farmland to keep expanding her farming business.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies, pay for labor costs in transplanting rice, and to rent a tractor to till the land for planting potatoes.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is 38 years old, married, and the mother of three children. For the last five years, the lady has earned a living by farming and selling her produce to her clients in Mpeketoni, Lamu. She earns a monthly profit of KES 10,000. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our credit officers, and is applying for her third loan of KES 25,000 to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer, pesticides and so on to ensure that her produce is well taken care of. 

She will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay school fees for her children and assist with other family needs. Her goal for the future is to venture into mixed farming so that she may improve her family's financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Maria Ines

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  es la señora María, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los Lideres” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. Nuestra socia se dedica a vender alimentos en su restaurante, actividad que viene realizando hace mucho tiempo y que le permitió sacar adelante a su familia. María en esta oportunidad invertirá el préstamo solicitado para comprar insumos como papas, arroz, menestras etc. que le permitirán capitalizar y hacer producir a su comercio.
María está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y ayudarla a mantener y desarrollarse en sus actividades económicas.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Our member is Sra. María who belongs to “Los Lideres” Communal Bank in the city of Cusco, Perú. She sells food in her restaurant, a business that she has had for a long time and that has allowed her to move her family forward. María will invest this loan in the purchase of supplies such as potatoes, rice, mixed vegetables, etc., which will enable her to capitalize her business and make it productive.

María is very grateful to KIVA for permitting her to provide a better quality of life for her family and for helping her to sustain and develop her economic activities. She appreciates the loan and is committed to making her payments according to the scheduled time table.

loans.use: to purchase rice, mixed vegetables, potatoes and greens.

loans.name: Mirna Yecenia

texts.es:
La señora Mirna  tiene 30 años, es casada, tiene 3 hijos, reside en una comunidad del Municipio de Santa Cruz de Yojoa.
Su actividad económica que le genera ingresos para su familia, es una pequeña pulpería donde vende productos de la canasta básica (arroz, frijoles, harina de trigo y de maíz, huevos) y productos de higiene. Su negocio lo inicio con recursos propios y posteriormente ha tenido la oportunidad de administrar varios créditos, lo cual le ha permitido sostener su negocio y su familia. Considera como principales dificultades por enfrentar, los altos precios de los productos alimenticios y las pocas ventas en algunas temporadas del año.
 En la actualidad ha solicitado un préstamo de L.15, 000.00, el que invertirá en la compra de productos alimenticios, productos para el aseo y medicinas. Su meta es ofrecer más variedad de productos a sus clientes, aumentar su negocio y ahorrar para el futuro de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mirna, age 30, is married and has three children.  She lives in a community in the Santa Cruz de Yojoa municipality.

Her business activity that generates income for her family is a small grocery store.  She sells basic needs products (rice, beans, wheat flour, corn flour, and eggs) and hygiene products.  She started her business with her own resources, and she later had the opportunity to use several loans.  This allowed her to maintain her business and support her family.

She thinks that the main difficulties she faces are the high prices of food products and the low number of sales during some times of the year.

She has currently requested a loan for 15,000 lempiras.  She will use the loan to buy food products, hygiene products, and medicines.  Her goals are to offer her customers a variety of products, to increase her business, and to save for her children’s future.

loans.use: to buy food products, hygiene products, and medicines in order to stock her business.

loans.name: Mebakari

texts.en:
Mebakari is 42 years old and lives together with her life partner and five children. She has a cafe where she sells different types of foods and beverages. She has been in her business for a number of years and already has a lot of customers as everything she sells is top quality and affordable. In addition, she has a small grocery stall outside her house where she sells a variety of fruits and vegetables.

Mebakari is a woman who is committed to her work and her home. The most important thing for her is her family and she would like them to live in better conditions. She always does her best to ensure her customers are pleased with her services and that they don’t get offended. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Yehu that will allow her to buy more ingredients such as wheat flour, beans, sugar, etc. in order to provide a variety and quality foods. Mebakari is a responsible person. She is certain that she will be able to repay her loan and also provide her family with the quality of life they deserve.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients such as wheat flour, beans, sugar, etc

loans.name: Jemalyn

texts.en:
Jemalyn is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Jemalyn is offering manicure and pedicure in their local community. She has had this business for nine years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy materials to be used in manicure and pedicure.

Jemalyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Jemalyn hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy materials to use in pedicure and manicure

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en: This is Yusuf's fifth loan with Kiva's field partner, Yehu Microfinance, and he successfully paid back the past loans, which have helped his family increase business and the family's income. With a good business, he is requesting another loan with Yehu Microfinance. He will use this loan to purchase more fishing nets to supply more fish for his business. He hopes to increase his business and make a living better and keep his children in school.

loans.use: to purchase more fishing nets to supply more fish

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Josephine has a pig-raising business that sells grown & matured pigs. She has had this business for seven years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy animal feed for the pigs.

Josephine has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, Josephine hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for pigs

loans.name: Jesus Alberto

texts.es: Jesus  desde sus 15 años construyó su propia experiencia de negocios y fue mediante la observación de como, las  mujeres que necesitaban hacer mas efectiva sus tareas domésticas  en otras comunidades,  recurrían a pequeños negocios donde alquilaban por horas maquinarias para lavar diariamente y se resguardaban del candente sol del Caribe. Por eso no dudó en emprender esta misma aventura y aplicarla a sus vecinos del  sector donde habita. Su servicio lo ofrece de contado a sus principales clientes, son amas de casa, hombres y mujeres que trabajan y tienen esta responsabilidad familiar y les queda poco tiempo para realizarla. Los días de mayor recurrencia del servicio son los fines de semana, fechas en las cuales desde muy temprano quedan muchos clientes sin acceder al servicio. Jesús con su olfato de negocio, aprovechando el potencial de clientes que a diario lo visitan, para adicionar un nuevo negocio donde ofrece servicios de telecomunicaciones  en el que le ha ido muy bien y ha agregado un nuevo ingreso, con el cual hacer realidad el sueño de prosperidad de hacer cada vez mas amplio su negocio. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva, también crédito inicial en la Fundación Mario Santo Domino, con el cual comprará una nueva máquina de lavar, para dar respuesta gradual a la demanda de este servicio que tiene su mercado.
texts.en:
Since he was 15, Jesus has been garnering business experience, which showed him that women in other communities, who needed to do housework more efficiently and protect themselves from the blazing Caribbean sun, rented washing machines by the hour every day. He had no doubts about starting a similar business for the residents of his neighborhood. He offers the service in cash to his main customers: homemakers, both men and women who are responsible for this family chore, yet have little time to do it without this service. Weekends are the busiest times, and many customers can't get service after early morning. 

Jesús, with his nose for  business and taking advantage of the potential to serve the customers who came every day, added a new business offering telephone and internet service that has flourished, increased his earnings, and with which he hopes to achieve his dream to prosper and to keep growing his business. He is applying for his first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domino, with which he will buy a new washing machine to gradually meet the market demand for this service.

loans.use: to buy a new washing machine.

loans.name: Nunu

texts.en:
Nunu is 50 years old. She lives in Samtredia District with her husband Pilate and their 20-year-old daughter, who is a student. Pilate works as a laborer in the village. Nunu requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for agricultural business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected each time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is the monthly salary of Pilate and social assistance in the amount of 60 Laris per month. The monthly income of the family is 240 Laris. It is hardly enough to feed a three-member family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the vulnerable poor category; they get the above-mentioned monthly social assistance from the government, as they are estimated to live below the poverty line.

Nunu requested a loan from Credo to start up a dairy farm. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit Nunu will purchase a milk cow. She will place it in an old empty farm building located in their yard. Nunu will work hard in the farm. She will produce cheese and sell it in the village. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan will significantly increase the income of the family. Their income will double and the family members will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Mlongo

texts.en:
Thirty-five-year-old Mlongo,who lives with her five children in Tiribe, Kenya, has a grocery store at the market where she sells a variety of groceries. Mlongo used to help her mother in a vegetable stall there when she was young, and because of this experience decided to open her own business. She dreams of expanding her store and opening a retail shop in the future.

Mlongo is now requesting her first Kiva loan from Yehu to buy more groceries such as kale, tomatoes, fruits, etc. to better meet the demands of her discerning customers whose loyalty she is always striving to maintain.

loans.use: to buy more groceries such as kale, tomatoes, fruits, etc.

loans.name: Hilario

texts.es:
Hilario es un señor de 45 años de edad y vive con su esposa y sus siete hijos en la comunidad de San Rafael de Florencia de San Carlos, en la provincia de Alajuela. Esta comunidad rural presenta mucho potencial de desarrollo a través de las actividades agrícolas. La zona  posee un clima caliente, lo que permite la producción de ciertas frutas que se desarrollan con más fuerza gracias a  este tipo de clima  como el mango, el melón y otros propios de la zona, también se destaca actividades  tales como el ganado de engorde.
La localidad de Florencia se caracteriza por sus parques nacionales y su extensa variedad en la flora y en la fauna. 
Don Hilario con su propios esfuerzo y trabajo ha ido construyendo poco a poco su vivienda, con gran dificultad ya que seis de sus hijos son memores de edad y el único ingreso que tiene es el suyo, necesita techar , poner piso y terminar el cuarto de pilas, para ello debe comprar materiales como cemento , arena, piedra entre otros. Está solicitando un préstamo de seiscientos mil colones (¢600.000) con este monto considera que puede lograr su objetivo, agrega que se siente muy feliz de tener casa propia.
Es miembro de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de SCSAR S.A, este será su primer préstamo razón por la cual está  muy agradecido, por la oportunidad de acceso al crédito que esta le brinda y poder terminar de construir su vivienda.
texts.en:
Hilario is 45 years old and lives with his wife and their seven children in the community of San Rafael of Florencia of San Carlos in Alajuela province. This rural community presents a lot of potential for development through agricultural activities. The area has a warm climate, which allows the production of certain fruits that develop better thanks to this type of climate such as mango, melon and other inherent to the area, there are also activities such as cattle fattening.

The town of Florencia is characterized by its national parks and its extensive variety in flora and fauna. Hilario through his own effort and hard work has gradually built up his house, with great difficulty as six of his children are minors and his income is the only one they have. 

He needs to build the roof, put the floor and finish a room, for this he must purchase materials such as concrete, sand, stone among others. He is requesting a loan of six hundred thousand colones (¢600.000), an amount that he considers is enough to reach his goal, he mentions that he is very happy of having his own house. He is a member of the Communal Bank SCSAR S.A. This would be his first loan and for this reason he is very thankful for this opportunity and because he will be able to finish his house.

loans.use: To build a house

location.town: San Rafael de Florencia de San Carlos

loans.name: Pamela Ann

texts.en:
Pamela Ann, a 23-year-old married mother of a four-year-old, resides in Corella, Bohol where she operates a sari-sari store (general store) in her neighborhood. She is requesting a loan of 7000 PHP to buy additional items such as snack food, seasonings, coffee, milk, toiletries and canned goods.

The additional capital will enable Pamela Ann to improve her inventory which will attract more customers to her store. Her income will help provide healthy food for her child and also reinvestment for the business.

loans.use: to buy additional items like snack food, seasonings, coffee, milk, toiletries and canned goods.

loans.name: Cien Porciento Esfuerzo Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Cien por ciento esfuerzo” está conformado por 17 emprendedores que se dedican al rubro del comercio, específicamente remates, venta de ropa, venta de comida rápida, venta de perfumes, venta de plumones y sabanas, venta de confites, costura, venta de ropa interior, servicios entre otros. Todos pertenecientes a la comuna de Peñalolén ubicada en la ciudad de Santiago. 
Nidia, presidenta del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra en cuclillas, viste un pantalón y una chaqueta de color gris, encima lleva un pañuelo de color negro y blanco y en sus manos una carpeta, su cabello es de color castaño oscuro y lo usa tomado.
Ella se dedica al rubro de venta de almacén, desde hace 2 meses. Comenta que trabaja en su casa en conjunto con su madre durante la mañana, ya que en la tarde se dedica a trabajar como cajera.
Su mercadería la compra en supermercados, distribuidoras de confites a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará confites, galletas, papas fritas, dulces.
Sus metas son continuar con el negocio y poder ampliar una parte de  la casa, para instalar adecuadamente  su negocio para generar mayores ingresos, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Nidia vive junto a sus padres, un hermano, una sobrina y su hijo pequeño de 8 años de edad. Sus sueños son obtener su casa propia y darle lo mejor a su hijo.
Ella está muy agradecida y contenta  de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Comenta que las capacitaciones han sido fundamentales para su negocio y también para su desarrollo personal, ya que ha aprendido a organizar y distribuir de mejor manera sus ingresos e inversiones. Además se siente muy cómoda con las demás emprendedoras del grupo del Banco Comunal ya que existe respeto, unidad y confianza.
Peñalolén se localiza al oriente de la región metropolitana. Cuenta con diversos atractivos tales como viñas, edificios considerados patrimonio histórico y sitios naturales de excursión, elementos que están transformando a esta comuna en un nuevo panorama turístico dentro de la región Metropolitana.
texts.en:
The communal  bank "Cien Por Ciento Esfuerzo" (One-Hundred Percent Effort) is comprised of 17 entrepreneurs whom make a living in commerce.  Specifically, in auctions, sewing, the sale of clothing, fast foods, perfumes, duvets and sheets, snacks, and undergarments among others.  All the entrepreneurs reside in the community of Peñalolén located in Santiago.  

Nidia, the only woman squatting in the photo, is President of the comunal bank.  She has been making a living in her retail store for the last 2 months.  She works at home with her mother during the week and in the evening she works as a cashier for the store.  Nidia purchases her merchandise at supermarkets and low-cost distributors, whichever is economically convenient.  With this loan she will purchase snacks such as cookies, french fries, and sweets in general.

Her goals are to continue with her business and expand part of her home for the store so that she can generate higher revenues.  This way she can have a higher quality of life.  Nidia lives with her parents, a brother, a niece, and her eight year old son.  She wishes to purchase her own home and give her son the best.  

She very much appreciates and is happy for the opportunity brought to her by Fondo Esperanza (Hope Fund) that will permit her to invest in her business.  Now that she has learned to better organize her business and manage her capital she realized the training provided has been fundamental for her business and her personal development.  In addition, she feels very comfortable with the other entrepreneurs of the communal bank because of the respect, unity, and confidence that exists among the members.  

Peñalolén is located east of the metropolitan region.  It has attractive points of interest such as vines, buildings considered heritage sites, and natural sites which are transforming the community into a new tourism landscape within the metropolitan region.

loans.use: Comprará confites, galletas, papas fritas, dulces.

loans.name: Najah's Group

texts.en: This group is called Alsafa-Alqadsia and consists of 5 women; Najah, Nwal, Samah, Afrah and Mriam, who are hardworking and live in Sana`a, Yemen. They took out a loan of 180000 YER. Mriam is 20 years old, a single woman, and lives in Sana`a, Yemen. (She is the woman located in the centre of the photo.)  She applied for a youth loan of 40000 YER to buy a computer for her personel use. Her goal is to be able to continue working and that way be a successful small business owner.

loans.use: to buy a computer for personal use

loans.name: Artemia

texts.en:
Artemia is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Artemia sells spices and vegetables. She has had this business for six years. She has requested a loan of 5,000 to buy more spices and vegetables to sell.

Artemia is a new member of HSPI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and spices to sell

loans.name: Camino Al Exito Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Camino al Éxito” está conformado por 17 emprendedores quienes se dedican  a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales  se encuentran; venta de ropa, venta de abarrotes, verdulería, costuras, bazar, venta de juguetes, comida rápida, feriantes, venta de pan amasado, venta de ensaladas crudas y cocidas, servicios entre otros. Todos pertenecientes a la comuna de Colina, ubicada en la ciudad de Santiago.
Érica, integrante del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra sentada en primera fila, ocupando el cuarto lugar de derecha a izquierda, viste un blue jeans y un poleron de color rojo con letras negras y grises, en sus manos carga una carpeta y un bolsito, su cabello es de color negro y lo usa corto.
Ella se dedica al rubro de venta de bazar, desde hace 6 meses. Comenta que trabaja sola, su bazar lo ubica en una parte de su casa, trabaja de lunes a viernes y su horario lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad.
La mercadería que va necesitando en su bazar la compra en distribuidoras a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará hilos, agujas, útiles escolares, artículos de paquetería.
Las metas en su negocio son poder construir un local en el patio de su casa y contar con el permiso de la municipalidad, así tener toda su mercadería ordenada y que su clientela salga satisfecha de su local.
Érica vive junto a sus 2 hijas y su nieto. Sus sueños a nivel laboral son tener un negocio solido, en el cual le de satisfacción en lo económico y un buen bienestar a su familia.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Comenta que las capacitaciones han sido fundamentales para su negocio y también para su desarrollo personal, ya que ha aprendido a organizar y distribuir de mejor manera sus ingresos e inversiones.
Colina es una comuna de la región metropolitana (donde está Santiago, capital de Chile) ubicada al norte de la misma. Actualmente es centro de importantes inversiones, principalmente en el área agro industrial, debido a la instalación de grandes e importantes empresas, que de paso entregan un gran número de empleos a la comunidad. Es también un área de parcelaciones de agrado, lo que ha contribuido a aumentar considerablemente el número de habitantes. También cuenta con espacios adecuados al turismo, tales como termas, deporte en la Laguna Piedra Roja y montañismo.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Camino al Éxito” [Road to Success] comprises 17 entrepreneurs who undertake a variety of activities, among which are: selling clothing, groceries, vegetables, and games; dressmaking; running a shop; preparing and selling fast foods, bread dough, raw and cooked salads; selling at fairs; and others. All the members live in Colina, a community in Santiago.

Érica is the member of the communal bank who is seated in the first row in the fourth seat from right to left of the photo, wearing blue jeans and a red shirt with black and grey lettering, holding a folder and purse in her hands, and  whose hair is black and cut short. For 6 months, she has been selling at her shop. She says she works alone; her shop is located in her house, and she works Monday to Friday depending on her availability. She must purchase her merchandise from discount distributors so that her business is economically viable. She will use the loan to buy thread, needles, school supplies, and packing materials.

Her business goals are to build a space on her patio and obtain a city permit so that her merchandise can be displayed well and her customers are satisfied shopping there. Érica lives with her two daughters and a nephew. She dreams of having a stable business that will meet her financial needs and provide for her family's well-being. She is happy and grateful for the opportunity offered by Fondo Esperanza that will allow her to invest in her business. She says the training has been critical to her business and personal development, as she had learned to better organize, invest, and spend her income. 

Colina is located in the north of a metroplitan area (Santiago, the capital of Chile is located here). Today it is an important business center, primarily in agribusiness as large companies have set up offices here and brought many employees to the community. Country homes are common in the area, which has increased the number of residents considerably. There are also tourist attractions such as hot springs, water sports at Laguna Piedra Roja, and mountain climbing.

loans.use: to buy thread, needles, school supplies, and packing materials.

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma is 44 years old. She is married and lives in a small village in the Tbilisi District with her husband Valerian and their two children. The younger child studies in the village school, and the elder serves in the army. 

Irma and Valerian run the family agricultural business. They have a milking cow and produce cheese. Part of the cheese is used by the family members, and the rest is sold on the local open market.  Along with the agricultural business, Valerian works repairing cars and gets service fees for the work.

Irma requested a loan to build a house. They live in a rented house. With this loan, they will be able to purchase construction materials to start building the house. Thus, the family will have their own house, and their living conditions will improve. They will be able to spend their evenings after their hard-working days in a more comfortable environment. Irma hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to build a house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the gasoline.

loans.name: Bashir

texts.en: Bashir is 28 years old and married. He lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He is a hardworking person who makes sure he can provide for all the needs of his family. He has managed a store for nine years. He sells different products of spices in the community. He is requesting a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB to buy additional products of spices that he can offer in the community. He hopes to have another store.

loans.use: to buy additional products of spices that he can offer for his business.

loans.name: Satrah Group

texts.en:
This group called Satrah consists of two men, Abdullah and Manna, and one woman, Fathia. They are employers in Bank and live in Sana`a, Yemen.

Fathia is a 24-year-old married woman from Sana'a, Yemen.   She is an employer who is looking to improve her living conditions.  She is requesting a youth loan of 110,000 YER from AMB to purchase housewares for her house.

loans.use: to purchase housewares for her house.

loans.name: Zubaidh Group

texts.en:
This group is called Zubaidh and consists of 4 members Jlila, Amirh, Zubaidh and Walia who live in Sana`a, Yemen. 
Walia is a very active lady and performs her household duties very well by staying at home. She is a 29-year-old married woman and has 2 children who live in Sana`a, Yemen.
Walia has applied for a youth loan of 70,000 YER from AMB for further expansion of her tailoring business. She has great skills in her work and her clients are very satisfied with her work. With the loan investment she will buy a new sewing machine that will allow her to complete client orders on time and increase her profits. She is very much hopeful that she could enroll her children in school.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 39 years old and is married to Peter. They are blessed with four children.

She has been earning a living through poultry keeping and also has been selling beads for the past two years, earning a monthly income of KES. 30,000.

This will be her first loan from KADET LTD, and she plans to use it to purchase beads. The anticipated profit will be used  to pay school fees for her children. She hopes to have a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase beads for resale.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita  is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Mercedita has a food/retail shop, or sari-sari store, that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan for 5,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Mercedita has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Mercedita hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en: Marilou is a 37-year-old woman from Maribojoc, Bohol. She is married and has a son who is 3 years old. Marilou has been selling purified water, coconut wine, and soft drinks for 10 years now. She is also into raising cattle. She is asking for a loan to buy more coconut wine, purified water, and soft drinks for her customers. Marilou hopes that with more effort and dedication, she can continue to improve her business for her family. In the future, she hopes to have a bigger business so she can make enough money to send her child to school.

loans.use: To buy more coconut wine, purified water, and soft drinks

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en:
Yusuf, aged 38, is a married father. He has one child, who is dependent on him and still in primary school. He and his wife sell fish paste, grilled fish, and dried fish to make a living in a rural village of Msambweni district. He has been in his primary business for almost fifteen years. The main challenge for his family is the lessened demand for his product.

This is the sixth loan with Kiva's field partner, Yehu Microfinance, and he successfully paid back the past loans, which have helped his family increase business and the family's income. With a good business, he is requesting a loan with Yehu Microfinance. He will use this loan to buy more fish for his business. He hopes to increase his business and make a living better and keep his child in school.

loans.use: to buy more fish for his business.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 22 years old. He is married and lives in a small village of Telavi District with his wife, Nino. They run an agricultural business. They have a plot of land, where cucumber, tomatoes and potatoes are grown. They sell harvested products on the local open market.  They also have calves. George and Nino work hard but their income is hardly enough for food for two members of the family. The total average monthly income of the family is 200 Lari.

George requested a loan to purchase feed for the cattle. He will purchase hay, which will be used for feeding the calves during the fall and winter seasons. Hay is cheap now and the price increases by 30-40% in the fall months. George will save significantly on the cost of feeding the calves. The grown calves will be sold for a good price. Thus, he will be able to earn additional income. He will reinvest the additional earnings to expand his agricultural enterprise to make it more profitable, thereby improving the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase food for the cattle.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio is 49 years old, married, and lives in the Philippines. Rogelio has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. He has had this business for eight years.

He requested a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Rogelio became a member of HSPFI in 2012. In the future, Rogelio hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Purification

texts.en:
Purificacion is 69 years old and widowed with 10 children. Purificacion works very hard to provide for them.

Purificacion runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her store.

Purificacion has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other grocery items. 

In the future Purificacion would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Ghassan

texts.en:
Ghassan is a 54-year-old married man from Tulkarem and he has a family with three members. He has a farm for raising bees to produce honey to sell and his sons work on it.

He asked Ryada for funds in order to buy more bees and boxes to raise bees and increase the production of honey, thus improving his income and developing his project to be larger.

loans.use: to buy more bees and boxes

loans.name: Umeda

texts.ru: Умеда молодая женщина в возрасте 40лет, имеет двоих детей. Работает она в детской санатории  воспитательницей.Ее заработная плата очень маленькая и хватает только на семейные нужды.Дочка Умеды уже взрослая и скоро выходит замуж.По традиции родители невесты должны подготовить преданное.Умеда решила получить кредит и приобрести ювелирные изделия и один ковер на преданное своей дочки.Умеда очень надеется на нашу поддержку и заранее благодарит.
texts.en:
Umeda is a young woman, aged 40, with two children. She works in a children's sanatorium hospital. Her wages are very small and not enough for her family's needs. 

Umeda's daughter is already grown and is getting married soon. By tradition, the bride's parents should prepare a dowry. Umeda decided to get a loan and to buy jewelry and a carpet for her devoted daughter. 

Umeda has high hopes for our support and sends her thanks in advance.

loans.use: to buy items for her daughter's wedding

loans.name: Munavvarkhon

texts.ru: Мунавархон женщина с высшим экономическим образованием, работает по специальности бухгалтера в медицинской организации по поставке медикаментов.Она мать троих детей и дети уже взрослые и учатся в ВУЗе. Мунавархон дополнительно делает бухгалтерские отчеты на дому частных предпринимателей и зарабатывает немного денег её профессия очень востребована.Все что она зарабатывает все уходит на учебу детей и семейные нужды.Её привлекли в нашу организацию наши клиенты которые работают уже несколько лет с нашей организацией.Она хочет купить себе хорошую электрическую духовку, на которую накопила немного денег и ей не хватает.Сейчас Мунавархон запрашивает небольшую сумму и в будущем она планирует получить большую сумму на покупку квартиры.Её муж сейчас находится на заработках в РФ и когда он приедет семья собирается купить новую квартиру и тогда возможно ей понадобится крупный кредит.
texts.en: Munavvarkhon  is a woman with a higher economics education.  She works as an accountant at a medical organization that supplies medicines.  She is a mother of three children, all of whom are grown and attend a university.  Munavvarkhon  additionally does accounting work at homes of private entrepreneurs and earns some money this way because her profession is in high demand.  Everything that she earns get spent on her children's education and family needs.  She was referred to our organization by our clients, who have been working with us for several years.  She wants to purchase a good electric oven for herself, but does not have enough money for it.  Currently, Munavvarkhon is requesting a small amount and plans to obtain a larger sum in the future to purchase an apartment.  Her husband is currently working in the Russian Federation, and the family plans to purchase a new apartment when he returns, and she will probably need a large loan then.

loans.use: to purchase an electric oven

loans.name: Maui Dantu Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Maui Dantu” está conformado por 18 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; feriantes, venta de huevos, venta de ropa por catalogo, venta de ropa usada, semaneros, maquinas de entretención, ventas de pinches, servicios entre otros. Todos pertenecientes a la comuna de Independencia, ubicada en la ciudad de Santiago.
Griselda, presidenta del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie, en la última fila, ocupando el tercer lugar de derecha a izquierda, viste una chaqueta de color negro, y su pelo lo usa tomado y es de color castaño oscuro.
Ella se dedica  al rubro de comida rápida, desde hace 6 años, y ahora ultimo agregó venta de ropa de mujer, como chalecos. Comenta que trabaja en su casa de martes a domingo y su horario es de las 11ºº hasta la 01ºº horas de la madrugada. Su comida se especializa en venta de completos, churrascos, papas fritas y tiene bastante clientela.
Su mercadería la compra en la vega que es un  abastecimiento de productos y verduras a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito Sus metas son tener la posibilidad de hacer un local, más amplio para recibir a su clientela, así con esto generar mayores ingresos y brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
Griselda vive junto a su esposo y 2 hijas de 15 y 11 años de edad. Sus sueños a nivel laboral son crecer en su negocio, ya que con estos ingresos puede ayudar a su hija de 15 años de edad para comprar sus medicamentos, ya que su estado de salud está bastante complicado.
Ella está muy agradecida y contenta de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio.
Además se siente muy cómoda con la compañía de las demás emprendedoras del grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que comparten diferentes actividades, intereses, lo cual le ha servido como un momento de distracción.
Independencia es una de las 34 comunas que componen la ciudad de Santiago (capital de Chile), ubicada en el sector centro-norte. Surgió a fines del siglo XIX como un sector tradicional de la ciudad. Su eje principal es la Av. Independencia, por la cual pasaba el antiguo Camino del Inca, puerta de entrada por el norte, a la ciudad de Santiago. Dada su amplia población indígena, en Independencia se encuentra el Centro Cultural Indígena de Chile. Cuenta también con importantes construcciones históricas, entre ellas 6 monumentos históricos de Chile.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Maui Dantu”.  It is comprised of 18 entrepreneurs who carry out various lines of work among which are found:  stall holders, selling eggs, selling clothes by catalog, selling used clothes, bracelets, slot machines, hair clips, and services, among others.  All of them are from the Independencia community in the city of Santiago.

Griselda is the president of the communal bank.  In the photo she is standing in the last row, and she is the third person from right to left.  She is wearing a black jacket, and her dark brown hair is pulled back.  She has been selling fast food for six year.  She has recently added the sale of women’s clothes like vests.  

She says that she works at her house Tuesday through Sunday from 11:00 a.m. until 1:00 a.m.  She specializes in hot dogs, barbecue, and French fries.  She has plenty of customers.

Her goal for the loan is to have a bigger place in order to receive more customers.  This way she will generate more income and give her family a better quality of life.

Griselda lives with her husband and her two children, ages 15 and 11.  Her dream for her work is to grow as a business.  With this income she can help her 15 year old by purchasing her medications.  The state of her health is very complex.

She is very grateful and happy about the opportunity granted to her from Fond Esperanza.  It has allowed her to invest in her business.  Also, she is very comfortable in the company of the other entrepreneurs in her communal bank.  They share different activities and interests, which have served to pass the time pleasantly.

Independencia is one of 34 communities that make up Santiago, the Chilean capital. It is located in the north-central section. In the 19th century, Independencia emerged as one of the more traditional sectors of the city. The main thoroughfare is Independencia Avenue, which served as the old Incan Road and the gateway to the north from the city of Santiago. Given the growing indigenous population, Independencia is known as the "Indigenous Cultural Center of Chile". It also has important historical sites, including six Chilean historical monuments.

loans.use: to buy hot dogs, bread, mayonnaise, barbecue sauce, mustard, and a variety of women's vests.

loans.name: Samer

texts.en:
Samer is 32 years old and comes from Nablus. He is a married man and has two daughters.

Samer owns an ice cream shop and has been working in this field for seven years and has owned his shop since 2009. He asked Ryada for this loan to buy an automatic ice-cream maker.

He hopes that this loan will help him improve his income and improve the quality of his ice-cream. He has the only ice-cream place in the area.

loans.use: to buy an automatic ice-cream maker

loans.name: Oyunchimeg

texts.en:
Oyunchimeg, 40, is a hairdresser and owns a barbershop in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. She has been operating her business for over 6 years nonstop. In the past, she had so many permanent customers and most of them still say “she is one of the skilful hairdressers in Ulaanbaatar.” Oyunchimeg has one daughter and now she lives with her younger sister and her husband in a common apartment.

In the last several years, Oyunchimeg's barbershop has not had any renovations at all. Its wall is damaged and it has a heat loss problem. She says it is a big problem for her business and makes it difficult to run it normally, especially in winter. Also it reduces the number of her customers. In the winter, she uses a coal firing furnace in her shop just to stay warm. For this reason, she wants to repair her shop. First, she is planning to repair the walls and put insulation in with foam boards and cement. She hopes it will be more comfortable and better after the repairs. She is planning to complete this project before the coming winter. She is requesting a loan to buy some building materials to put wall insulation in her shop. Please, let’s help her to save her business!

loans.use: To buy some building materials to put wall insulation in her barbershop.

loans.name: Ketevan

texts.en:
Ketevan is 59 years old. She lives in a small village in Mtskheta District with her family: her husband, Nugzar, and her 33-year-old son. Her son works on the constructions and gets service fees for his work. Ketevan and Nugzar earn their living in an agricultural business. They have a milking cow and produce cheese. They sell milk and cheese in their village. Ketevan also works as a nurse and earns a monthly salary. 

Ketevan requested a loan for purchasing an additional milking cow. Thus, she wants to expand her agricultural business. With two milking cows, Ketevan will be able to increase her cheese production. This will positively influence the income of the family. With increased income, Ketevan and Nugzar will increase their agricultural business in order to make it more profitable. Thus, the family’s living conditions will improve. Ketevan and Nugzar hope for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase a milking cow

loans.name: Ketevan

texts.en:
Ketevan is 40 years old. She lives in a small village in the Tetritskaro District with her 18 years old son, brother and sister-in-law. Ketevan’s son is a student. 

Ketevan and her family members are busy with their agricultural business. They have two milking cows, two calves, three pigs and 15 hens. They produce cheese and sell it on the local open market. They sell piglets and hens in nearby villages as well. Along with their agricultural business, Ketevan works in a hospital as a nurse and gets a monthly salary.

Ketevan has requested a loan to finance the studies of her son. With this loan her son will be able to continue his studies at the institute. An educated son is a guarantor of a good future. As a result of the above mentioned activity, the living conditions of the family will improve.

loans.use: to finance the studies of her son

loans.name: Moreen

texts.en:
Moreen is married and the mother of four children, all of whom are still in school. With four dependents, she owns an internet café where she provides different services. In addition, Moreen owns a motorcycle and has hired a gentle man to operate it. Her husband is a medical officer. Her customer base is large and diverse, composed of students and the general public. 

With the goal of meeting customer demand and maximizing her profit, she has requested a loan to service her computers. Moreen would like to help pay for the education of her children and put money aside as savings. Her goal is to set up other businesses to increase her income.This is her third loan with both Yehu and Kiva. She is really grateful for the support given and she hopes to be applying for more loans so as to get ahead.

loans.use: to service her computers.

loans.name: Chhoem

texts.en: Chhoem is 41 years old, married and has four children – two of whom are married. She earns a living by working hard at a farming business while her husband works in construction, making wooden houses. Her husband has a good reputation and works for many clients around Kampot province. Chhoem wants to raise her household income by going into the business of raising pigs. Because she does not have enough money to do this, she is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders to build a pen and buy piglets for fattening. Chhoem hopes that that this will allow her to uplift her family out of poverty someday and educate her children.

loans.use: to build a pen and purchase piglets for fattening.

loans.name: Akpar

texts.en: Akpar is a leader who always realizes all his plans. He is clever and has his own business. For the past 30 years, he has been busy with his transportation business. He has his own minibus and transports the local people from one place to another. Akpar always takes part in the conversations of businessmen and gives his ideas. His skills help him to develop his business, but his income isn't enough for improving his living conditions. Akpar has 4 brainy children and a lovely wife. He must comfort them with all necessary things alone. His elder son is going to get married, but he doesn't have his own house. Akpar wants to build a house for his son. He is asking for a loan to buy building materials for constructing a house. He awaits your help and mercy.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as cement and wood

loans.name: Natela

texts.en:
Natela is 56 years old. She lives in a small village of Telavi District with her husband – David. They are busy with trading. They purchase secondhand clothing in Tbilisi (Capital of Georgia) and then sell them in nearby villages. The clothes are of good quality and they have no problems with selling. 

Natela requested a credit for purchasing seasonal clothes for resale. She will offer a wide assortment of clothes to the customers. This will increase her sales and consequently, her profit. She will reinvest part of the profit in the same business, and the other part will be used for improving family living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal clothes for resale

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en: Zipporah is 30 years old, from Naivasha and is married with two children who are both in school. She has a green grocery business which she has been running for the past 5 years. She has applied for her first loan from KADET LTD to enable her buy more stocks of onions, tomatoes and green peppers for sale. She hopes to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of onions, tomatoes and green peppers for sale.

loans.name: Nanuli

texts.en:
Nanuli is 55 years old. She lives in a small village of Akhmeta District with her husband – Eldar. They earn their living through agricultural business. In particular, they are busy with farming. They have a vineyard and a plot of land where maize is grown. They work hard on their agricultural land to get good harvests. They sell harvested products on the local open market. They also have a milking cow and 15 beehives with bee colonies. Nanuli and Eldar produce honey and cheese and sell them on the local open market as well. Along with the agricultural business, Eldar works in vine factory and gets a monthly salary. Total average monthly income of the family is 450 Lari. 

Nanuli requested a loan for purchasing an additional milk cow. With two milk cows she will be able to produce more cheese. Thus, she wants to expand her business in order to earn a good profit. With increased profits, she will be able to reinvest in her agricultural business, as well as spend more on the family’s daily needs and the living conditions of the family will be improved.

loans.use: to purchase a milking cow

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Femme d’un mécanicien, âgée de 39ans Madame Yawoa est maman d’01 enfant de 04ans qui va à l’école. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu les produits de premières nécessités (riz, huile végétale, sucre…)et des condiments(oignons) depuis 2007 dans une boutique. Pour accroitre son activité, elle sollicité de WAGES un troisième crédit pour s’approvisionner en marchandises au grand marché de Lomé. Elle veut augmenter son capital et assurer le bien – être de la famille.
texts.en: Yawoa, the wife of a mechanic, is 39 years old. She is mother to one child, who is four years old and goes to school. She has had an income-generating activity, selling basic food products (rice, vegetable oil, sugar) and condiments (onions) in a shop, since 2007. In order to expand her business, she is requesting a third loan from WAGES to get fresh supplies from Lomé's Grand Market. She wants to increase her capital and ensure her family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers for the vegetables

loans.name: Asha

texts.en: Asha is 41 years old, married and lives with her husband and one child in a rural part of the Msambweni district of Mombasa. She earns a living by running a retail shop, while her husband runs a battery-charging business. The family earns about KES 400 a day, which allows her to feed her family as well as save about KES 200. She is applying for her first loan from Kiva’s partner, Yehu Microfinance, for KES 25,000 to buy more items to sell in her store. She hopes this loan will allow her to increase her family’s business and earn enough income to provide her family with a higher standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Genevey

texts.en: Genevey is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines with her husband and three children. She earns a living by running a food/retail (or sari-sari store) where she buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care items, home use products and beverages. She has been in this line of work for five years, and is requesting a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell to her customers. Genevey joined HSPFI earlier this year as a way to improve her business and pay for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Revendeuse de nourriture depuis 2008, Madame Akossiwa exerce son activité dans une école. Elle est mère de deux enfants âgés de 25 et 22ans. Elle veut acheter des ingrédients pour son commerce et sollicite de WAGES son deuxième crédit. Elle veut ravitailler les denrées alimentaires avec les profits réalisés. Elle veut arriver à se tailler une bonne place dans la restauration et subvenir aux besoins de la famille sur tous les plans. Son conjoint est employé dans une société et elle est âgée de 46ans.
texts.en: Akossiwa has been a food retailer since 2008 and carries out her activity in a school. She is mother to two children, who are 25 and 22 years old. She wants to buy ingredients for her business and is requesting her second loan from WAGES. She wants to get fresh supplies of food with the profits she makes. She would like to carve out a good position for herself in the restauration business and provide for her family's needs on all levels. Her husband is a company employee and she is 46 years old.

loans.use: to buy food products;

loans.name: Tahmina

texts.ru: Тахмина женщина возрасте 31 года, мать троих детей.Занимается завозом и продажей женской одежды. Муж Тахмины на заработках в Российской Федерации, и каждый месяц присылает ей деньги на семейные  расходы.Она уже 10 лет , как занимается этим видом деятельности.Она мечтает чтобы ее дети учились в хороших учебных заведениях чтобы в будущем были обеспеченны работой.Она очень старается достичь своей цели поэтому хочет расширить свой бизнес и накопить денег на учебу.  На полученный кредит она планирует привезти  летнюю партию женской одежды.
texts.en: Tahmina is a 31-year-old mother of three children. Her business is selling women's clothing. Tahmina's husband is working in Russia and sends her money for family expenses each month. Tahmina has been in the clothing business for over 10 years. She dreams of supporting her children to study in good academic institutions, ensuring their future employment. Tahmina is working hard towards this goal, and wants to expand her business and save money for her children's education. With her loan funds, she plans to purchase women's clothing for the summer season.

loans.use: purchase of summer women's clothing

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en: Rowena  is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines with her husband and eight children. She earns a living by running a food/retail (or sari-sari) store where she buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care items, home use products and beverages. She has been in business for six years, and is requesting a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more items to sell to her customers. Rowena joined HSPFI earlier this year as way to improve her business and pay for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 28 years old, and she has three children. She is in a common-law marriage, and she lives with her life partner in Tiribe, Southern Coast of Kenya.

Susana established her own business one and a half years ago. She has a boutique where she sells a variety of beauty products. She has kept the business stable during this time, and it has gone well for her. Her sales have been maintained. In addition to this business, Susana has a store where she sells household utensils.

She has invested a previous loan from Yehu, and it has helped her to increase her inventory. She is currently requesting a KES 40,000 loan to stock the products that she does not have in her inventory. With this investment she will always have products to offer her customers.

Her goal is to expand the business. She is thinking of adding the sale of used clothes and more cosmetics in order to have more customers and increase the family income.

loans.use: to purchase clothes.

loans.name: Mwanatumu

texts.en:
Mwanatumu, aged 56, is a married mother of three children. She sells fish paste, grilled fish, and dried fish to make a living in a rural village of Msambweni district. She also earns extra income from selling clothes from her home. She has been in her primary business for almost ten years. The main challenge for her family is the lessened demand for her product.

This is her first loan with Kiva's field partner, Yehu Microfinance, which will help her family increase business and the family's income. As she has a good business, she is requesting a loan with Yehu Microfinance. She will use this loan to buy more fish for her business. She hopes to increase her business and make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy more fish for her business.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is 47 years old. She is married and lives in a small village of Telavi District with her family: her husband: Revaz, her parents-in-law, her son and daughter-in-law and two grandchildren (2 and 5 years old). Her parents-in-law are pensioners and her husband and son work in private companies. They are distributors and get a monthly salary. The family runs an agricultural business as well. They have a vineyard, in fall they pick grapes and sell them on the local open market. Nino also, is busy with trading. She sells clothes and shoes in Telavi market. 

Fatima requested a loan to increase her stock. Because of the high demand for her products, she plans to purchase more clothes and shoes. This will increase her sales and Fatima will be able to improve the living conditions of the family. With an increased income she will be able to reinvest in her business to expand it and make it more profitable. She hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to increase her stock for trading.

loans.name: Mazbut

texts.ru: Мазбуд 52 летний мужчина, отец двоих сыновей, жена домохозяйка. По профессии Мазбуд работает учителем в местной школе , преподаёт уроки физики.Из-за того, что его заработной  платы не хватает на жизнь, он уже несколько лет занимается животноводством.Когда Мазбуд на работе , за скотом ухаживает его жена.Его жена тоже знает все про животноводство. Для увеличения поголовья скота Мазбуд решил получить кредит и расширить свой бизнес
texts.en: Mazbut is a 52-year-old father of two sons. His wife is a homemaker and he is a physics teacher at the local school. However, because Mazbut and his family cannot live on his teacher's salary alone, for the last several years he has also been raising livestock. While Mazbut works, his wife looks after the animals. She is also very knowledgeable about raising livestock. Mazbut has decided to take out a loan to increase the number of cattle in his herd and expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Fikret

texts.ru: Fikret jivet v Baku regione vmeste so svoyey jenoy i detmi. On jenat i imeyet 2 prekrasnix detey. Fikret 37 let. Uje 7 let kak on rabotayet elektrikom. Fikret nujdayetsya v 1500 AZN chtobi kupit nujniye instrumenti dlya yego raboti. On nujdayetsya v xoroshix instrumentax chtobi uludshit svoyu deyatelnost i zdelat novshestva v svoyey rabote. Fikret nujdayetsya v uvelicheniye svoix mesachnix doxodov tak kak u nego yest bolnaya mama kotoroy on kajdiy mesac pokupayet dorogiye lekarstva dlya yeyo lecheniya na chto yemu ne xvatayet deneg.
texts.en: Fikret is 37 years old and lives in Baku region with his wife and two beautiful children. He has been an electrician for the last seven years. Fikret needs 1500 Azeri Manats (AZN) to buy new tools for his work. He needs good tools to improve his work and do new things on the job. Fikret needs to increase his monthly profits as his mother is sick; each month he buys expensive medicine for her and he doesn't have enough money for it.

loans.use: to purchase tools

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino is 33 years old. She is married and lives in a small village of Telavi District with her family: her husband Mikheil and her parents-in-law. The family runs an agricultural business. They have a milking cow and produce yogurt. They sell yogurt on the local open market and in nearby villages usig their own car. Also, they have a vineyard and produce wine. Along with agricultural activities, Nino works as an accountant and gets a service fee for the work. Mikheil is an engineer of medical equipment/techniques and earns additional income for the family. Nino’s mother-in-law is a teacher. She teaches in the village school and gets a monthly salary.
 
Nino requested a loan to install a gas tank in the family car. This will decrease the cost of transportation and will increase the income of the family. With the increased income she will be able to finance the education of her child. As a result of Kiva loan the family will have better living conditions.

loans.use: to install a gas tank in the car.

loans.name: Margalita

texts.en:
Margalita is 49 years old. She lives in the village of Mukhiani, West Georgia with her husband Elguja and her 31-year-old daughter. The family earns a living through a small-scale agricultural business. They grow melons and greens on a family owned plot of land. Margarita and Elguja sell the harvested products on local open market. Margalita requested loan from local financial institutions several times for an agricultural business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time, because of their low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The monthly income of the family doesn’t exceed 200 Laris. It is hardly enough for food for a three-member family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Margalita requested loan from Credo to construct a greenhouse. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-start-up credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With the received credit Margalita will purchase needed materials (wooden pillars and polyethylene) and construct the greenhouse. She will grow tomatoes and greens there during the whole year. The income of the family won’t be seasonal any more and they will be able to get increased income during the whole year. It will positively reflect on the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase materials to construct a greenhouse.

loans.name: Jonah

texts.en:
Jonah is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children.

Jonah is buying and selling recyclable materials in her community. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy more recyclable materials to resell.
