Jonah has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, she hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy more recyclable materials to resell.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
Doña Verónica, tiene 56 años de edad, casada, tiene 1 hijo, vive en una aldea de Santa cruz de Yojoa. 
Desde hace 4 años se motivo a establecer una pulpería (venta de productos de la canasta básica familiar, como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, sal, manteca, condimentos, jabón, pastas etc.), ya que su casa esta en buena ubicación,  y su negocio tiene buena clientela aprovecha a vender refrescos, jugos, churros, confites, pan, otras cosas que necesitan los clientes, Este negocio ha sido rentable, de éste obtiene los ingresos necesarios para cubrir los gastos de hogar.
 Con ODEF solicito un préstamo de 6,000 lempiras, para invertir en su negocio en compra de productos alimenticios, como arroz, azúcar, manteca, frijoles, maseca, carnes, lácteos, embutidos, refrescos, golosinas etc. Esta inversión le ayuda a incrementar sus ingresos.
Esta agradecida con la ayuda que le han brindado con el financiamiento, y piensa seguir trabajando para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Verónica, age 56, is married and has one child.  She lives in the village of Santa Cruz de Yojoa.

Four years ago she was motivated to establish a grocery store (selling basic needs products like rice, beans, sugar, salt, lard, condiments, soap, and pastas, etc.).  She did this because her house is in a good location.  Her business has good customers, and she takes the opportunity to sell soft drinks, juices, churros, candy, bread, and other things her customers need.  This business has been profitable.  From her business she receives the income needed to cover the household expenses.

She has requested a loan for 6,000 lempiras from ODEF to invest in her business.  She will use the loan to buy food products like rice, sugar, lard, beans, instant corn flour, meat, dairy products, soft drinks, and candy, etc.  This investment helps her to increase her income.

She is grateful for the help given to her by the loan.  She plans to continue working in order to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy food products like rice, sugar, lard, beans, instant corn flour, meat, dairy products, soft drinks, and candy, etc. in order to stock her business.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.es:
Nelson es un muchacho de 37  años de edad el cual vive con su  familia, en una comunidad llamada Osa, localizada en Caña Blancal,  ubicada en la provincia de Puntarenas. Está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona rural muy visitada por sus lindas  playas, su diversidad de vida silvestre y otras atracciones naturales.  Sus principales actividades económicas son las turísticas y agropecuarias.

Nelson trabaja ofreciendo el servicio de transporte público con su vehículo dentro y fuera de su comunidad,  necesita comprar algunos repuestos para mejorar el estado del mismo y  dar mejor servicio a sus clientes y por supuesto obtener mayores ingresos, ya que la única entrada de dinero en su hogar es la suya, y tiene varias necesidades económicas las cuales solo con trabajo puede solventar.

Nelson cuenta con el  apoyo de sus vecinos ya que usan sus servicios  frecuentemente. El está solicitando un micro crédito de quinientos mil colones (¢500.000) para comprar repuestos , reparar su vehículo y pagar la mano de obra.

Nelson es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Caña Blancal, una de las 110 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Con este préstamo se espera crecer más a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Nelson is a 37-year-old young man who lives with his family in a community called Osa, located in Caña Blancal, which is in the province of Puntarenas. This community is known for being a highly visited rural area, because of its beautiful beaches, its wildlife diversity, and other natural attractions. Its main economic activities are tourism and agriculture.

Nelson works offering public transportation services with his vehicle inside and out of his community. He needs to buy some spare parts in order to improve his vehicle's condition, give his customers a better service, and of course obtain higher income, since he is the only source of income in his household and he has several financial needs which he cannot cover through his work alone.

Nelson has the support of his neighbors, since they use his services often. He is requesting a 500,000 colones microloan in order to purchase spare parts, repair his vehicle, and pay for labor. 

Nelson belongs to the communal bank Caña Blancal, one of EDESA's 110 partner organizations in Costa Rica. He hopes this loan will allow him to grow on a personal and financial level. Thanks to this kind of organizations and lending resources he can improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his vehicle

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.es:
Rodrigo es soltero y no tiene hijos, vive en la casa de sus padres ocupando una habitación, la casa esta ubicada en la zona Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja como cocinero por más de ocho horas al día  en una empresa privada ya que debe ayudar con los pagos de alimentación y servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para el pago de matricula de  sus estudios de diseño grafico ya que con lo que gana no le alcanza para el pago de sus estudios.
El sueño de Rodrigo es mejorar sus ingresos y poder independizarse para mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Rodrigo is single and has no children. He lives at his parents’ house where he occupies one room. The house is located in the District of Tembladerani in the city of La Paz.

Rodrigo currently works as a cook for more than eight hours a day at a private business. This job helps to pay for food and basic services for his family. The loan he is requesting will be used to pay the tuition for his studies in graphic design. He does not earn enough to pay for his studies.

Rodrigo dreams of improving his income and becoming independent so that he can improve his quality of life. This is the first time he is requesting a loan from IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to pay the tuition for his studies.

loans.name: Sorbon

texts.en:
Sorbon is a man who works hard from early morning until late in the evening. Many children know him as "milky uncle". Sorbon has been busy with animal husbandry for more than fifteen years. He has his own farm near his house. There are many cows and sheep on his farm. He has enough experience to develop his business. 

Sorbon's lovely wife helps him with the business. They have four children, all of whom are schoolboys. Sorbon must work hard, because his children demand more benefits. He is going to build an additional building for his farm, because the number of his cattle is greater than last year. Sorbon is asking for a loan to buy building materials. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as cement and wood.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 34-year-old married man who lives with his family in a home that lacks both electricity and piped water. He supports his family by operating a clothing sale business, selling door to door. His wife helps him while their two children attend local primary school. He usually sells men's and women's clothes and jackets. In July, a majority of his customers need more jackets since this is a cold season, so Hassan needs more clothes to sell to meet his customer demands.

He has requested a loan of KES 10,000 from Yehu to purchase bundles of clothes to resell. His wish is to own a boutique and ensure that his children acquire a quality education.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes to resell.

loans.name: Khatuna

texts.en:
Khatuna is 29 years old; she is married and lives in a small village of Akhmeta District with her husband, Zurab. Khatuna and Zurab are busy with an agricultural business. They have a milking cow and produce cheese. They also own a plot of land, where cereals are grown. They sell harvested products on the local open market. The total average monthly income of the family is 500 Lari.

Khatuna requested a loan to purchase an additional milk cow and a calf. Khatuna and Zurab will be able to produce more cheese. This will increase their sales and the family will get additional income. With the increased income they plan to expand their business. They are very hard-working people and take good care of their livestock. Taking into consideration the above mentioned, the living conditions of the family will improve.

loans.use: to purchase an additional milk cow and a calf.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon sells groceries in his grocery store that is located in a strategic place along one of the busy streets. He is 30 years old and is married to a business woman. He has two children who are currently in education. 

Simon is requesting his first loan from Yehu. He is requesting this loan in order to buy fruits and vegetables so that he can better satisfy the needs of his customers. Simon launched his business in 2009 and at times his cousin helps him with his activities. He hopes to use the profits gained from this capital to open a kiosk and a second store so that he can see his family prosper.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Roel Jim

texts.en:
Roel Jim is 25 years old, single, and lives in the Philippines. Roel Jim is providing motorela or motorcycle services. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the services.

Roel Jim became a member of HSPFI in 2012. In the future,Roel Jim hopes to improve his services.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline.

loans.name: Zurab

texts.en:
Zurab is 40 years old. He is married and lives in a small village of Telavi District with his wife, Natalia, and a mother, who is a pensioner. Zurab and Natalia have a vineyard. They work hard on their plot during the spring and summer seasons to get a good harvest. They pick grapes in fall and Zurab takes the harvested grapes to the wine factory to sell. Along with his agricultural business, Zurab offers taxi services to local population in his own car. Thus, he earns additional income for the family.
 
Zurab requested a loan to purchase a car. He will purchase a better car and will be able to provide better quality service to his passengers and become more competitive. Zurab will use the increased profit for the well-being of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a new car.

loans.name: Mishi

texts.en:
When Mishi first opened her cosmetics stall at Msambweni market in Mombasa a year ago, she found that demand for the products she carried grew quickly. She can attribute much of her success since then to her excellent rapport with her customers and high receptiveness to their suggestions. “I receive a lot of help from my customers. In this business, particularly, you have to treat people well, and then they’ll come back.”

Before she began selling “everything for the woman,” as she describes it, Mishi sold vegetables at the market, but she had a strong desire to start her own business. She knew that she had the customer service skills, as well as the strong work ethic, to open her own stall. Mishi sells her products at the market from Monday to Sunday.
 
Mishi learned about Yehu Microfinance a year ago from a friend that also operates a stall. This is Mishi’s second loan with Yehu Microfinance, and she will use the KES 30,000 to increase her inventory. By making monthly trips to Mombasa town, she will be able to purchase more goods at a cheaper price to bring back to her customers in Msambweni. She hopes that the loan and her increased earnings will allow her to hire an employee to help manage the stall.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for her cosmetics stall business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stock of sugar, flour and meat for the business.

loans.name: Mussarat's Group

texts.en:
Mussarat is a housewife, staying at home and handling her household responsibilities. She is very active and has raised her children very well. All four of her children are continuing their education by going to a nearby school.

Mussarat's husband is a rickshaw driver and provides transport services to his passengers. He is a very safe driver and takes care of his passengers very well during travel. Mussarat has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her husband, who wants to repair his autorickshaw. By doing that he will be able to provide better-quality transport services to his passengers and increase his income.

loans.use: To repair an autorickshaw for a transport business

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en: Emelita is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. Emelita  has a sari-sari store, or food/retail shop, where she sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for  5,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Emelita has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, she hopes to improve her business to pay for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Milka

texts.en:
Milka is 34 years old. She is married to Isaac and together they have two children. She is a livestock broker and has been in the business for the past 13 years. She gets a monthly income of KES 20,000 from the business.

This is her 12th loan from KADET Ltd. She paid back all her previous loans well and in good time.She was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a credit officer. She will use the loan amount to purchase two cows to rear for resale.

She hopes to purchase a truck to assist her in transportation.

loans.use: to purchase two cows to rear for resale.

loans.name: Melina

texts.en:
Melina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

NWTF is listing Melina's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. Rosalia  has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has had this business for seven years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 5,000  to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Rosalia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rosalia hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Astghik

texts.en:
Astghik is still managing her agricultural business. Thanks to the business she is able to pay for her son’s education and to fulfil part of her family’s needs. Astghik shares with us that now her daughter is married and she lives separately from her parents. 

Astghik used her first Kiva loan to buy seedlings of new potato varieties. This allowed her to improve her income from sales of agricultural products. Now she needs a 900,000 AMD loan to buy a plot of land where she will plant potatoes, haricots, tomatoes, cucumbers and also an orchard. This will allow her to develop her agricultural business and thus to increase her family’s income in the future.

loans.use: To buy a plot of land where she will plant potatoes, haricots, tomatoes, cucumbers and also an orchard.

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur is 20 years old. He lives in a small village of Marneuli District with his parents. The family runs an agricultural business. They have a plot of land, where potatoes are grown. The family also has milking cows, calves and pigs. They are very hard-working people and take good care of their livestock.  On the local open market they sell the potatoes they harvest and also the dairy products, cheese and curds, which they make. 

Artur requested a loan to purchase calves and food for them. He will purchase hay, which will be used to feed the cattle during the fall and winter seasons. He will raise the calves and then sell them for a good price. This will increase the income of the family. As a result, Artur will be able to create better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to purchase calves and food for them.

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Revendeuse de chaussures à domicile, Madame Akouvi est âgée  de 28ans. Elle a en charge un enfant de 04ans qui ne fréquente pas pour le moment. Son conjoint est également revendeur. Elle veut augmenter son commerce, assurer l’éducation de son enfant c’est pour cela, elle sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour s’approvisionner en marchandises afin d’atteindre cet objectif.
texts.en:
Mrs. Akouvi, age 28, is a shoe reseller working from her home. She has a 4-year-old dependent child who does not yet go to school. Her spouse is also a reseller.

To expand her business and provide for her child’s education, she is seeking a first loan from WAGES. She will use the credit to stock up on merchandise, which will help her to attain her goals.

loans.use: to buy shoes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
Gabriela es una joven de 22 años de edad y vive con su abuela y su pequeño hijo de dos años de edad en la comunidad de San Rafael de Florencia de San Carlos, en la provincia de Alajuela. Esta comunidad rural presenta mucho potencial de desarrollo a través de las actividades agrícolas. La zona  posee un clima caliente, lo que permite la producción de ciertas frutas que se desarrollan con más fuerza gracias a  este tipo de clima  como el mango, el melón y otros propios de la zona, también se destaca actividades  tales como el ganado de engorde.
La localidad de Florencia se caracteriza por sus parques nacionales y su extensa variedad en la flora y en la fauna. 
Gabriela trabaja desde su casa porque debe cuidar tanto a su abuela como a su hijo, ella tiene un proyecto que es un  taller de costura pero solo tiene una máquina de coser  ,  solicita un crédito de quinientos mil colones (¢500.000) para ampliar su equipo, necesita otra máquina overlock, telas, hilos, accesorios entre otros materiales.
Ella es miembro de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de SCSAR S.A, este será su primer préstamo razón por la cual está  muy agradecida, por las oportunidades  de acceso al crédito que esta le brinda y poder llevar a cabo sus proyecto.
texts.en:
Gabriela is a young woman, 22 years old, who lives with her grandmother and small child, aged 2, in the community of San Rafael in the district of Florencia, in the  canton of San Carlos in Alajuela Province. This rural community shows great potential for development through its farming activities. The area has a warm climate which encourages the production of certain fruits that are better adapted to this type of weather, such as mangoes, melons and others that are native to the area. Other activities, such as stock breeding also stand out. 

The Florencia area is known for its national parks and its extensive variety of flora and fauna.

Gabriela works from her home because she has to take care of her grandmother as well as her child. She has a sewing workshop but only has one sewing machine and is requesting a loan of 500,000 colones to expand her equipment. She needs another overlock machine, fabric, thread and accessories, among other items.

She is a member of the Empresa de Credito Communal Bank of SCSAR S.A. This will be her first loan and she is very grateful for the opportunity to access the loan that is being offered to her and for being able to bring her project to fruition.

loans.use: to produce clothing.

loans.name: Akouavi

texts.fr: Femme d’un tailleur et mère de 03 enfants tous à l’école,  Madame Akouavi est revendeuse depuis 2006 de friperies à domicile et de façon ambulante. Pour mieux répondre aux besoins de ses clients, elle sollicite de WAGES son premier prêt pour acheter des habits au marché de HEDZRANAWOE. Elle voudrait dans l’avenir augmenter son stock et voir sa famille s’épanouir.
texts.en:
Mrs. Akouavi is married to a tailor. The couple have three children who all go to school. She has been a reseller of second-hand clothing since 2006, working from her home and door-to-door. 

To meet the needs of her customers, she is seeking a first loan from WAGES to buy clothing at the market of HEDZRANAWOE. Her goals for the future are to bolster her stock and ensure her family’s well-being.

loans.use: to buy used clothing for resale.

loans.name: Meach

texts.en:
Meach is 48 years old, a resident of Siem Reap province, where she owns and manages a farming business. She cultivates annual crops, primarily planting rice for sale each harvesting season. At the same time, Meach is also a rice trader who purchases rice in bulk from local villagers during the harvesting season, and then resells it for a profit. 

Due to the lack of funds to invest in her rice trading business, Meach is now asking for a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a stock of rice for future sale. With the increase in her income, Meach will invest in a hog-raising business in order to double her income. She promises to pay back her loan in full.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of rice for future sale.

loans.name: Villa Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Villa Esperanza” está conformado por 17 emprendedores que se dedican al rubro del comercio, específicamente venta de ropa, venta de calzado, transporte, feriantes, taxi, colectivos, camioneros, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos perteneciente a la comuna de el Bosque, ubicada en la cuidad de Santiago.
Encarnación, integrante del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra sentada en tercera fila de derecha a izquierda, viste una chaqueta de color negra, su cabello es de color castaño oscuro y lo usa tomado.
Ella se dedica al rubro de venta de pallet (es una estructura de agrupación de carga, fabricada generalmente con madera. La funcionalidad del pallet, es el transportar carga, generalmente, fruta. Por lo mismo, los pallet, tiene forma rectangular o cuadrada. Esto es, para que sea más fácil su manipulación), desde hace 7 años. Comenta que trabaja con la ayuda de su marido y su hijo, su taller lo ubica en su casa y su horario es de la 9ºº hasta las 13ºº y luego de 14ºº a 17.30ºº horas de lunes a viernes.
Su mercadería la compra en grandes empresas y distribuidoras como material reciclable, a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará solamente clavos.
Sus metas en su negocio son crecer más, para generar mayores ingresos, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Encarnación vive junto a su esposo quien la ayuda en las ventas, y 2 hijos de 19 y 23 años de edad. Sus sueños son poder entregar material a grandes empresas, ya que por el momento trabajan con intermediarios que trabajan para las empresas.
Ella está muy agradecida y contenta de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Comenta que las capacitaciones han sido fundamentales para su negocio y también para su desarrollo personal, ya que ha aprendido a organizar y distribuir de mejor manera sus ingresos e inversiones.
El Bosque es una comuna emplazada en el sector sur de Santiago (capital de Chile). En esta comuna se encuentran la Base Aérea El Bosque y la Escuela de Aviación Capitán Ávalos, concentrando el grueso de la actividad aeronáutica de esta rama de las Fuerzas Armadas. También se encuentra el Observatorio Meteorológico y Astronómico, el cual sirve de gran apoyo a la aeronavegación
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Villa Esperanza” and it is composed of 17 entrepreneurs, all dedicated to business, specifically to selling clothing, footwear, transportation, market stall sellers, taxi driver, “colectivos” [a system of taxi drivers], truck drivers and to services, among other occupations. All of the members belong to the comuna [the smallest administrative unit in Chile] of El Bosque, located in the city of Santiago.  

Encarnación is the member of the group who is seated in the third row in the photo, going from right to left. She is wearing a black jacket and her hair is dark chestnut brown and she wears it pulled back.

She has been selling pallets for seven years. The pallet is a structure used for loading cargo that is generally made of wood. Its function is to transport cargo, generally fruit, and it is rectangular or square in shape, so as to be more easily manipulated. Encarnación notes that she works with the help of her husband and son. Her workshop is located at her house and her schedule is from 9:00 until 1:00 and then from 2:00 until 5:30, Monday to Friday. She buys her merchandise, such as recyclable materials, from large businesses and distributors at low cost, consequently it is economically feasible. 

She will use the loan to purchase only nails. Her goal in her business is to grow more in order to generate a higher income and thereby aim for a better quality of life. 

Encarnación lives with her husband, who helps her with sales, and with her two sons, who are 19 and 23 years old. Her dreams are to be able to deliver material directly to large businesses because at the moment she works with intermediaries who work for the businesses. 

She is very grateful and happy for the opportunity provided by Fondo Esperanza because it will enable her to invest in her business. She says that the training workshops have been fundamental for her business and also her own personal development because she has learned how to better organize and distribute her income and investments.

El Bosque is a comuna located in the southern sector of Santiago (capital of Chile). There, one encounters El Bosque Aerial Base and Capitán Ávalos Flight School. Thus it is the place where the bulk of the aeronautical activity of this branch of the Armed Forces is concentrated. There, also, is the Meterological and Astronomical Observatory, which provides critical support in aerial navigation.

loans.use: to purchase only nails.

loans.name: Nuestra Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Nuestra nueva Esperanza” está conformado por 18 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; taller ciclista, venta de ropa, manualidades, repostería, maquinas de juego, bazar, peluquería, bordados, costuras, verdulería, invernadero, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos perteneciente a la ciudad de San Fernando.
Elizabeth, presidenta del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie en primera fila ocupando el segundo lugar de izquierda a derecha, viste una chaqueta de color gris, encima lleva una bufanda (Prenda con que se envuelve y abriga el cuello), usa aros y su cabello es largo y lo usa tomado y es de color castaño claro.
Ella se dedica al rubro de manualidades, peluquería y monitora en su municipalidad para el adulto mayor, desde hace 8 años. Comenta que trabaja de lunes a viernes en la municipalidad y en las tardes se dedica a su peluquería y sus manualidades, este último rubro le gusta mucho, trabaja a pedido, realiza 21 puntos diferentes para trabajar, uno de ellos es el capitoné (tapizado clásico, muy elegante, que se caracteriza por el acolchado en relieve siguiendo una pauta regular y ordenada, como un diseño geométrico).
Su mercadería la compra en distribuidoras que se especializan en manualidades y productos para el cabello.
Con el crédito comprará telas, cintas, hilo, bolillo (blonda tejida a crochet), tinturas para el cabello.
Sus metas son continuar con el negocio y poder comprar una maquina bordadora, para generar mayores ingresos, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Elizabeth vive junto a su hija de 21 años de edad, quien se encuentra estudiando. Sus sueños a nivel laboral tener un taller donde pueda poner sus maquinas, y a nivel familiar ver a su hija titulada, para ver su tarea cumplida.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que el crédito le permitirá invertir en sus negocios. Además se siente cómoda con el grupo del Banco Comunal del cual forma parte, lo cual la motiva a seguir participando.
San Fernando es una ciudad ubicada en la región del Libertador General Bernardo O´Higgins , zona centro de Chile. La actividad económica de la ciudad se basa principalmente en la agricultura (viñedos, cultivo de remolacha, frutales, tabaco, trigo y cultivo tradicional), la agroindustria (empresas exportadoras de frutas, conserveras, de lácteos, etc.) y el comercio.
texts.en:
This community bank is called Nuestra Nueva Esperanza and is made up of 18 members who earn their living in a variety of ways: bicycle repair shop, clothing sales, crafts,  pastry making, toys, gift stall, hairdressing, embroidery, sewing, fruit and vegetable sales, greenhouse, and services. 

Elizabeth is the president of the community bank. In the photo she is standing in the front row, second on the left. She is wearing a grey jacket and a scarf (a garment you wrap around your neck to protect it), and ear rings. Her light brown hair is long. Elizabeth makes crafts and is also a hairdresser. For the last eight years she has been a teacher of older adults in the community. She works from Monday to Friday in the community, and in the afternoons she does crafts and works in the salon. 

Elizabeth particularly enjoys making crafts for which she takes orders. She knows twenty one different stitches and styles of embroidery. She buys her supplies from specialist distributors of crafts and hair products.

With the loan Elizabeth will buy fabric, ribbon, thread, bobbins (crochet wool), and hair dye. Her goal is to continue her business and to buy an embroidery machine so that she can earn more money and achieve a better standard of living.

She lives with her 21-year old daughter who is a student. Her dream is to have a workshop of her own where she can put her sewing and embroidery machines. She would also like to see her daughter graduate from university and her work completed.

She is very grateful for this opportunity provided by Fondo Esperanza for a loan to invest in her business. As well, she is happy to be part of her community bank who motivate her to continue participating. 

San Fernando is a town located in the region of Libertador General Bernardo O'Higgins in the central part of Chile. The most important economic activities of the town are agriculture (grape growing, beets, fruit trees, tobacco, wheat, and traditional crops),  industries associated with agriculture such as fruit exports and milk products, and commerce.

loans.use: buy fabric, ribbon, thread, bobbins (crochet wool), and hair dye

loans.name: Nuevo Camino Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Nuevo Camino” está conformado por 18 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; pastelería, criadero de cerdos, venta de comida rápida, venta de queso, venta de ropa interior, kiosko, invernadero, venta de verduras, artesanía, venta de carbón, bazar, librería, tejidos, venta de chichería(pinches de niñitas). Todos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Chillan.
Carolina, secretaria del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie en segunda fila, ocupando el segundo lugar de derecha a izquierda, viste un beatle de color gris y encima lleva una chaqueta de color negro, usa anteojos, su cabello lo usa tomado y es de color castaño oscuro.
Ella se dedica al rubro del comercio específicamente a la venta de ropa nueva, desde hace 2 años, trabaja desde su casa y entrega a domicilio, su horario de trabajo empieza en la tarde ya que en la mañana se dedica a sus hijos y a la casa. Su mercadería en ropa es diversa, ya que generalmente sus productos son para dama, varón, niños y bebes.
Su mercadería usualmente la compra en la ciudad de Santiago en distribuidoras y bodegas a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará ropa de diferentes tallas y modelos para su variada clientela.
Sus metas son seguir creciendo con su negocio y lograr instalar un local propio en su casa, para generar mayores ingresos, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Carolina vive junto a su esposo, quien la apoya en su negocio, y 2 hijos de 17 y 11 años de edad, quienes se encuentran estudiado. Sus sueño a nivel laboral es tener su local propio, y a nivel familiar que su hija se reciba de carabinero (policía uniformada en Chile)
Carolina está muy contenta y agradecida del crédito y servicios otorgados por Fondo Esperanza. Además comenta que se siente muy cómoda con las reuniones del Banco Comunal, ya que existe generosidad, respeto y unidad.
Chillán es una comuna de la zona centro sur de Chile. Su nombre significa “silla del sol” en mapudungun, idioma de nuestros indígenas mapuches. Chillán es conocida como “Cuna de la Patria” o “Tierra de Artistas”, debido a que en la ciudad han nacido destacados personajes de la historia de Chile, como por ejemplo el conocido pianista Claudio Arrau.
texts.en:
The 18 members of the Nuevo Camino community bank operate businesses that include: a bakery, animal sales, prepared food sales, cheese sales, clothing sales, kiosk sales, a greenhouse, vegetable sales, crafts sales, fuel sales, paper sales, etc.  All of the members live in the city of Chillan.
Carolina, the group's secretary, can be seen standing in the back row, second from the right, wearing a gray coat over a gray blouse, with glasses on.
She has operated a clothing sales business for 2 years. Specifically, she sell new clothing.  She operates the business from her house.  She works in the afternoon so that she can take care of family duties in the morning.
She sells a wide range of clothing for men, women, children and babies.  She buys from wholesalers in Santiago because that's where she can get the merchandise she needs at the lowest cost.  She will use this loan to buy different sizes and styles of clothing that she will resell to her customers.
For the future, she wants to grow her business and set up a space in her house where she can meet her customers.  The investment will help her improve her income and, in turn, her family's quality of life.
Carolina and her husband have 2 children, 17- and 11-years old, respectively.  Her husband supports her efforts to make an extra income.  They hope to help their daughter start a career in the carabinero (Chile's national police service).  
Carolina is happy with the terms of the loans that she receives from Fondo Esperanza.  She says, too, that she likes her community bank because its members are generous, considerate and supportive.
Chillan is a town in south-central Chile.  The name means "seat of the sun" in Mapudungun, the language of the indigenous Mapuche people.  The town is known as the Cradle of the Nation and Land of Artists.  It's famous for the many distinguished Chileans who were born here including the well-know pianist, Claudio Arrau.

loans.use: to stock her clothing sales business.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is 30 years old and lives with her family in the lovely district of Msambweni. The economy in Msambweni is principally based on foodstuffs, and there are also people who fish for a living. She has worked in her retail business for four years, and the support and help of her family makes her job easier. Furthermore, her business is very interesting to her, as it has gradually grown thanks to increased demand from neighbors and community members satisfied with the service she provides.

A member of Yehu Microfinance, Fatuma is requesting her first loan of KES 30,000 to buy more goods such as wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar. This will allow her to earn more money and achieve better living conditions for herself and her family. She hopes to use the loan to continue growing personally and economically, as well as actively participate in the loan organization in her community.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise like wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Hikoyat

texts.en:
Hikoyat likes to meet with friends and talk about business and fashion. She is a woman of taste and always tries to keep up with the modern world. She is a successful woman and wants to organize her own business. She is going to be busy with selling fabrics. She will sell fabrics to local people with low prices.

Hikoyat has many friends and all of them are glad about her new work. She is a divorcee and has no children. Her cousin will help her with the business. She wants to organize the business but she has not enough money for it. She is asking for a loan to buy fabrics for organizing the business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy fabrics for organizing a new business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary sells 'gari' at Apowa near Takoradi. She is married to a carpenter and has four children. Mary has been selling 'gari' for two years. Her loan will be used to buy stock for her business. She hopes to use the additional profits from her business to support her family.

loans.use: To buy a stock of 'gari' (manioc couscous) for her business

loans.name: Elmuraz

texts.en:
Elmuraz is 47 years old. He is married and lives in a small village of Marneuli District with his wife – Dilara and their 16-year-old son. The family owns 0.30 hectare of land, where strawberries are grown.  They sell harvested product on the local open market.  In addition, to the family agricultural business, Elmuraz works at the stone quarry as a worker and gets a fee for the work, and his son is busy with trading. 

Elmuraz’s son wants to increase his stock in trade and so they requested a loan. He will offer a wide assortment of household products to the customers and increase his sales, and, consequently, his profit. He will reinvest part of the profit in the same business, and the other part will be used for improving family living conditions.

loans.use: to increase his son's stock in trade

loans.name: Didier

texts.es:
Didier  es un muchacho de 31 años de  edad ,vive con su esposa  e hijos, en una comunidad  llamada Osa, localizada en Caña Blancal , en la provincia de Puntarenas. Está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona rural muy visitada por sus bellas playas y la diversidad de fauna que posee .Sus principales actividades económicas son las turísticas y agropecuarias.

Didier comenzó a construir su vivienda con dinero propio , pero no la pudo terminar por lo que está urgido de concluirla  ya que estamos iniciando la época lluviosa en nuestro país, la cual se mantendrá durante los restantes 6 meses del año, necesita poner canoas, mejorar  el techo, impermeabilizar paredes, hacer divisiones, hacer aceras entre otros detalles.

Lo que en estos momentos solicita  Didier   es un micro crédito de un millón de colones (¢1.000.000), para comprar materiales de construcción y poder terminar su vivienda lo antes posible .

El  es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Caña Blancal, una de las 110 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Con este préstamo  espera solucionar esta necesidad muy importante para el y su familia.
texts.en:
Didier, 31, lives with his wife and children in Osa, a small town in Puntarenas province.  The area is known for its beautiful beaches and the diversity of the local wildlife.  Many local people make their living from tourism and farming.  

Didier used his savings to start his house, but he hasn't yet finished.  He urgently needs to complete construction because the rainy season has started and will continue through the remaining 6 months of the year.  He needs to put in "canoas" [not sure in this context--some kind of barrier, presumably], fix the roof, waterproof walls and make other improvements.

Didier is applying for a small loan of one million (1,000,000) colones that he needs to buy construction materials for immediately finishing the improvements to his house.

Didier is a member of the Cana Blancal community bank, one of the 110 member organizations of Costa Rica's EDESA.  You loan will help Didier to provide decent housing for his family

loans.use: to buy construction materials for house improvement project.

loans.name: Tamila

texts.en:
Tamila is 52 years old. She lives in Adigeni District, South Georgia, with her husband, Alexander. They have a 33-year-old son and a 20-year-old daughter. Tamila's daughter is a student, and her son helps the family in its agricultural business. Tamila requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for her trading business startup but without any success. Her loan request was rejected each time, because the creditors did not find the existing family income to be sufficient to approve the loan. 

The only source of income for the family is a small-scale family agricultural business. They grow potatoes on a family-owned plot of land and also have a small-scale rabbit-breeding farm. They sell rabbits in the village. The monthly income of the family is 500 Laris. According to Credo's estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category.

Tamila requested a loan from Credo to start a trading business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative by Kiva and Credo. The startup loan program envisages provisions for business startups and re-startup credits with soft conditions for the country's rural poor, who, regarded as "high risk borrowers" because of their low income, do not have access to credit products. 

With the received credit, Tamila will purchase a small truck. She will start trading in seasonal fruits and vegetables. Alexander will help her. They will purchase fruits and vegetables from local farmers at wholesale prices and sell them in nearby towns with a price markup. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva startup loan, will significantly increase the family's income. Their income will double, and the family members will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a small truck for her trading business.

loans.name: Odeliza

texts.en:
Odeliza is  32  years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. Odeliza has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for  7,000 PHP  to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Odeliza  has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Odeliza hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Ayélé

texts.fr: Madame Ayélé est revendeuse de friperie et Lacoste depuis 1995. Elle exerce cette activité dans un quartier de la place et achète les marchandises à Lomé. Elle est maman de 03 adorables enfants qui tous fréquentent. Ils ont entre 16 et 09ans. Elle est mariée à un employé dans une société de la place et est âgée de 35ans. Madame Ayélé espère son troisième crédit de WAGES pour s’approvisionner en marchandise afin de mieux satisfaire les besoins des clients. Son désir est d'avoir une grande boutique de prêt à porter et subvenir aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ayélé, age 35, has been a reseller of used clothing and Lacoste brand apparel since 1995. She conducts her sales in a district of the area and buys her merchandise in Lomé. She is a married mother of three adorable children aged 9 to 16 who all go to school. Her husband is an employee at a local company. 

Mrs. Ayélé is seeking a third loan from WAGES to stock up on merchandise to meet the needs of her customers. Her goals are to own a large ready-to-wear store and provide for her family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Santos Elias

texts.es:
Santos, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para poderlo invertir en la compra de leña, maíz, también comprará láminas para el techo de su vivienda, con este préstamo espera solventar su situación en el negocio teniendo los materiales necesarios para seguir en la producción de tortillas, al mismo tiempo espera solventar la necesidad en el techo de su vivienda.

Con el préstamo anterior considera haber recibido la ayuda para la compra de los insumos que hasta el momento le han permitido mantener su negocio, produciendo las tortillas para los clientes, al mismo tiempo le ha generado ganancias para cubrir las necesidades de su familia.
texts.en:
Santos is applying for a loan, part of which she will use to buy firewood and maize for her prepared food business and part for roofing to improve her house.  The investments will allow her to continue her tortilla sales business and repair her roof.

She used a past loan to buy supplies that she needed for her tortilla business, an investment that allowed her to increase her earnings and better provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for supplies for her food business and roofing for her house.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is thirty-three years old and single. She supports her parents and sister. She has been running a chemist's for the last seven years, earning a monthly income of 4,933 KES.

Dorothy was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer and is applying for her first loan of 5,000 KES to purchase additional anti-malaria drugs to sell.

She will use the profits to pay her children's school fees as well as to continue looking after her family. She hopes to have a stable business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional anti-malaria drugs to sell.

loans.name: Nasir

texts.en:
Nasir lives in a community called Kanana, which is located in Msambweni, in the Coastal province. This community is known for being a rural area which receives a lot of visitors to its beaches. The main business activities in this area are tourism and agriculture.

Nasir says that he has thought about how beneficial it would be for his community to have a coconut supplier because his neighbors do not have any business nearby that buys coconuts in bulk from the farmers. He also says that this business will help him to make progress in life and improve his personal financial situation as he believes it to be a promising project. He adds that he has the support of his community in carrying out this business activity.

Nasir is currently requesting a micro-loan for KES 30,000 so that he can buy coconuts in bulk and resell them to coconut firms. He hopes to use this loan to grow further on both a personal and financial level. He also points out that, thanks to this type of organization who provide loans, he will be able to spend more time engaged in productive activities.

loans.use: to buy coconuts in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Natia

texts.en:
Natia is 26 years old. She is married and lives in a small village of Kareli District with her family: her husband – Sergo, their 1-year-old daughter, her parents-in-law, her  brother-in-law, and the grandmother of her husband, who is a pensioner.  Her husband and brother-in-law serve in the army and get a monthly salary. Natia and her parents-in-law run the family agricultural business with two milk cows, three calves and two pigs.  They produce cheese and sell it on the local open market. The family owns a plot of land as well, where maize, haricot beans, apples, cherries and pears are grown. They work hard on their plot during the spring and summer seasons to get a good harvest.  They sell harvested product on the local open market. 

Natia requested a loan for purchasing calves. She plans to grow them and sell them after several months. Grown calves will be sold for a good price. This will increase the income of the family. With increased income she will be able to reinvest in the family agricultural business to expand it and make it more profitable. As a result, Natia will be able to create better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Rosa Isabel

texts.es:
Rosa es una mujer de 21 años, es soltera, vive con sus padres y hermanos en la ciudad de Naca; ella es una joven que a pesar de su edad es muy trabajadora, entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias al apoyo de sus padres pudo estudiar la carrera técnica de cocina y pastelería; en sus ratos libres le gusta relajarse escuchando un poco de música y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Gracias a su espíritu emprendedor y al apoyo de sus padres, Rosa pudo en marcha su pequeño negocio de venta de tortas, día a día con mucho empeño, desde tempranas horas de la mañana ella inicia la elaboración  de sus tortas, Rosa dedica a su negocio un aproximado de 8 horas diarias y se siente a gusto realizando su labor ya que sus clientes la recomiendan por sus deliciosas tortas y por su buena atención.
Rosa se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una batidora industrial, moldes y quequeras; de esta manera ella contará con las herramientas necesarias para la mejor elaboración de sus tortas, así Rosa espera poder aumentar sus ventas e incrementar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales en un futuro no muy lejano desea utilizar para poder tener su pastelería y con ellos desea apoyar a su familia para juntos poder salir adelante.
texts.en:
Rosa, 21, is single.  She lives in the city of Nazca with her parents, brother and sisters.  She's a young woman, enthusiastic and hard-working, with a strong drive to get ahead in the world.  Thanks to help from her parents, she received a degree in cooking and pastry-making.  In her spare time, she likes to listen to music.  She also makes a terrific chicken and rice dish for her family.
Rosa operates a business, making and selling torillas, a business that she started with help from her parents.  She works around 8 hours a day and says that it's rewarding work because her clients like the service she provides and often recommend her tortillas to others.
Rosa is grateful to Kiva lenders because your loans will allow her to buy an industrial mixer, baking pans and other kitchen supplies.  The investment will give her the tools she needs to increase her sales and grow her business.  For the future, she wants to open a bakery and have the means to help support her family.

loans.use: to buy kitchen supplies for her food business.

loans.name: Seif

texts.en: Seif, 54 years old, is a very hardworking man. He's been with Mwanamvua for 34 years and they have five children; they live in the village of Msambweni. Seif has been a motorbike taxi driver for one year. He used to live in a rural area with his parents but he decided to move to the city thinking about the future progress of  himself and his family. Seif indicates that his job is hard because during the rainy season he has fewer passengers because it's very cold. His dream is to buy more motorbikes, to work and to make more progress. Seif is requesting a loan to buy another motorbike to earn more income.

loans.use: to buy another motorbike

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca  is married with seven children and three of her children go to school; the rest are still young.  She has a business selling half bricks used for building. She has been in this business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan   of 700,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more half bricks.   She works six days a week and sells to all categories of people, wholesale only.    

Besides this half brick business she generates additional income through a beauty salon.   She is aspiring of owning a fully stocked hardware shop and also building her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and not to piped water. Her monthly expenses   include school fees, feeding the family, and rent.

loans.use: To buy more  half bricks for  resale

loans.name: Nina

texts.en:
Nina is 66 years old. She lives in a small village of Kareli District with her family: her husband – Vigenti, her 33-year-old son and her daughter-in-law. The family earns their living through agricultural business. They have a milk cow and two calves. They produce cheese and sell it on the local open market.  They also own a plot of land, where haricot beans, onions and nuts are grown. They sell harvested product in nearby villages.  The total average monthly income of the family is 800 Lari.

Nina requested a loan to purchase a milk cow and two calves. She will be able to produce and sell more cheese. She wants to expand her business in order to earn a good profit. With increased income she will be able to purchase household goods.  As a result, Nina will be able to create better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow and two calves

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools for the maintenance of her photocopy machine

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is 36 years old. She lives with her husband and their three children. She sells spare parts. In addition, she sells petroleum in one litre and half litre bottles, in the same store where she sells her spare parts. Her small store is in a well located area. 

Fatuma has gained a great deal of sales experience and she is proud of her results. She has a large number of customers because they know that everything she sells is top quality at reasonable prices, and she provides excellent service. Fatuma is very dedicated to her work. She always tries to do better and doesn't consider giving up on her way to success. 

One of her biggest dreams is to grow her business so that she can increase her earnings. She would like to invest in additional inventory but she does not have capital to do this. She is therefore requesting a loan from Yehu microfinance that will enable her to buy more stock of spare parts and gallons of petrol. Fatuma is responsible and very capable of making payments. She is sure she can repay the debt and at the same time provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more stock of spare parts and gallons of petrol.

loans.name: Rustam

texts.en:
Rustam is very kind and plodding. He is a very successful businessman who has operated his own animal husbandry business for more than 3 years. Rustam buys cattle, cares for them for 2 or 3 months, and then sells them to local people at a low price. He has many customers, many of them butchers. All his customers are very satisfied with his work.

Rustam has a large family. His wife helps him with the business. They have 5 children and try to do the best for them. Rustam wants to develop his business but doesn't have enough income to do so. He is asking for a loan to buy young cattle to develop his business. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy young cattle

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 8 children. For the past 5 years, Gina has provided motorela or motorcycle services with her husband as the driver. She has requested a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy tools and to pay for gasoline. Gina has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, she hopes to improve her services.

loans.use: to buy tools and to pay for gasoline

loans.name: Loise

texts.en:
Loise, 38 years old, is married to James and together they have three children aged 18, 16 and 12 years old. She has operated an electronics shop for the past 11 years and is also a farmer.

Loise was introduced to KADET by a credit officer and this is her fourth term loan. She repaid all her previous loans well. Loise will use the loan amount to purchase stock of electronics gadgets to sell. She hopes to increase her income to help improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of electronic gadgets.

loans.name: Ramadhani

texts.en:
Ramadhani lives in Msambweni. He is happily married and has children from his marriage. He has a small grocery store in his home which he says he has been working in for three years. He says that it is doing very well because he has good customers who always come to his business.

Ramadhani is requesting this loan as he would like to stock his business with essential products such as milk, baked goods, sugar, wheat flour, meat, etc. He is grateful for the help that he is receiving. It will be very useful to him.

loans.use: to purchase stock such as milk, baked goods, sugar, wheat flour, meat, etc.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena sells oranges, bananas, and slippers at Besease, near Elmina. She has been selling these items for 7 years. Abena is married to a farmer and has 5 dependents. Abena uses her income to assist her husband in the general upkeep of their home. She will use her loan to purchase a variety of fruit to sell. With the new profit Abena plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of fruit to sell

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en: Jenelyn is 29 years old from Loboc, Bohol. She is married with a six-year-old son. Jenelyn owns a sari-sari (variety) store business and also sells cosmetics from Avon. Her store has been in existence for six years and she has been in the direct selling business for three years. She is asking for a loan to buy cologne, body talc, perfume, lotion, rice, and soft drinks. The income that she will generate will be for her son's needs, like school fees, and for healthy daily food consumption for her family.

loans.use: to buy cologne, body talc, perfume, lotion, rice, and soft drinks

loans.name: Fressia Milagros

texts.es:
Fressia es una joven de 21 años, vive en  la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Santiago con su pequeño hijo de 2 años, lamentablemente por diversas circunstancias se separó de su pareja, ahora ella es padre y madre para su pequeño, ella es una mujer luchadora, entusiasta y muy perseverante, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos a trabajar para salir adelante; en sus ratos libres le gusta ver televisión junto con su pequeño, lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar la carrera de medicina que tanto quería, pero sueña con poderlo algún día.
Por iniciativa propia y gracias al apoyo de una amiga, Fressia puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de venta de productos de belleza, tales como perfumes, cosméticos y cartera; ella dedica a su negocio un aproximado de 8 horas diarias, en las cuales puede atender buena cantidad de clientes, ella cree que su negocio marcha bien debido a los buenos productos que vende, así como por su trato amable y respetuoso que brinda sus clientes.  
Fressia se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de un estante y una vitrina para poder exhibir sus productos; de esta manera Fressia tendrá su negocio mejor acondicionado y podrá incrementar sus ventas y sus ingresos económicos, con los cuales poco a poco espera poder ahorrar el dinero necesario tener su local propio en el mercado central de su ciudad y así espera poder dar inicio a sus estudios y con ello asegurar el bienestar y futuro de su pequeño hijo.
texts.en:
Fressia, 21, and her 2-year old son live in Ica, a city in Santiago district.  She is separated from her partner, she says, and has to be both mother and father to her young child.  She perseveres, though, working and striving to get ahead in the world.  She tells us that she and her son like to watch television together when she has time for it.  She says, too, that she would have liked to have pursued a career in medicine, but there was no money for it and it's now a dream for another day.
Fressia started her small business, selling beauty products, with her own savings and help from a friend.  She sells perfumes, cosmetics and other products.  She works around 8 hours a day and sees many customers.  She says that the business has been successful because she sells good products and treats her customers with respect and good humor.  
Fressia is grateful to Kiva lenders because your loans will allow her to buy a display case for displaying the products she sells. The investment will allow her to better show her products so that she can grow her business and, in turn, increase her income.  For the future, she wants to save enough money to open a store in a shopping center in the city, a business that she hopes would give her the means to go back to school and provide her and her son with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a display case for her cosmetics business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy building materials.

loans.name: Abduhakim

texts.ru: Абдухаким  мужчина в возрасте 47 лет, отец двоих детей, работает мастером по ремонту автомашин. Его жена домохозяйка, занимается домашними делами воспитывает детей.  Он решил в кредит купить себе кондиционер потому что в это время года очень жарко.Он благодарен таким организиям , что есть такая возможность в кредит осуществить свои планы и каждый месяц погашать по частям со своего дохода.
texts.en: Abduhakim is a 47 year-old man, a father of two children, and works as an auto mechanic.  His wife is a homemaker and is involved in household work and raising children.  Abduhakim decided to purchase an air conditioner for himself because it is very hot this time of year.  He is grateful to such organizations that provide an ability to make his plans come to fruition through loans and to repay them monthly from his income.

loans.use: to purchase an air conditioner

loans.name: Huseyn

texts.ru:
Хусейн проживает в городе Душанбе. Ему 32 года. Он женат. У него трое детей. Его дети учатся в школе. Жена Хусейна домохозяйка. Сам Хусейн имеет среднее образование. Он в 2005 году открыл пекарню, где до сегодняшнего для предоставляет услугу вместе со своими работниками. Хусейн печет лепешки разных форм. Лепешки у Хусейна покупают оптом. 
Хусейн берет кредит для покупки муки.
texts.en: Huseyn lives in the city of Dushanbe.  He is 32 years old, married and has three children, all of whom attend a school.  His wife is a homemaker.  Huseyn has a secondary education.  He opened a bakery in 2005 and provides a service there together with his employees to this day.  Huseyn bakes flatbread of various shapes.  He then sells them wholesale.  Huseyn is requesting this loan to purchase flour.

loans.use: to purchase flour

loans.name: Rashida

texts.en: Rashida is married and has two children, who attend school. She also takes care of her elderly parents. Rashida has operated a restaurant business for two years. She has applied for a loan of 200,000 UGX (Uganda shillings) from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of bananas, 5 kgs of rice, beef, chicken and charcoal. Rashida's major business challenges include defaulters and lack of a permanent business premise.  She hopes to own a fully stocked restaurant. Rashida resides in a rented house where the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bananas, rice, beef, chicken and charcoal

loans.name: Nang's Group

texts.en: Age 54, Nang is a resident from Dambae district, in which rice farming is the primary industry. She is the mother of four children, one of whom is still living with her and helping the family's business. On two hectares of farmland, she grows paddy rice as her main source of income. Additionally, she plants cassava on another hectare of land to earn extra income. These are the businesses that she has been in for 30 years, and she is able to earn about 24,000 KHR per day. This is the fourth loan cycle for Nang and the second cycle for her other group member; her group consists of two. She has repaid the first loan successfully, and it has helped her to improve her current business gradually. Now, she is applying for a loan of 500,000 KHR, and her other member is seeking a loan of 700,000 KHR. As the group leader, she is going to use her loan portion to pay for the plowing and weeding of her cassava field. She hopes to earn more income so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to pay for the plowing and weeding of the cassava field

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia, 38, is from Kenya. For four years she has been running a food stall that she set up at one of the markets to earn extra income to cover household expenses. Lydia has experience with a previous loan that she used to provide a variety of food of high quality. 

Thanks to the support given by Yehu and Kiva to small business owners, Lydia will use this loan to buy ingredients such as rice, beans, sugar, meat, etc. Her customers like her and her food because she always maintains high hygiene in her stall. Lydia dreams of expanding her food stall to a hotel.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as rice, beans, sugar, meat, etc.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah is married and has five children, who all go to school.  She also takes care of additional family members (orphans). 

Deborah has a business of selling green bananas. She has been in this business for seven years. Besides this banana business, she generates additional income through hiring out a motorcycle.  She works six days a week and sells to all categories of people at the market. Her major business challenges include thieves and the rainy season, which hinders her customers in coming to her.

Deborah has applied for a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of bananas. She aspires to sell at wholesale only and also to build her own house.  She resides in a rented house and her family has access to electricity but not to piped water.  Her monthly expenses include school fees, feeding the family, and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of green bananas

loans.name: Rama

texts.en:
Rama is 38 years old.  He is married and has one child who is the reason for his hard work. Rama has made a living selling agricultural products for the past two years. He began this work when he was single, and after marrying and setting up his own home, he continued in the industry. He sells his products at the market to his neighbours and passersby. He has a well-established base of customers that always buy products from him because of their good quality.

Rama is asking for a loan to purchase cassava and coconuts for his daily sales, and he will also be purchasing fruits and vegetables to offer to his customers.

loans.use: to purchase cassava and coconuts for his daily sales, and also to purchase fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a 32-year-old lady from Kisumu.  She is married to Richard, a mechanic, and they have three children, aged 14,12, and 10 years old. She sells fruit, and this is a business she has done for the last eight years. She makes a monthly income of KES 10,000.

Caroline has applied for her second loan of KES 30,000, which she intends to use in expanding her business by buying sacks of different fruits like bananas, avocados, mangoes, and oranges for resale. 

She has a plan of expanding the business further with the profits she will make.  She will also use her profits to pay school fees for her children. Her dream is to become one of the fruit suppliers in the region.

loans.use: to buy sacks of different fruits like bananas, avocados, mangoes, and oranges for resale.

loans.name: Buzigire Group

texts.fr: Sibazuri est une cliente ambitieuse et secrétaire de l’association d’affaire  buzigire. Agée de 28ans est mariée à un agriculteur et mère de 6 enfants dont 3 sont scolarisés.  Elle vend  des divers produits vivriers (poissons salés, fretin, huile de palme) et a des ambitions d’accroitre son entreprise.  Le credit sollicité va lui permettre d’acheter 2 bidons d’huile de palme,  1 sac de poissons salés et 30kilos de fretins. Elle souhaite construire une  maison commerciale; ainsi elle remercie Hekima pour sa contribution à son épanouissement.
texts.en: Sibazuru is an ambitious client and the secretary of the Buzigire business association. She is 28 years old, married to a farmer and the mother of six children, three of whom are in school. She sells various staple foods (salted fish, fish fry, palm oil), and her goal is to grow her business. This loan will allow her to buy two jugs of palm oil, one bag of salted fish and 30 kgs [66 lbs] of fish fry. She would like to have a store built; she thanks Hekima for helping to  bolster her business.

loans.use: to buy two jugs of palm oil, one bag of salted fish and 30 kgs [66 lbs] of fish fry.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is married with five children, and all of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (mother and father). She has a business of selling cellular phones and phone accessories.  She has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more cellular phones, batteries, and phone chargers. She has been in this business for 2 years. She works seven days a week and sells to all categories of people on a retail basis.  Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She generates additional income from rental houses. She aspires to be fully stocked with cellular phones and their accessories.  She resides in her own house, and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her monthly expenses include school fees, utility bills, and medication.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cellular phones, batteries, and phone chargers

loans.name: Sokunthea's Group

texts.en:
Sokunthea, 32, is the mother of three dependent children who are still in school. To provide for the entire household, she works as a teacher at the local public school and supplements her income by growing cassava on two hectares of farmland. Sokunthea has been farming cassava for 20 years and is able to earn about 27,000 KHR.

Sokunthea is the group leader and this will be both members' fifth loan cycle with VisionFund. She has repaid the past four loans successfully and has been empowered to maintain her family's livelihood and keep her children in school. Sokunthea is requesting a loan of 100,000 KHR and the other member is applying for 150,000 KHR. Sokunthea is going to use her portion to pay for weeding her cassava field. She hopes to grow her cassava timely so that she can earn more income to maintain her standard of living.

loans.use: To pay for weeding her cassava field

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en: Muhammad is cute and hardworking. He has operated his own animal husbandry business for more than 2 years. He buys cattle, cares for them and sells them to local people at a low price. Muhammad has 5 children and a lovely wife. His wife doesn’t work and he must solely provide the family with all modern conveniences. Muhammad is asking for a loan to buy young cattle to develop his business. He awaits your help and mercy.

loans.use: To buy young cattle

loans.name: Som

texts.en:
Som is a 38-year-old married woman who has been living in Siem Reap province. She is responsible for four single children, some of whom have their own employment. Som runs a small store from her home, selling snack foods, spices, sweets, and many miscellaneous household products. She typically generates around US $2 per day to add to her husband’s income. Her husband is in the motorcycle transportation business.

Som is applying for a loan through HKL to expand her store and to purchase merchandise to sell such as snack foods, soft drinks, spices, cigarettes, shampoos, powders, and beauty products. This purchase will allow her to satisfy her customers and thereby increase her income. She is very thankful and will repay her loan on time as scheduled.

loans.use: to expand her store and to purchase merchandise to sell

loans.name: Mnyazi

texts.en:
Mnyazi is from Msambweni, Mombasa. She is 40 years old and married to Ali. They have four dependent children who are all attending school. Mnyazi's business is buying, producing and selling vegetables. She makes her sales to neighboring community members and in the Msambweni town market. She tells us that she has an established customer base which helps her to make a very good income and thereby help her family.

Mnyazi is requesting a loan to buy vegetables such as tomatoes, peppers, onions, etc. She tells us that this will enable her to stock up and have a larger variety of products to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy vegetables such as tomatoes, peppers, onions, etc.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is married with three children and only one of her children goes to school. She also takes care of additional family members (her grandchildren). She has business selling green bananas and sells to all categories of people, retail. She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Uganda shillings to buy more bunches of green bananas. She has been in this banana business for eight years working at the market and works six days a week. 

Besides this banana business, she generates additional income through hiring out a motorcycle. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. She is aspiring of becoming a wholesaler and buying a delivery van to ease transportation and also building rental rooms. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses  include school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en: Henry, 25 years old, is single. He has operated a motorcycle transport business for the past year, earning a monthly income of KES 15,000. Henry was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer and this will be his first loan from KADET LTD. He will use the loan amount to repair his motorcycle. Henry hopes to start up a wholesale shop and also start a family.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose  produces  "fanti  kenkey" (balls of fermented corn dough) for sale at Besease near Elmina. She is married and has  six dependents.  Her husband is a farmer.  Rose  has been selling "fanti kenkey"  for 10  years now. She uses her income to help her husband to pay their children's school fees. Her loan will be used to purchase bags of maize for the production of her "kenkey" for sale. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize for the production of her 'kenkey' for sale

loans.name: Kesia

texts.en:
Kesia is a farmer in Olkalau town where she plants cash crops such as maize, beans and potatoes.She is 39 years old and married with four children.

This will be her third loan and she plans to use the loan to buy farm inputs for her farm during this planting season.With the anticipated income she plans to pay school fees for her children.

In the future, Kesia hopes to buy a lorry that will enable her to transport her farm produce to the marketplace.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Nat's Group

texts.en:
Nat, aged 62 years old, is a villager from the Prey Chhor district of Kompong Cham Province. She has three children, and she needs to support one daughter as she cannot earn much money as a garment factory worker. For 42 years, Nat has been growing paddy rice as her main source of income. The lack of working capital to support her business remains the main challenge for Nat. She has now formed a group of four to request a new loan to overcome such challenges. 

Nat has been with VisionFund since 2011 when she was a first cycle client. She used the loan successfully and managed to pay back the entire loan. Now, she is leading a group of four female members to seek  a new loan. She and one other member are applying for 800,000 KHR each, while other members are requesting 1,000,000 KHR and 500,000 KHR. Nat will use her loan portion not only to buy seeds and fertilizers but also to pay for harvesting fees for her farmland. She hopes to receive more crop yield to earn more income to lease an additional plot of farmland for expanding her paddy rice growing business.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers and to pay for harvesting costs

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Kavumbi

texts.en:
Kavumbi comes from Msambweni. She’s a married mother of three children whom she’s been raising with much sacrifice and effort. Her children are her life’s purpose and this is why she strives even more each day.

She buys fish from fishermen and fries them for resale to her neighbouring comminity members and passersby. She’s been doing this for three years so has vast business experience. She comments that she is going to continue to struggle for her children because her greatest wish is that they become upstanding citizens who are useful not just to themselves but to society as well.

She asks for the loan to buy bundles of the kinds of fish which sell the most and that will help her earn more income.

loans.use: to buy bundles of fish to fry for resale

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is married and has two children, one of whom attends school. For the past 8 years, she has operated a business selling used children's clothing. Juliet generates additional income by selling charcoal. She sells to all categories of people at the retail level, working seven days a week from her home.

Juliet has applied for a loan of 900,000 UGX (Uganda shillings) from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used children's clothing. Her major business challenge is transportation of the clothing from the market to her stall at home. Juliet hopes to see her business grow big so that she becomes a wholesaler and to get enough profits to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has no access to electricity and piped water. Juliet's monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used children's clothing

loans.name: Nyame

texts.en: Nyame  is a widow. She is a cone mill operator and also sells saucepans at Besease near Elmina.  She has been in this business for the past 15 years now. She has five dependents. Nyame is responsible for the upkeep of her children. She will use her loan to purchase a bigger milling machine for her business.  Nyame plans to  expand her business with her new profit.

loans.use: to purchase a bigger mill for her business.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is 54 years old. She is married and has eight adult children. She works as a farmer in her two-acre farm.She has been growing a variety of crops but mostly maize. Annah has been farming for the last 15 years. Apart from the income got from the sale of her farm products, she also receives some contributions from her children, some of whom are working.

With a goal of growing more crops, Annah has come to Yehu and Partners for a loan in the amount of 10,000 KES to buy fertilizers and with the rest cater for cultivation costs. She plans to invest the income from the loan to start a kiosk in her home, thanks to her persistent efforts despite her advanced age.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and with the rest cater for cultivation costs.
