loans.name: Efua

texts.en: For the past 5 years, Efua has been selling cassava and plantains at Besease, near Elmina. She is married to a mason and has 5 dependents. Efua uses her income to assist her husband with the family's upkeep. She will use her loan to purchase more cassava and plantains to sell. Efua will expand her business with her new profit.

loans.use: to purchase more cassava and plantains to sell

loans.name: Mwanabibi

texts.en:
Mwanabibi, 59 years old, is married and has five independent adult children with their own careers. Mwanabibi sells fruits and vegetables, a job which thankfully allows her to support her family and to get what they need to have a dignified and respectful life. She says that she has good customers because she has always sold good quality products.

Mwanabibi is asking for this loan so that she can buy more fruits and vegetables to stock her business and meet her customer demand. She is grateful for the opportunity given to her and it will be of great help to her small business.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua sells cassava, gari (cassava flakes), and plantain at Besease near Elmina. Efua is married to a farmer and has seven dependants. She has been selling the above for six years. She uses her income to support her husband to pay their utility bills. Efua will use her loan to purchase more cassava and gari for sale. With the new profits Efua will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more cassava and gari for sale

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en: Angelique is 39 years old. She sells soft drinks in her shop and has been in the business for seven years. With this loan, she wants to add more juices, mineral water, and milk for sale. She plans to use the profits for her savings.

loans.use: To buy more juices, mineral water and milk for resale.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is sixty-two  years old,  married to Anna, and blessed with one child. He has operated a carpentry business for the last twelve years, earning a monthly income of KES 7,600.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our credit officers and is applying for his first loan of KES 20,000 to buy additional equipment such as a saw, a hammer and nails for use in the business.

The anticipated profits will be invested back into his business. His future dreams are to have a happy family.

loans.use: to  buy additional equipment such as a saw, a hammer and nails

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for tuition fees at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for tuition fees at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for tuition fees at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Nem's Group

texts.en:
Nem, 27 years old, lives in the Dambae district of Kompong Cham province. She has three dependent children who are still at school. Nem has been growing paddy rice and planting cassava for the past 10 years, earning about 14,000 KHR. The declining price of cassava is the main challenge for her business.

This is the first loan cycle for Nem and for her two other group members, who are seeking a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the group leader, Nem is going to use her portion of the loan to pay for weeding her cassava field. She hopes to improve her standard of living gradually.

loans.use: To pay for weeding her cassava field

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en: Claudine, 28 years old, is married and has two children. She operates a store where she sells different items. Claudine is requesting a loan to buy more cooking oil, salt and rice to sell. She will use the profits to make more savings. Claudine is very thankful for the previous loan from Kiva which helped her and her business.

loans.use: to buy items such as rice, cooking oil, salt, etc.

loans.name: Nagina's Group

texts.en:
Nagina has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who is an embroidery expert. 

With the loan investment he will buy beads, thread, embroidery frames of better variety and of larger quantity that will allow him to prepare beautiful looking clothes and increase his orders and income. 

He has been in this business for many years and has a good number of business contacts from whom he gets regular orders every month. 

Nagina is confident that a Kiva loan will help him move his business to a more profitable level and increase his income.

loans.use: To buy embroidery material for an embroidery business

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi is a petty trader at Besease near Elmina. She is married to a farmer and has five children. She has been in this business for the past eight years now. Esi uses her income to assist her husband in paying the utility bills. She will use her loan to purchase more food items for sale. With the new profits, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more food items for sale

loans.name: Alijon

texts.ru:
Аличон любит свою работу. Он всегда пытается найти новые способы получения дохода. Три года назад, Аличон начал свою деятельность. Аличон предоставляет услугу, такси на своем автомобиле. У него много клиентов. 
Аличон женат. Ему 30 лет. У него двое детей. Аличон хочет продолжить свой деятельность, но его доходов недостаточно для ремонта автомобиля. Его машина находится не в хорошем состоянии. 
Аличон просит кредит для ремонта и покраски своего автомобиля.
texts.en: Alijon loves his work.  He always tries to find new ways of earning money.  Alijon started his business three years ago.  He provides a taxi service using his own car and has many customers.  Alijon is 30 years old, married and has two children.  He wants to continue his business, but does not have a sufficient income to repair his car.  Currently, his car is in a bad condition.  Alijon is requesting this loan to repair and paint his car.

loans.use: to repair and paint his car

loans.name: Tolibjon

texts.ru:
Толибчон родился 1952 году. Он живет со своей семьей в районе Рудаки. Его жена домохозяйка. Сын работает таксистом а дочь замужем. 
Сам Толибчон предоставляет услугу. У него имеется маршрутка Газель. Он развозит пассажиров по определенному маршруту. Толибчон имеет богатый опыт в этой области. Он более тридцати лет работает шафером. 
Толибчон просит кредит для приобретения новой автомашины своему сыну, чтобы он смог продолжить свою деятельность.
texts.en: Tolibjon was born in 1952.  He lives with his family in the Rudaki district.  His wife is a homemaker.  His son works as a taxi driver, and daughter is married.  Tolibjon provides a service.  He has a Gazel mini-bus, which he uses to transport passengers along a set route.  Tolibjon has a rich experience in this area.  He has been working as a driver for over thirty years.  Tolibjon is requesting this loan to purchase a new car for his son, so that he could continue his business.

loans.use: to purchase a new car for his son

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret sells sacks and bags in Nakuru town. She is 49 years old and married to Denis and together they have two children.

This is her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy more stock of sacks and packing bags to sell to traders and farmers in the marketplace. With the anticipate profits, she plans to complete building her house.

In the future, she hopes to build rental houses and make more income.

loans.use: To buy sacks and  packing bags.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria  cooks "banku" (fermented dough) and rice for sale. She serves them with  vegetables, fish and meat stew at Besease. She is married and has five children. Her husband is a farmer.  

Victoria has been selling "banku" and rice for seven years. She assists her husband to provide for the family. She will use her loan to buy bags of rice and maize to cook her food to sell. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy rice and maize to prepare  her food to sell

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 48 years old. She has six children and all go to school. She has been selling foodstuffs for ten years. With the loan, she wants to buy more beans, bananas and sorghum to sell. The profits from the business will be used for paying school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more beans, bananas and sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Khem's Group

texts.en:
Khem is 56 years old and she has four children. She is a villager from a rural area of the MongKul Borey district of Banteay Meanchey province, where rice farming is the common business for other villagers, as well as for Khem’s family. To better support her family, Khem sells a traditional dessert, sticky rice in bamboo tube (krolan in Cambodian). She has been in these businesses for fifteen years. The current business earns her approximately KHR 26,000 per day, of which she is able to save about KHR 6,000.

Khem has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for four cycles and her group member, for two cycles. Khem has successfully repaid her loans, which have gradually improved her family's livelihood. She and her group member are now applying for a new loan of KHR 1,000,000 each. As the leader, Khem will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and to buy ingredients such as sticky rice, sugar, bamboo, etc. for her dessert business. She hopes to double her current business income so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Valentine

texts.en: Valentine is 27 years old. She is married to a farmer and they have one child, aged 3. She has requested a loan to buy more bananas and sorghum to sell. Valentine will use the profits from the business to buy a cow to provide milk for the family.

loans.use: To buy more bananas and sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Subira

texts.en:
Subira, 35, is a married mother; she has four children, all of whom attend school which is her reason to strive. She’s from Msambweni district. From her savings she has managed to open her own business where she sells all types and brands of clothes. She currently has a well-established clientele in the area and her clothes orders increase accordingly. Thanks to her effort and dedication she has been able to build a little house for herself. 

She’s asking for the loan to buy shirts, T-shirts, shorts and other clothes that are in season and that her customers ask her for a lot. She is grateful for the support she’s receiving because everything she does is in order to provide her children with the best.

loans.use: to buy shirts, T-shirts, shorts and other clothes.

loans.name: Franz

texts.es:
Franz es casado y tiene dos hijos que están en etapa escolar, viven en casa propia, la casa esta ubicada en la zona Villa Copacabana de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja como profesor de cocina en un Instituto privado por más de ocho horas al día ya que debe pagar los gastos de alimentación, educación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia por que su esposa no gana mucho como artesana.
El crédito lo solicita para la refacción de su baño en su domicilio ya que desea realizar la obra fina y la puesta de azulejos para  no tener tanta humedad.
El sueño de Franz es mejorar sus ingresos y tener más comodidad.
Es la segunda vez que solícita crédito junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Franz is married and has two children who are of school age. They live in their own home, which is located in the District of Villa Copacabana in the city of La Paz.

Franz currently works as a cooking instructor at a private institution. He works more than eight hours a day so that he can pay for expenses such as food, education, and basic services for his family. His wife does not earn much money as an artisan. The loan he is requesting will be used to remodel a bathroom in his home because he wants it to be completely finished. He will also have tiles installed so as to prevent humidity.

Franz dreams of improving his income and being more comfortable. This is the second time he has requested a loan from IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for the remodeling of a bathroom in his home.

loans.name: Santos Luis

texts.es:
Don Santos, tiene 49 años de edad, está casado, tiene 2 hijos, vive con su esposa y una hija en Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Cortes.
El hace 7 años decidió establecer un negocio en su casa de una pulpería, la cual es administrada también por su esposa donde vende arroz, frijoles, maíz, manteca, harina y abarrotería. El ha invertido 10 préstamos anteriores al actual. Este negocio es su fuente de ingresos de donde cubre los gastos del hogar. Este préstamo que solicita es por 22,000 Lempiras y lo invertirá también en productos alimenticios para surtir la pulpería y seguir obteniendo ingresos. Su meta es que el negocio crezca y se mantenga surtido para que su familia viva mejor.
texts.en:
Don Santos is 49 years old, married, and has two children. He lives with his wife and a daughter in Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Cortes.

Seven years ago, he decided to establish a grocery store in his home. He and his wife manage this business together and they sell rice, beans, corn, lard, flour, and other grocery items. Santos has invested 10 loans prior to this current one. This business serves as his source of income by which he is able to cover the household expenses.

The loan he is requesting in the amount of 22,000 HNL will be invested in food products to restock his grocery store. This will enable him to continue generating income. His goal is to grow his business and keep it stocked so that his family can live better.

loans.use: to buy various food products for his store.

loans.name: Lamiya

texts.ru: Lamiya zamujem i imeyet 2 detey. Ona jivet v Absheron regione vmeste so svoim mujem i detmi. Lamiya 24 qoda. Ona uje 3 qoda kak imeyet etot magazin gde prodayot raznuyu produkcyu( skovorodki , kostruli, chashki, vilki, lojki i t.d) Seychas Lamiya nujdayetsya v 1500 AZN chtobi kupit noviy tovar dlya pereprodaji i razvitiya yeyo biznessa.
texts.en: Lamiya is married and has two children.  She lives in the Absheron region together with her husband and children.  Lamiya is 24 years old.  She has had this store, where she sells various goods (pans, pots, teapots, forks, spoons, etc., for three years.  Currently, Lamiya needs 1500 AZN to purchase new merchandise for resale in order to develop her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is 46 years old and the mother of a son and two daughters. She lives with her mother-in-law and her children in their home, located in the rural areas of Tiribe.

Halima has worked for over six years tending her kiosk where she attends to a number of customers in her community. She also owns a motorcycle taxi which she says has been a profitable project, since this is a common means of transportation in her rural home. 

Halima is asking for this loan to purchase another motor bike to expand her business. She is very happy to continue working with Yehu and Kiva because of the help they have given her business and because her living conditions are improving.

Her dream is to have several businesses so as to earn more income.

loans.use: to purchase a motor bike.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua sells oranges, bananas, groundnuts, cassava and plantains at Besease near Elmina. Ekua is married to a teacher and has six dependents.  She has been selling the above for 12 years.  She uses her income to assist her husband in paying their utility bills. Ekua will use her loan to purchase a variety of  fruit and other foodstuffs for sale. With the new profit Ekua will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of  fruit and other foodstuffs for sale.

loans.name: Naime

texts.en:
Naime lives in Kosovo. She is married and the mother of five children (three boys and two girls); two of them go to school. She loves her children very much; they are her reason to keep going. 

Naime is an enthusiastic person, who puts all her effort into helping her children get ahead. She is running a small business in her kiosk. She sells seeds, pistachios, etc. Naime  has been in this business for a long time. She works at the business 30 days per month and 12 hours a day.

Her business is the only source of income she has. 

Naime has requested a loan in order to renovate her kiosk.

In the future, she plans to expand and grow her business and improve her standard of living. She appreciates KosInvest –KIVA support.

loans.use: To renovate her kiosk

loans.name: Peris

texts.en:
Peris is 25 years old. She is married to Bernard and together they have two children. She is a farmer and has been in the business for the past seven years. She gets a monthly income of KES 15,000.

This is her second loan cycle. She repaid her previous loan well and in good time. She was introduced to KADET LTD by  a credit officer. She will use the loan amount to purchase two sheep to rear and sell later, and also buy farm inputs.

She hopes to diversify and start rearing sheep for resale.

loans.use: to purchase two  sheep for rearing and also  buy  farm inputs.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan has been managing rice farming and vegetable vending businesses as the primary sources of income for her family. Chan pays mainly for her daily food and allowances for her children. Chan's husband operates a motorcycle transportation business and also provides income for the family. Chan and her husband have six children, three of whom are married and live separately with their new families.

Chan would like to improve her farming business, so she is asking for a loan of KHR 3,000,000 to purchase a buffalo to maintain the rice field. She is very grateful for the given funds which improve her standard of living. Chan hopes that, through her hard work, she will be able to attain success in her business.

loans.use: to purchase a buffalo to maintain the rice field.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
Ricardo esta casado y tiene seis hijos que están en etapa escolar, viven en casa propia ocupando cinco habitaciones con paredes de ladrillo y el piso de tierra, la casa esta ubicada en la zona El Tejar de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente percibe ingresos ya que trabaja cono chofer por más de diez  horas al día y hasta altas horas de la noche siendo el único que cubre los gastos de alimentación, educación y gastos médicos.
El crédito lo requiere para la refacción de cuatro habitaciones ya que las paredes son de ladrillo y desea realizar la obra fina y el pintado para mejorar su calidad de vida.
El sueño de Ricardo es tener mejores ingresos para poder solventar los gastos de estudios universitarios de sus hijos.
Es la segunda vez que solícita el crédito junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Ricardo is married and has six children who are of school age. They live in their own home where they occupy five rooms that consist of brick walls and dirt floors. The house is located in the District of El Tejar in the city of La Paz.

Ricardo currently earns income by working more than 10 hours a day as a chauffeur. He works into the late hours of the evening since this is the only source of income by which he is able to cover expenses such as food, education, and medical care. The loan he is requesting will be used to repair four rooms. The walls are made of brick, but he wants to add paint and finishing touches so that his quality of life can improve.

Ricardo dreams of having more income so that he can pay for his children’s educational expenses at the university. This is the second time he has requested a loan from IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to repair four rooms in his home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building and drainage materials.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua  is a fishmonger and also sells cooking utenstils and surcepans  at Besease near Elmina. She is married to a farmer and has four children.  She has been a fishmonger for the past 10 years now. Efua uses her income to assist her husband in the upkeep of their children. She will use her loan to purchase more fish, cooking utenstils and saucepans to sell. Efua will expand her business with her new profit.

loans.use: to purchase more fish, cooking utenstils and saucepans to sell

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua sells cloth. She lives with her husband and three children in Besease, near Elmina. Ekua has been selling cloth for three years now. She uses her income to support her husband in feeding and clothing their children. Ekua will use her loan to purchase cloth to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth to sell.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah is a petty trader who has been selling  footwear for 15 years. She lives in Besease, near Elmina. Hannah is married and has 2 children. She uses her income to help her husband pay their accommodation bills. Hannah will use her loan to purchase footwear to sell. With the new profit from her expanded business, she wishes to build a shop to sell the footwear.

loans.use: to purchase  footwear to sell

loans.name: Sopheap's Group

texts.en:
Sopheap is a 38-year-old rural villager living in the Mongkul Borey district of Battambang Province (Cambodia). She is the mother of three children, two of whom are dependent on her for support and helping their family’s business. For the past 10 years, Sopheap has earned a living by farming rice on one hectare of farmland, earning approximately KHR 25,000 per day. She supplements her income by working as a paid laborer. Sopheap's main challenge is the declining of crop yields ruined by flood in the past year.

Sopheap’s group consists of two members who have been with VisionFund for two cycles; she is the group leader. Sopheap has completely repaid her loans which have enabled her to maintain her lifestyle. She is now requesting 600,000 KHR and the other group member is seeking 200,000 KHR. Sopheap is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and insecticide to protect her crop. She hopes to receive more crop yields so that she can earn more profit.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and insecticide for her farmland

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
La socia Celia nació en el departamento del Cusco y vive en la mima ciudad donde nació, ella tiene 38 años de edad y tiene cuatro hijos. Su actividad económica principal de la socia Celia es la venta de productos de primera necesidad, ella tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes donde vende sus productos y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad la socia Celia requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar, fideos, tarros de leche y otras cosas más.  

La socia Celia pertenece al banco comunal “Unión Latina” y le va muy bien pues una persona responsable y puntual.
texts.en:
Celia is 38 years old, she has four children, she was born in the department of Cusco and she lives in the same town where she was born. Celia’s main activity is selling basic necessities: she runs a small grocery store where she sells her products and thing are going very well. In this occasion, Celia is requesting a loan to buy products such as bags of rice, bags of sugar, noodles, canned milk and other products.

Celia is a member of the Communal Bank “Union Latina” (Latin Union), and it is very good for her, because she is a very responsible and punctual person.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice, bags of sugar, noodles and canned milk.

loans.name: Vicentina

texts.es: La socia Vicentina sigue participando en el banco comunal “Luz del Sur” y le va muy bien gracias a los pagos puntuales de sus cuotas, ella sigue trabajando como estilista y tiene un pequeño salón de belleza pero el local donde trabaja es alquilado y le va muy bien. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio pero todas manera le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad la socia Vicentina requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como champús, acondicionadores y otras cosas más. La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en: Vicentina keeps on being a member of the Communal Bank “Luz del Sur” (Southern Light), and things are going very well for her because she punctually repays her dues. She keeps on working as a stylist and running her small beauty salon; she pays rent for the locale where she works and things are going very well. She has been engaged in this activity for many years already and things are going well. In this occasion Vicentina is requesting a loan to buy working tools such as shampoos, conditioners and other supplies. She is grateful for the loan and she commits to complying with the repayment of her dues according to the repayment schedule.

loans.use: To buy shampoos, conditioners and other supplies.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
El socio Cesar sigue participando en el banco comunal “Luz del Sur” y le va muy bien gracias a los pagos puntuales de sus cuotas, él sigue fabricando estructuras metálicas como por ejemplo para ventanas, puertas, barandas y otras cosas más. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad el socio Cesar requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como fierros, pintura y otras cosas más. 

El socio agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Cesar keeps on being a member of the Communal Bank “Luz del Sur” (Southern Light), and it is going very well for him as he is punctual in his repayments. He keeps on creating metal structures such as window frames, door frames, railings and other items, an activity he has been engaged in for many years, and things are going very well. In this occasion Cesar is requesting a loan to buy materials for his job such as iron, paint and other supplies.

He is grateful for the loan and he commits to complying with the repayment of his dues according to schedule.

loans.use: To buy working tools such as iron and paint.

loans.name: Shahzoda

texts.en:
Shahzoda’s name, which means ‘queen,’ is appropriate since she is as beautiful and brainy as a queen. Good-natured and kind-hearted, this divorcee raising her child alone is also persistent and always works with pleasure. For more than eight years she has been busy with her business selling national skullcaps for women and men.

With her business skills, Shahzoda’s enterprise has been steadily developing day by day, and although her income is modest she is using it to improve her and her son's living conditions. Now requesting a loan to buy goods for the new season, she awaits your help and support.

loans.use: to buy goods for the new season.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is a 33-year-old woman from Kisumu. She is married to Erick, a driver, and they have two children, 5 and 10. For the past 2 years, Ruth has operated a beauty salon business, making a monthly income of KES 6,000. Due to the rise of customers requiring more complex services, Ruth has applied for her first loan of KES 20,000 from KADET LTD to buy a blow dryer, hair dryer and chemicals. She will use the anticipated profits to grow the business. Ruth's dream is to be a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: To buy salon items such as a dryers and chemicals.

loans.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en:
Mwanaidi, 35, is from Msambweni. She has worked in a beauty salon for two years, which has helped her develop a good clientele that always goes to her. After getting some experience in Msambweni, Mwanaidi came to open her place here. She is a very hardworking and enterprising person with a great desire to get ahead to help her family. 

Mwanaidi is requesting this loan to buy supplies such as dyes, creams, curlers, and other necessary items for her beauty salon to stock her business and so continue giving her customers good service.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as dyes, creams and curlers

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama  has been selling cooking utensils, saucepans and bowls in Beasase, near Elmina, for many years.  She is married to a trader and has 4 children. Ama supports her husband in paying their children’s school fees. She will use her loan to purchase more cooking utensils, saucepans and bowls to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a shop to sell her items.

loans.use: to purchase more cooking utensils, saucepans and bowls to sell

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es:
Don Manuel  Antonio, tiene 55 años de edad, soltero,  vive en  la aldea Petoa de Santa Bárbara.
 Quien tiene desde hace 15 años una pulpería donde vende productos de la canasta básica familiar, anteriormente vendía comida y decidió establecer este negocio de pulpería porque es más rentable, los productos que vende son arroz, refrescos, productos enlatados, lácteos, azúcar, manteca, churros, dulces, productos de abarrotes etc. Este negocio lo ha mantenido estable mediante varios préstamos que ha solicitado a ODEF, y actualmente solicita el treceavo préstamo que  es por 15,000 Lempiras para surtir de productos comestibles su negocio y aprovechar que es buena temporada. Su meta es hacer crecer el negocio y que en su familia siempre haya unidad y solvencia económica.
texts.en:
Don Manuel Antonio is 55 years old, single, and lives in the neighborhood of Petoa de Santa Bárbara.

For the past 15 years, he has managed a store where he sells basic household products. He previously sold food, but decided to open a store because this type of business is more profitable. The merchandise he sells includes rice, soft drinks, canned goods, dairy products, sugar, lard, donuts, and other grocery products. This business has remained stable as a result of the various loans he has requested from ODEF.

Manuel is currently requesting his 13th loan in the amount of 15,000 HNL so that he can restock his business with food products and take advantage of this good season. His goal is to grow his business so that his family will always be unified and financially solvent.

loans.use: to buy various food products for his store.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Víctor es casado y tiene doce hijos pero ya son todos independientes, vive con su esposa, tienen casa propia y esta ubicada en la zona Llojeta de la ciudad de La Paz.
El estudio solo hasta la secundaria y actualmente trabaja como chofer en un sindicato de transporte público trabajando por más de diez horas al día ya que es el único que cubre los gastos de alimentación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para la refacción de su baño en su vivienda ya que se encuentra deteriorado y desgastado.
El sueño de Víctor, es mejorar sus ingresos y poner un negocio en su domicilio para que lo atienda su esposa ya que con lo que él gana no les alcanza.
Es la segunda vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Víctor is married and has 12 children, but all of them are independent. He and his wife live in their own home in the District of Llojeta in the city of La Paz.

Víctor only has a high school education. He currently works as a chauffeur for a public transportation union for more than 10 hours a day. This is the only source of income that he has to cover the cost of food and basic services for his family. The loan he is requesting will be used to remodel a bathroom in his home that has deteriorated and eroded.

Víctor dreams of improving his income and establishing a business in his home that his wife can manage since the income he earns is not enough. This is the second time he has worked with IMPRO, but the first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to remodel a bathroom in his home.

loans.name: Juana Yovana

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  es la señora Juana, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los Lideres” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. Nuestra socia se sigue dedicando a la comercialización de muebles, ella compra y vende muebles para el hogar y la oficina. Juana en esta oportunidad invertirá el préstamo solicitado comprar muebles como modulares y confortables para sala.
Juana está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y ayudarla a mantener y desarrollarse en sus actividades económicas.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
This is our member, Juana.  She belongs to the Los Lideres Communal Bank from the city of Cusco, Peru.  Our member is still selling furniture for a living.  She buys and sells home and office furniture.  This time, Juana will use the requested loan to buy comfortable, modular home furniture.  

Juana is very thankful to Kiva for allowing her to give her family a better quality of life and for helping her maintain and develop her business activities.

She is thankful for the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase living-room furniture

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Nuestro socio  es el señor  Juan, él pertenece al banco comunal “Los Lideres” de la ciudad del Cusco - Perú, nuestro socio sigue dedicándose a la mecánica automotriz en su taller, por ello invertirá el préstamo solicitado para comprar repuestos para los vehículos que repara.
Juan está muy agradecido con KIVA por permitirle mantenerse en su actividad y por apoyarlo con su familia.
El socio agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Our member is Sr. Juan, who belongs to the "Los Lideres" communal bank in Cusco, Peru. He continues dedicating himself to automobile repair in his shop, and with the requested loan he will purchase parts for the vehicles that he repairs. 

Juan is very grateful to Kiva for allowing him to keep working in his activity and for supporting his family. 

He appreciates the loan and promises to comply with the payments in his payment plan.

loans.use: to buy auto parts for his mechanics shop

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a lovely and beautiful woman. She is also very clever and smart. Mejumaa is married and has seven children, four of whom attend school.

For 2 years, Mejumaa has been busy selling omena (small dried fish) at the market. She has established a good customer base. Mejumaa also farms. She is requesting this loan to purchase sacks of dried fish and to invest part of it in farming. Mejumaa's goal is to own a rental house and to construct a permanent house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of dried fish and to help with her farming

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  es la señora Victoria, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Reyna de los Angeles” de la provincia de Urubamba en Cusco – Perú. Nuestra socia se sigue dedicando a la producción y el comercio mayorista de verduras como legumbres y hortalizas, y lo distribuyen en los diferentes mercados de la región, pero también a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas,los engorda y luego los comercializa en el mercado. Estas actividaded son muy recurrentes en esta parte de la regiòn debido a que el clima de Urubamba es propicio para el cultivo y la produccion de verduras y hortalizas, así como la crianza de algunos animales menores. Victoria en esta oportunidad invertirá el préstamo solicitado para comprar Gallinas y cuyes para aumentar su producción y satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
Victoria está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia ya que con estas actividades pudo educar a su hijos que ya son adultose independientes, y por ayudarla con el crecimiento y fortalecimiento de sus actividades.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the “Reyna de los Angeles” community bank in Urubamba province in Cusco – Peru. She works in the production and wholesaling of vegetables, such beans and greens, and distributes them to markets in the region. She also raises and sells small animals, like guinea pigs and hens. In this loan cycle, Victoria will invest her funds in buying hens and guinea pigs, which she will fatten and then sell in the market. These activities are very common in this part of the region because of the climate of Urubamba is good for growing and cultivating vegetables and small animals. 

In this opportunity, Victoria will use the loan to purchase hens and guinea pigs to increase her production and satisfy the demand of her clients. 

Victoria is very grateful to Kiva for allowing her to give a better quality of life to her family since with these activities she can educate her children who are independent adults, and help them grow and strengthen their activities.

loans.use: to purchase hens and guinea pigs

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
EL SEÑOR ANTONIO: se encuentra casado, con 3 hijos
antonio decea poder bardear  y terminar el patio trasero de su vivienda
para poder asi tener su propia privacidad de el i de su familia
al mismo tiempo tener seguridad en su hogar
ya que hoy en día se vive mucha inseguridad
por lo cual antonio decea proteger a su familia asi mismo al patrimonio 
que en un futuro les dejara a sus hijos
asi antonio mejora la calidad de vida de el y de su familia.
texts.en: Antonio is married with 3 children.  Antonio wants to be able to fence in and finish the back patio on his house to be able to have his privacy for himself and his family.  At the same time, he will have a more secure home since he currently lives with great insecurity.  Therefore, Antonio wants to protect his family as well as the future he will leave to his children, so Antonio is improving the quality of his life and his family's life.

loans.use: to build fencing and a floor for the back patio.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila is from Msambweni. She is single and runs a store within her home, selling beverages. She has formed a customer base and brings in a good monthly income. She is a very hardworking, responsible and honest lady. She tells how she began with a small kiosk selling fast food. Her dream was always to have a well-stocked store with many customers. She is grateful to Yehu Microfinance because, thanks to their help, she is fulfilling her dream.

Jamila has approached Yehu Microfinance and Kiva to request a loan, which she wants to use to purchase drinks, dairy products, baked goods, meat and other stock to meet the needs of her customers and increase her daily sales that motivate her every day to get ahead. .

loans.use: to purchase drinks, dairy products, baked goods, meat and other stock

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy  sells   cosmetics,  hair relaxers,  and pomade at  Besease near Elmina.  She is married.  She  has been selling   cosmetics for four  years.  She helps her husband  in the upkeep the family. Marcy will use her loan to purchase more   cosmetics and hair relaxers  for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her expanded business to aquire a shop for the sale of the cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics  and hair relaxers  for sale

loans.name: Saoret's Group

texts.en:
Saoret lives in a rural area of the MongKul Borey district of Banteay Meanchey province, Cambodia. She is married with five children, one daughter of whom is still dependent on her for support. Rice farming on two hectares of farmland is the only main source of family’s income for Saoret. She has been in this business for twenty years and is able to earn about KHR 23,000 per day. Low crop yield is still the main challenge for her business.

Saoret’s group consists of three members who live in the same village; they have been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for two cycles. Saoret successfully paid back the past loans and is now leading the group to request a loan. She is going to use her portion of KHR 1,000,000 to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland. She hopes to earn more income so as to have enough capital to expand her business and to have a proper house.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 44 years old and lives in Silongon, Tudela. Emma is married with four children. 

Emma has a store that sells a variety of products. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 8000 PHP to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

Emma has been a member of PMPC for 7 years.  In the future, Emma hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo, 19, has one child who is still too young for school. She established her grocery store from her savings. In this way, she became independent and, thanks to her sales strategy, she grew her business. Mwanakombo is a very hardworking person and she shows it every day working in her small store, thanks to which she gives her child everything.

Mwanakombo is requesting this loan to buy a variety of beverages, sugar and flour. She is grateful to Yehu Microfinance for the opportunity it is giving her; it is very important support for her because the loan is her only opportunity to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy a variety of beverages, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Rhuhekekuguma Group

texts.fr: Sifa est trésorière dans le groupe de credit  rhuhekekuguma. Agée de 34 ans est  mariée à un taxi man  et  mère de 7enfants  dont 5 sont scolarisés. Elle vend  divers produits vivriers (huile raffinée, riz, sel, sucre et farine) depuis  1998.  Elle compte s’approvisionner en 8 sacs de riz, 1 bidon de 20 litres  d’huile raffinée et  1 sac de sucre (50 kg).  Son vœu est de construire une maison commerciale.  Elle souhaite à Hekima la prospérité.
texts.en: Sifa is the treasurer of the borrowing group called Rhuhekekuguma. Aged 34, she is married to a taxi driver and the mother of seven children, of whom five are enrolled in school. She has been selling various foodstuffs (refined oil, rice, salt, sugar and flour) since 1998.  She intends to add to her inventory: eight sacks of rice, one 20-liter jerrycan of refined oil, and one sack of 50 kilos of sugar. Her dream is to construct a commercial house. She wishes prosperity for Hekima.

loans.use: to buy eight sacks of rice, one 20-liter jerrycan of refined oil, and one 50 kilo sack of sugar

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Hayotullo

texts.en: For more than 3 years, Hayotullo has been busy driving. He serves as a taxi man to local people and all of his clients are happy with him. His business has been developing year by year because he has a good ability to attract clients. Hayotullo has a lovely wife but they haven’t any children. They want a child but their house is in bad condition and they must prepare it for a little child. You are the only who can help Hayotullo. He is asking for a loan to buy building materials to repair his house. He awaits your help and support.

loans.use: To buy building materials to repair his house

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua  is a food vendor who   cooks   rice and bean stew for sale at  Besease  near  Elmina.  Ekua  is married   and has six  children.  She has been in this business for six  years now.  She uses her income to  help her husband to feed their children. 

 Ekua  will use her loan to purchase bags of rice and beans to perpare her food to sell.  With the new profit,  Ekua  plans to build a better stall for the sale of her food.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice and beans to prepare her food to sell

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Rufina is 60 years old and comes from Loboc, Bohol. She is married with three adult children. Rufina has a good skill at direct selling of products which she puts to good use. She is into direct selling of assorted shirts, blouses and pants from Personal Collection, Natasha and Boardwalk. 

Rufina is asking for a loan to buy additional stock like household cleaners, lotion, body talc, body wash, cologne, shirts and blouses. Her income will enable her to help her husband who works as a carpenter. Her income will cover expenses for food and household bills like electricity and water.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like household cleaners, lotion, body talc, body wash, cologne, shirts and blouses

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline, 49 years old, is married and has three children. She is from Bohol, Philippines, where she is engaged in beauty services such as hair cutting, manicures and pedicures. This business provides her with the income that she needs for her family.

Evangeline is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy additional materials such as nail polish, alcohol, hair coloring and other items, for her business, thus giving her more opportunity to cater to more customers. Evangeline hopes to improve her livelihood so that she can send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for lifestyle and beauty services

loans.name: Chiquitas De Cascada Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CHIQUITAS DE CASCADA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Rosa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: artesanía en lana, pastelería, artesanía en tejido, macramé, venta de comida, venta de verduras, taller de chaperia.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Rosa es una integrante, ella indica que desde hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una familiar que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de verduras, ella cuenta que hace cinco años atrás emprendió este negocio conjuntamente su madre.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para la ampliación de su capital (compra de verduras) mismo que comprará de las ferias de la Ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en las ferias de la Ciudad de El Alto, en sus puestos fijos. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es soltera y tiene una hija.  

Cuando se le consulta que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta estar con las compañeras.

En la fotografía no se encuentra la señora Nancy a causa de consulta médica.
texts.en:
Chiquitas de Cascada Communal Bank will start its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Cascada regional office.  It is made up of nine members governed by a board of directors of which Rosa is the president.  The varied businesses that the members of the communal bank carry out include wool handicrafts, a bakery, woven handicrafts, macrame, food sales, vegetable sales, and an auto body shop.

The loan they are going to get will benefit small micro-businesses of which Rosa is a member.  She points out that she has been with Pro Mujer for a year, joining on the invitation of a family member who is a member of the institution.  Currently she has a business selling vegetables that she started five years ago with her mother.

The loan she will get is to expand her capital buying vegetables, which she will buy at the markets in the city of La Paz and later sell in the markets in El Alto, in her stalls.  This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family as much as possible, because she is single and has a daughter.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes to be with her colleagues.

Nancy is not in the photograph because she had a medical appointment.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en: Cynthia  sells cassava and plantains at Besease near Elmina; she has done this for three years now. Cynthia is married to a mason and has five dependents. Cynthia uses her income to assist her husband in the upkeep of their family. She will use her loan to purchase more cassava and plantains for sale. Cynthia will expand her business with her new profit.

loans.use: to purchase more cassava and plantains for sale.

loans.name: Sophorn's Group

texts.en:
Sophorn, 32 years old, is the mother of four dependent children. She is a rural villager from the MongKul Borey district of Banteay Meanchey province. For the past 5 years, Sophorn has grown rice as the only main source of family income.

Sophorn’s group consists of three female members who are applying for a loan of KHR 1,000,000 each. Sophorn and one other member have been with VisionFund for four cycles while the third member has just joined VisionFund. Sophorn has used her past loans with success, improving her family’s living conditions because she can earn approximately KHR 30,000 per day. As group leader, Sophorn is going to use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizers, rice seeds, and gasoline for water pumping for her farmland. She is also going to use a portion of it to pay a harvesting fee. Sophorn hopes that this loan will enable her to earn more income so as to have a better standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Imperio Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “IMPERIO” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por siete integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Filomena es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de ganado y verduras, artesana en tejido de chompas, venta de ropa, trenzado de mantas, venta de frutas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Filomena es una integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de asesora de la institución que vino a su casa a promocionar. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de artesanía (elaboración y venta de mantas) aprendiendo este oficio de sus padres desde hace tiempo atrás, ya que es un negocio familiar.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para la ampliación de su capital (compra de lanas) mismo que comprará de las ferias tradicionales del departamento de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará a pedido de las clientas. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros.
texts.en:
The community association "Imperio" is beginning their first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as a part of the regional office of Senkata.  They are made up of seven member of the association and guided by a board of directors, in which Filomena is the president.  The business activities of the members of the association as varied and among them we have: poultry and vegetable sales, weaving of jackets, clothing sales, blanket weaving, and fruit sales.

The loan they will receive will benefit small businesses in which Filomena is a participant, and she says that this is the first time that she has joined together with Pro Mujer, coming in via the invitation of a consultant from the lending institution who came to her house to promote it.  Currently, she has a business in crafts (the creation and sales of blankets), which she learned to make with her parents a long time ago, since it is a family business.

The loan that she will now receive is to expand her capital investment through buying wools, which she will get at the traditional markets of the department of La Paz and then after weaving she will sell them according to the wishes of her customers.  This type of works will generate income to support her family to the greatest possible extent, as she lives in a common law marriage and has three children.

When asked what she most likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she likes the savings.

loans.use: to buy sheep's wool.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy various goods such as lotions, milk, bread, sugar, soap, juice, etc. for resale.

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en: Gifty sells cloth. She lives together with the husband and three children at Besease  near Elmina.  Gifty  has been selling cloth for three years now. She uses her income to help her husband to feed and clothe their children. Gifty will use her loan to purchase cloth to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth to sell

loans.name: Placida

texts.es:
Placida es una mujer de 45 años, se encuentra felizmente casada y tiene 3 hijos, con quienes vive en la ciudad de Nazca, ella es una persona muy amable, entusiasta y trabajadora, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos junto con los de su esposo para sacar adelante a su familia, lamentablemente por la necesidad de trabajar y ayudar a sus padres, Placida no pudo culminar sus estudios secundarios, pero le hubiera gustado poder hacerlo; en sus ratos libres le gusta ver programas educativos y noticieros  en televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina un delicioso Locro para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, día a día Placida trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de queso y adicionalmente para obtener algunos ingresos vende cervezas; ella dedica a su negocio un aproximado de 10 horas diarias, ella se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien ya que sus clientes la recomiendan por sus buenos precios y por su trato amable.
Placida se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que desea poder realizar los acabados, tales como: tarrajeado, pintado, puesta de piso y ventas para su hogar; de esta manera Placida podrá brindar mayor seguridad y bienestar para su familia, así como un ambiente mas cómodo y grato para el desarrollo de sus queridos hijos, y en un futuro no muy lejano desea poder terminar la construcción , y en un futuro no muy lejano desea poder terminar la construcción total de su vivienda para poder iniciar un pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes, para con ello poder asegurar la educación y futuro de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Placida is a 45-year-old woman who is happily married and has three children. She and her family live in the city of Nazca. Placida is a friendly, enthusiastic, and hardworking individual. All of her efforts and those of her husband are geared toward moving their family forward. Unfortunately, Placida was not able to finish her high school studies because she needed to work and help her parents. However, she enjoys what she does. In her free time, Placida likes to watch the news and educational programs on TV. On a few occasions, she prepares the delicious “locro” (Peruvian squash stew) to share with her family.

Through her own initiative, Placida works with great effort and dedication each day at her small business of selling cheese. She also earns some income by selling beer. Placida works at her business approximately 10 hours each day. She enjoys her job and believes she is doing well since her customers recommend her because of her good prices and friendly service.

Placida is extremely grateful to the Kiva lenders. Thanks to the assistance they will provide, she will be able to make improvements to her home. She wants to add finishing touches such as plaster, paint, floor tiles, and windows to her home. This will provide her family with greater security and well-being. These improvements will also result in a more comfortable and pleasant environment in which her children can develop. In the not-so-distant future, Placida wants to completely finish the construction of her home so that she can start a small grocery business in order to secure an education and a future for her children.

loans.use: to pay for home improvements.

loans.name: Gotitas De Limon Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “GOTITAS DE LIMÓN” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por siete integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Cristina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: taller de costura de mochilas, venta de chompas, venta de busos, venta de comida, venta de chamarras, tienda de barrio.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Cristina es una integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una de sus compañeras que es socia de nuestra institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de chompas aprendiendo este oficio conjuntamente su hermana agrandando este negocio poco a poco desde hace tres años.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para la ampliación de su capital (compra de chompas) mismo que comprará de las ferias tradicionales de la Ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto fijo. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros, las capacitaciones, el consultorio, el crédito, etc.
texts.en:
The community association "Gotitas de Limón" (Lime Drops) will begin their first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as a part of the regional office of Senkata.  They are a group of seven individuals, and they are guided by a board on which Cristina is the president.  The businesses of the community association's members are varied and include among them: a backpack making business, sweater sales, sales of pullovers, food sales, blanket sales, and a local store.

The loan she will receive goes to benefit the small businesses of the group Cristina belongs to, and she says this is the first time she has received a loan from Pro Mujer, joining by the invitation of a friend of hers who is already a member of the institution.  She currently has a small business selling sweaters, a business she is learning to do alongside her sister and building their business little by little over the past three years.

The loan she will receive will build her working capital through buying sweaters, which she buys in the traditional markets of the city of La Paz and then sells at her own market stall.  This line of work generates income to support her family in the best possible way, as she lives in a civil union and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she likes the savings, the workshops, the consulting, the loans, etc.

loans.use: to buy sweaters.

loans.name: Barno

texts.ru:
Барно проживает в городе Душанбе. Ей 43 года. Она замужем. У нее один ребенок. Барно имеет собственный бизнес.

Барно работает на рынке Корвон. Она занимается торговлей женского белья на протяжении 6 лет. В торговле ей помогает ее муж. Барно трудолюбивая. В будущем она планирует открыть свой магазин. 

Барно просит кредит для покупки купальников и женского нижнего белья с целью увеличения ассортимента товара.
texts.en: Barno lives in the city of Dushanbe.  She is 43 years old, married and has one child.  Barno has her own business.  She works at the Korvon market.  She has been involved in selling women's undergarments for six years.  Her husband helps her with the sales.  Barno is hardworking.  She plans to open her own store in the future.  Barno is requesting this loan to purchase swimming suits and women's undergarments in order to expand the merchandise selection.

loans.use: to purchase swimming suits and women's undergarments

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more drinks like Fanta for resale.

loans.name: Ayebi

texts.en: Ayebi  sells doughnuts at Besease near Elmina.  She is married  and has three children.  Ayebi has been selling doughnuts for 15 years. She uses her income to assist her husband in paying utility bills. She will use her loan to buy flour, sugar and cooking oil to prepare her doughnuts. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: buy flour, sugar and cooking oil to prepare her doughnuts.

loans.name: Mupa

texts.en:
Mupa is 36 years old and lives in the town of Ukunda in the Coastal region of Kenya. She is married and has four children who are all currently in school. For the past one year, Mupa has been working hard to manage her small business, where she buys and sells chickens.

To help expand her business, Mupa has requested a loan of 10,000 Kenyan Shillings from Yehu. The loan will be used to buy chickens and chicken feed, and will help her to generate greater profits. Mupa hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a retail shop.

loans.use: to buy chickens and chicken feed

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua sells maize at Besease, which is near Elmina. She has been selling this for 6 years. Ekua is married to a farmer and has 3 children. Ekua assists her husband in providing for their family. Her loan will be used to purchase bags of maize to sell. She plans to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase bags of maize to sell

loans.name: 6 De Junio 2 Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “6 DE JUNIO 2” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Paulina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: costura de faldas, venta de aceite, venta de palillos de tejer, taller de carrocería, tejido y venta de mantas, venta de pensión.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Paulina es una integrante, ella indica que desde hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora que trabaja en la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido y venta de mantas, ella cuenta que aprendió este oficio de una tía que realizaba mantas y posteriormente emprendió su propio negocio.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para la mejoramiento de su negocio (compra de máquina de tejer) mismo que comprará las tiendas distribuidoras y posteriormente lo instalara en su espacio de trabajo. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es soltera y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The community association "6 de Junio 2" (6 of June 2)will begin their second loan cycle with Pro Mujer as a part of the regional office of Cascada. They are a group of six individuals, and they are guided by a board on which Paulina is the president. The businesses of the community association's members are varied and include among them: sewing skirts, oil sales, sales of knitting needles, an auto-body repair shop, weaving and sales of blankets, and sales of annuities.

The loan she will receive goes to benefit the small businesses of the group Paulina belongs to, and she says that it has been two years since she became a member of Pro Mujer, joining by the invitation of a promoter who works for the institution. She currently has a small business weaving and selling blankets, and she says she learned this work from her aunt who made blankets and then learned to run her own business.

The loan she will receive will improve her business through buying a weaving machine, which she will buy from a store and the have installed in her workshop. This line of work generates income to support her family in the best possible way, as she is single and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she likes the health workshops and the loans.

loans.use: to buy a weaving machine.

loans.name: Mamurjon

texts.en: Mamurjon is a man who cooks very tasty foods. He has been busy in this kind of business for more than 8 years. He has his own café in the centre of town. His tasty foods attract many clients. His lovely wife helps him with his business. They have 2 children and try to do the best for them. Mamurjon’s eldest son wants to marry a lovely girl, but Mamurjon's income is small and isn't enough to pay for his son’s marriage. He is asking for a loan to pay for his son’s marriage. His son and his girlfriend wait for your support.

loans.use: To pay for his son’s marriage

loans.name: Sok's Group

texts.en:
A resident from a rural village of the Sangke district of Battambang, Cambodia, Sok is a 37-year-old married woman with eight children, seven of whom are living with her and work at the family’s business. She earns a living through rice farming and  growing vegetables such as soybeans and cabbages, which she has been doing for 20 years. With her current business, she can earn about KHR 60,800 per day. 

The main challenge for her is low crop yields resulting from flood. Sok is leading this group of two members who have been with VisionFund for three cycles. She has successfully managed to pay back the past loans that have helped her gradually improve her family’s livelihood. She and the other member are applying for KHR 1,000,000 each. Sok will use her portion to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her income so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Lyzle

texts.en:
Lyzle is a 26-year-old married woman and a mother of three young children ages 5, 3, and two years old. Lyzle lives in Tagbilaran, Bohol, Philiipines. She has had a sari-sari store or grocery store business for more than a year now. This is the source of their income.

Lyzle is applying for a loan worth 4000 PHP to buy more items  to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and other snack foods. With the loan, Lyzle will be able to augment her stock thus she can cater for more customers in their community.

Lyzle dreams of expanding her business to increase her income so that she will be able send her children to school and provide them a better life. Any additional revenue will be used to finance the family's daily consumption and savings.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and other snack foods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy large quantities of meat for resale.

loans.name: Biasha

texts.en:
Biasha is a married woman who has two children who are still too young for school. She is a dressmaker who has a small sewing workshop where she works hard every day.

She got started in this line of work with a friend who taught her how to sew. She also used to work with a friend, and in this way she saved some money. Now she is a professional in her work. She works making all types of garments.

She is requesting a loan to buy fabric, thread, buttons, sewing needles and other supplies so that she can continue to work and fill her customers' orders. She thanks Kiva and Yehu Microfinance for the opportunity she is receiving, because it will be a great help to her.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, buttons, sewing needles and other supplies

loans.name: Zubaida's Group

texts.en:
Zubaida is married and has four sons. Three of them work and are involved in a milk selling business. Zubaida supports her family by selling clothes. She knows about latest trends in fashion and provides good quality clothes to her clients for very reasonable rates. She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for further improvement of her clothes selling business.

With the loan investment she will buy clothes in bulk quantity and of better variety that will help her attract more clients towards her business and increase her sales and income.

loans.use: To buy clothes for clothes selling business

loans.name: Rimma

texts.ru:
Римма вдова, имеет двое взрослых дочерей. Римма владеет бизнесом по продаже женской и подростковой одежды. Больше всего продаются подростковые платья, блузки, юбки, свитера, кофты. Занимается она этим бизнесом уже 14 лет. За это время она приобрела опыт и постоянных клиентов, что важно для успешной торговли.

Римма просит предоставить ей кредит на закупку школьной одежды на осень. Сейчас она может купить ее оптом по выгодной цене, что поможет ей получить дополнительную прибыль в августе.  Римма планирует развивать свой бизнес дальше и увеличивать торговый оборот.
texts.en: Rimma is a widow and has two adult daughters.  She owns a business of selling women's and adolescent clothing.  Adolescent dresses, blouses, skirts, sweaters and cardigans sell the most.  Rimma has been involved in this business for 14 years.  Over this period of time, she acquired experience and regular customers, both of which are important for successful sales.  Rimma is requesting this loan to purchase school uniforms for the autumn.  Currently, she can purchase the uniforms wholesale at an advantageous price, which would help her to make an additional profit in August.  Rimma plans to develop her business further and increase her goods turnover.

loans.use: to purchase school uniforms and clothing at an advantageous price for subsequent resale

loans.name: Las Inolvidables De San Felipe Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS INOLVIDABLES DE SAN FELIPE” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Eleuteria es la Presidentaa. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: costura de enaguas, venta de lana de alpaca y vicuña, tienda de barrio, tejido de chompas, tejido de ponchos y tejido a macramé, venta de gelatinas, costura de faldas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Eleuteria es una integrante, ella indica que desde hace seis meses que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de llantas, ella cuenta que hace cinco años atrás emprendió este negocio conjuntamente su esposo ya que es un emprendimiento familiar.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para la ampliación de su capital (compra de llantas) mismo que comprará de las empresas distribuidoras y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de comercialización, en sus puestos fijos. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
The community association "Los Inolvidables de San Felipe" (The Unforgettables of San Felipe) will begin their second loan cycle with Pro Mujer as a part of the regional office of Cascada. They are a group of eight individuals, and they are guided by a board on which Eleuteria is the president. The businesses of the community association's members are varied and include among them: sewing petticoats, the sales of alpaca and vicuna wool, a local corner store, weaving of sweaters, weaving of ponchos and macramé work, jelly sales, and sewing of skirts.

The loan she will receive goes to benefit the small businesses of the group Eleuteria belongs to, and she says that it has been six months since she became a member of Pro Mujer, joining by the invitation of a friend who is also a member of the institution. She currently has a small business in tire sales; she tell us that it's been about five years since she learned to run this business together with her spouse as a family business.

The loan she will receive will improve her business through buying a tires, which she will buy from a distribution center and then sell at her own sales points in her stores. This line of work generates income to support her family as much as possible, as she is married and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she likes the health center.

loans.use: to buy tires.

loans.name: Ivan

texts.ru:
Иван женат, у него двое взрослых детей. Она занимается продажей продуктов питания на рынке в г. Мелитополь. Иван - трудолюбивый и ответственный. Он пользуется бизнес кредитами и всегда выплачивает их вовремя. В бизнесе Ивана бывают спады торговли, но несмотря на это Иван продолжает двигаться вперед и развивать свой бизнес.
Иван просит предоставить ему кредит на расширение ассортимента.
texts.en: Ivan is married and has two adult children.  He is involved in selling food products at a market in the city of Melitopol.  Ivan is hardworking and responsible.  He uses business loans and always repays them on-time.  Ivan's business has periodic drops in sales, but, despite this, he continues to move forward and develop his business.  Ivan is requesting this loan to expand his selection.

loans.use: to purchase mayonnaise, sunflower oil, canned fish, etc.

loans.name: Ilhom

texts.ru:
Илхом проживает в городе Куляб. Ему 28 лет. Илхом самостоятельный и трудолюбивый молодой человек. Он женат. Живет вместе с родителями. У него двое детей. Его отец работает в институте города Куляб. 
Илхом более восьми лет работает в сфере реализации продуктов питания в рыночных условиях. Не далеко от дома Илхом открыл продуктовый магазин, где он работает продавцом.  
Илхом хорошо разбирается в качестве реализуемых товаров, он всегда может дать совет покупателям. Илхом берет кредит в размере 3 000 долларов США для того, чтобы закупить партию цветочных, травяных чаев, сахара, хлебобулочных изделий, а также приобрести хозяйственные товары.
texts.en: Ilhom lives in the city of Kulob.  He is 28 years old.  He is an independent and hardworking young person.  He is married and has two children.  Ilhom lives together with his parents.  His father works at an institute in Kulob.  Ilhom has been working in the field of selling food products in market conditions.  He opened a food market not far from his home, where he works as a salesperson.  Ilhom is very knowledgeable in the quality of sold products and can always provide advice to his customers.  Ilhom is requesting a loan in the amount of $3,000 to purchase an inventory of flower and herb teas, sugar, baked goods and also household goods.

loans.use: to purchase an inventory of flower and herb teas, sugar, baked goods and also household goods

loans.name: Heydi Patricia

texts.es: Heydi está estudiando Química y Farmacia, el crédito solicitado será para pagar los gastos de graduación y el curso de titulación de su carrera. En algunos años ella se ve como dueña de su propia farmacia y através de ello contribuir en cuanto a los fármacos se refiere, garantizando el uso adecuado de éstos. Es una joven con muchos deseos de superación es el pilar de su familia porque es la mayor de sus hermanos.
texts.en: Heydi is studying Chemistry and Pharmacy. She will use the requested loan to pay for graduation expenses and for the degree program in her major. A few years from now she sees herself owning her own pharmacy and contributing through her work, as far as drugs are concerned, to ensure their proper use. This young woman has a great desire for self-improvement, and she is the pillar of her family because she is the eldest of her siblings.

loans.use: to pay for graduation expenses.

loans.name: Sherali

texts.ru:
Шерали 37-летний женатый мужчина. У него двое детей. Шерали живет вместе с женой. Он занимается торговлей. 
Шерали начал свой бизнес в 2005 году. В то время он работал на центральном рынке города Куляб. На сегодняшний день у Шерали имеется собственный магазин. 
Шерали открыл продуктовый магазин рядом со своим домом. Он хочет увеличит ассортимент своего товара на канун Священного месяца Рамазан, так как в это время спрос на продукты питания увеличится.
texts.en: Sherali is a 37 year-old married man.  He has two children.  Sherali lives together with his wife.  He is involved in sales.  He started his business in 2005.  At that time, he worked at the central market of the city of Kulob.  Today, Sherali has his own store.  He opened his food market near his home.  He wants to expand the selection of product at the onset of the sacred month of Ramadan because the demand for food products increases during this time.

loans.use: to purchase beverages, natural juices, pasta, sugar, dairy products and chocolate

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is 38 years old and lives in Cagay-anon, Sinacaban. She is married with three children. 

Flora has a store that sells a variety of products. She has had this business for 10 years. Flora has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages and detergents to sell.
   
Flora has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages and detergents to sell.

loans.name: Maria Eva

texts.es:
La señora María Eva, es  comerciante  del  mercado en  Chinandega desde hace 41 años, vende  almuerzo su labor empieza a las seis de la mañana hasta las tres y media de la tarde de lunes a domingo.
Trabaja con la Ceprodel desde hace 4 años con 25 créditos, financiamientos que le han ayudado a incrementar su negocio, y sus utilidades y con estas mejorar su calidad de vida, Le ha permitido llevar el sustento a su hogar.  Tiene cuatro hijos es madre soltera uno de ellos no depende ya de ella pero los otros si y están en edad escolar, por los que lucha para sacarlos adelante, Solicita el  préstamo para la compra de  granos básicos al por mayor  para su negocio, Se siente agradecida con Ceprodel, por la confianza depositada en ella con los préstamos  que le hemos brindado. Ya que a la vez le han servido para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María Eva has been a merchant in Chinandega’s market for 41 years; she sells lunch.  Her work day starts at six in the morning and goes until three-thirty in the afternoon from Monday through Sunday.

She’s been working with Ceprodel for four years and has had 25 loans that have helped her increase business and profits which have led to improved quality of life.  She’s been able to support her household.  

She has four children; she’s a single mother.  One of her children no longer is dependent on her but the others are and are still school age.  She strives to move them forward.  She’s asking for the loan to buy basic grains at wholesale for her business.  She feels grateful to Ceprodel for the trust placed in her with the loans granted so far since they’ve served to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Fermin

texts.es:
El señor Fermín tiene 54 años, es soltero por viudez, vive con una hija en el Municipio de Taulabe, Comayagua. 
La actividad a que se dedica Don Fermín es la agricultura, específicamente a la siembra y producción de café. Hace  2 años se independizo y cuenta con sus propias parcelas de cultivo de café, los conocimientos lo obtuvo de sus padres ya que ha sido el patrimonio familiar. La comercialización del café la realiza en pergamino húmedo a personas intermediarias que le compran toda la producción en la comunidad, evitando con esto tener que desplazarse a otros lugares para realizar la venta. 
Actualmente ha solicitado un préstamo de 17,000 Lempiras para invertir en la compra de fertilizantes y abonar dicho cultivo. El espera obtener una buena cosecha y aprovechar el atractivo precio que mantiene el café en el mercado nacional e internacional.
texts.en:
