Fermín, age 54, is single because he is a widower.  He lives with his daughter in the Taulabe municipality in Comayagua.

Fermín is a farmer, and he produces coffee.  He became independent two years ago, and he has his own plots where he grows coffee.  He learned how to do this from his parents because it has been a family heritage.

He sells the wet parchment coffee to intermediaries who buy the entire production in the community.  This way he avoids having to travel to other placer to make the sale.

He has currently requested a loan for 17,000 lempiras.  He will use the loan to buy chemical and natural fertilizers to fertilize his crop.  He hopes to obtain a good harvest and take advantage of the attractive price that coffee maintains in the national and international markets.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for maintenance of his coffee farm.

loans.name: Valeh

texts.ru: Valeh yavlyayetsya IDP personom ,on pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda kotoriy yavlyayetsya okkupirovannim. Valeh seychas jivet v Absheron regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Valeh jenat i imeyet uje 3 detey. Valeh trudolubiviy chelovek kotoriy lubit delat novshestva i razvitiya v svoyom biznesse. Valeh nujdayetsya v 1000 AZN chtobi uvelichit pomesheniye magazina dlya razmesheniya bolshe tovarov. On uje neskalko raz bral krediti cherez Kivu i on ochen dovolen i blagodaren vsem Lenderam. On yavlyayetsya xoroshim kliyentom Komak kotoriy vsegda vovremya oplachival svoi krediti. Valeh46 let.
texts.en: Valeh is an IDP from the city of Fuzuli, which is now an occupied territory.  He currently lives in the Absheron region together with his family.  Valeh is 46 years old, married and has three children.  He is a hardworking person, who loves to create novelties and developments in his business.  Valeh needs 1000 AZN to increase his store space in order to place more merchandise there.  He has previously obtained loans through Kiva several times and is very satisfied and grateful to all the lenders.  He is a good client of Komak, who always repays his loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: to increase store space

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Rufina is a coconut wine dealer from Loboc, Bohol. She is 59 years old, is married and has five children. Her eldest is 40 and the youngest is 18. Rufina's husband works as a carpenter. She is determined to help him meet their household needs. 

She is asking for a loan to buy 5-gallon containers and tungog (a food coloring that gives coconut wine its maroon color and bitter taste that helps the natural fermentation). Rufina's profit will help meet the needs of her family, especially the family's daily consumption.

loans.use: to buy 5-gallon containers and tungog

loans.name: Kenia Del Carmen

texts.es: La Sra. Kenia Carranza es comerciante de productos lácteos, ella tiene aproximadamente un año de dedicarse en este tipo de negocio, su punto de venta es en el  mercado  de san Rafael del sur, decidió en poner este negocio gracias al apoyo de un hermano, quien la motivo para que estableciera su propio negocio. El crédito otorgado por ceprodel san Rafael del sur fue para ampliarlo, ya que actualmente se dedican a vender también en algunas comunidades del municipio a dueños de pulpería y a una cooperativa de la zona, por lo que doña Kenia manifiesta un agradecimiento especial por la oportunidad brindada y por haber mejorado su actividad comercial.
texts.en:
Kenia Carranza is a dairy products merchant.  She’s been in this type of business for about a year.  Her point of sale is in the market of San Rafael del Sur.  She decided to set up this business thanks to her brother’s support who motivated her to open her own business.
The loan granted by Ceprodel San Rafael del Sur was to expand it because they currently also sell in some of the communities in the municipality to grocery store owners and to a local cooperative which is why Kenia expresses her special gratitude for the opportunity provided to improve her commercial activity.

loans.use: to buy dairy products.

loans.name: Lleni

texts.es:
Lleni tiene 27 años, es una amable mujer, joven, emprendedora y muy trabajadora. Tiene cuatro hijos de 7, 6, 3 y la menor que está cerca a cumplir un año. Vive junto a ellas y a su pareja, desde hace 13 años, llamado Adriano.

Hace 4 años que empezó a vender comestibles de forma ambulatoria y a la par que ofrecía pescado; sin embargo, luego de mucho esfuerzo pudo establecer su tienda en su casa desde hace 2 años y ahora está más tranquila, pues la zona donde vive es una calle de mucha concurrencia. Eventualmente alterna su trabajo ejerciendo el oficio de cocinera para las faenas en las chacras, donde prepara los alimentos para los peones. Cuando estableció su tienda tuvo muchas dificultades, como la competencia de otras bodegas, pero con el pasar del tiempo pudo superarlo, ahora ella es muy visitada porque ofrece artículos variados, precios cómodos y un trato amable.

Este es su crédito número 4 con MFP y está muy contenta por el apoyo financiero que recibe, y por la confianza que depositan en ella para seguir adelante. Agradece el asesoramiento que ha recibido y está muy segura de avanzar con el apoyo de su banco comunal, ya que considera que todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias.

Con el monto solicitado, 1000 nuevos soles, comprará tres sacos de arroz, dos sacos de azúcar, cajas de leche grande y chicas, aceites por litros, fideos, productos enlatados, embutidos y otros comestibles de consumo diario.
texts.en:
Lleni is 27 years old, she is a friendly, young, hard working woman with an entrepreneurial spirit. She has four children who are 7, 6, 3 years old and the smallest child who will turn one-year-old soon. She lives with her children and her partner, Adriano, whom she has been with for 13 years. 

Four years ago she began selling groceries and fish by walking door to door. After much invested effort, two years ago she was able to open a small grocery store out of her home and now she works more peacefully. The area where she lives is a street with high traffic. Eventually she also began alternating her work, working as a cook to prepare food for the day laborers who work in the fields. When she first opened her store she had many problems, like the competition from other stores, but with time she was able to overcome them. Now her store has many customers because she a variety of products, with fair prices and treats people well.   

This is the fourth loan she has taken out through MFP and she is very happy for the financial support they offer her and also for the confidence they have in her to be able to continue moving forward. She is thankful for the advice she has received and is positive she will be able to get ahead with the support of the communal bank. She believes that the other members of the bank are all responsible and supportive people.  

With the loan she has requested of 1000 nuevos soles, she will buy three sacks of rice, two sacks of sugar, boxes of small and large milk containers, liters of cooking oil, noodles, canned products, meats, and other groceries of daily use.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice and sugar, milk, cooking oil, and other products for her store.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sughran's Group

texts.en:
Sughran has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her embroidery business. She is a very talented lady and her work is very much liked by her clients, who give her regular orders every month.

With the loan investment she will buy beads, embroidery thread and other embroidery materials in bulk quantities, which will allow her to prepare better-looking clothes for her clients and increase her orders and sales.

She has been attached to her business for many years and is very confident that the Kiva loan will help her make more profits from her business.

loans.use: To buy beads and threads for her embroidery business

loans.name: Yom

texts.en:
Originally from the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Cambodia, Yom is a 52-year-old married mother of five children. Three of her children (two daughters and one son) still depend on her for support, while one is in school and another works in Thailand.

The main source of her family’s income is from rice farming on a two-hectare plot of farmland. She also generates supplemental income by planting spices. Her main business challenges are droughts and the lack of adequate water.

Yom has been with VisionFund for three loan cycles and has successfully repaid her prior loans. She has used those loans to better support her current business, which enables her to earn 48,900 KHR per day to cover her family's living expenses. Now she is applying for a new loan in the amount of 1,500,000 KHR with VisionFund. She would use the loan proceeds to buy insecticides (to protect her crop yields), manure, and rice seeds, and to pay for plowing fees. She hopes to increase her income from the business and to thereby have a better standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase insecticides, manure, and rice seeds, and to pay plowing fees.

loans.name: Dani Lorenzo

texts.es:
El señor Dani Lorenzo, se dedica a la actividad de acarreo en su triciclo desde hace 7años,es casado y le tiene tres niños los cuales dos de ellos están en edad escolar a los cuales los tiene que mantener su educación.
El señor Dani, necesitaba el financiamiento para dar a reparar el medio de trabajo para darle una buena imagen a sus clientes ,  es por tal motivo que visito la institución  con el fin de que fuese beneficiado para optar a un crédito y así dar a reparar su medio de trabajo, es en señor bien luchador y emprendedor, es su segundo crédito que le hemos brindado y se siente muy bien y agradecido con la oportunidad que le hemos brindado, según el cuidara mucho su record crediticio para seguir trabajando con la institución y poder sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Dani Lorenzo has worked for 7 years providing transportation services with his three-wheeled vehicle. He is married and has three children, two of whom are school aged, so that he needs to support their education. 

Dani needed the loan to send his work vehicle for repair, in order to present a good image to his customers. It is for this reason that he visited the institution, with the aim of gaining benefits by requesting a loan and thus being able to repair his work vehicle. He is a very enterprising and hard-working man; this is the second loan which has been provided to him, and he feels very good about and grateful for the opportunity that has been offered to him. According to him, he will take very good care of his credit record so that he can keep working with the institution and help his family get ahead.

loans.use: to maintain his vehicle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a soldering machine and other construction tools.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
Marisol tiene 38 años, es una mujer muy buena, amable y trabajadora. Está separada, hace 4 años, del padre de su única hija llamada Jyody, quien tiene actualmente 12 años y está en etapa escolar. Es por ella por quien Marisol trabaja arduamente, ya que desea brindarle una buena educación y ofrecerle un futuro mejor, viven en la casa de sus padres.

Su trabajo consiste en la venta de productos de belleza. Esto lo realiza desde su casa o por las calles, entre sus amigos y personas que conoce. Cuando se inició, hace 6 años, le era complicado poder realizarlo con éxito, ya que no sabía muy bien cómo lograr obtener a sus clientes, pero con el tiempo fue aprendiendo y capacitándose en técnicas de ventas, así pudo salir adelante y logró consolidarse como una vendedora exitosa. Adicionalmente, hace 5 años, tiene instalado en su casa un equipo para brindar servicio de radiofonía a todas las personas que desean comunicarse con sus familiares o amigos en zonas alejadas de la ciudad.
Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que puede tener tiempo para poder hacer todas las actividades que desee, además de brindarle también atención a su hija. Le está yendo muy bien, ya que tiene dos ingresos que le permiten proyectarse al futuro.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP y está muy contenta de saber que le brindan un apoyo financiero para avanzar con su trabajo. Se compromete a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas, y está muy tranquila con su grupo, ya que todos son muy responsables y solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado, 600 nuevos soles, comprará productos de belleza, como perfumes, cremas corporales, cremas de manos, talcos, cosméticos y otros accesorios para tener en stock e incrementar la variedad de productos que ofrece a sus clientes.
texts.en: Marisol is thirty-eight years old and is a very good, friendly, and hardworking woman. She has been separated for four years from the father of her only daughter Jyody, who is twelve years old and in school. It is for her that Marisol works hard, since she wants to provide her with a good education and a better future. Currently they live in her parents' house. She makes her living selling beauty products. She does this from home or on the streets, working alongside her friends and acquaintances. When she started, six years ago, it was difficult for her to be successful, since she didn't know very much about how to attract customers. However, in time she learned sales techniques and was thus able to make progress and become a successful vendor. Additionally, five years ago she had radio equipment installed in her house so that she can provide a service whereby people can communicate with their relatives or friends who are in remote areas. What she likes most about her work is that she can have time to do all the things that she wishes, and the fact that she is able to provide her daughter with enough attention. Things are going well, since the income has allowed her to plan for the future. This is her first loan with MFP, and she is very happy to know that she will be able to obtain support in order to grow her business. She promises to make her repayments according to schedule, and she is very satisfied with her communal bank, since they are all responsible people and have a great deal of solidarity. With the funds she is seeking, 600 nuevos soles, she will buy beauty products such as perfumes, face and body creams, talc, cosmetics and other accessories to have in stock and increase the variety of products that she offers to her customers.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products so she can continue her sales.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Presentacion

texts.en:
Presentacion is a 39-year-old, married woman with two children from Tagbilaran, Bohol, Philippines.

For more than a year, she has owned and operated a sari-sari store, or mini-grocery store business. Presentacion works hard to earn a living so that she can help her husband provide for their family.

Presentacion is requesting a loan in the amount of 2,000 PHP to buy more items to sell, including rice, soda, canned goods, and noodles. She believes that the loan proceeds will allow her to improve her business. Presentacion dreams of expanding her business and sending her children to school so that they can receive a good education. She also wants to save money for future use.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory such as rice, soda, canned goods, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Agapita

texts.en:
Agapita is 49 years old and lives in Estrella, Sinacaban. She is married and has three children.

To earn a living, Agapita runs a store where she sells variety of products. Agapita explains that she has operated this business for 15 years.

Agapita is requesting a loan in the amount of 14,000 PHP to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, and detergents. Agapita has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Agapita hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a 38-year-old, married woman. She and her husband have two children, who are 7 and 12 years old.

Alma strives to be a better spouse to her husband, whose income largely supports their family. To generate income, Alma raises hogs in Loboc, Bohol. She explains that she likes this business because she does not have to leave home to work.

She is seeking a loan to buy piglets and feed so that she can fatten up the pigs and ultimately sell them for profits. Any income she generates as a result of the loan would be used to pay for her family's living expenses and her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a water tank and water pipes

loans.name: Kelly

texts.es:
Kelly tiene 20 años, es una mujer buena, amable y muy trabajadora. Es soltera y no tiene hijos, ya que desea primero formarse profesionalmente y después dar el salto a la maternidad. Vive en casa de sus padres donde todos los días comparte con ellos la alegría de estar juntos y trabajar para poder brindarles una mejor calidad de vida.

Su trabajo es la venta de comida. Todos los días sale a la vereda de su casa, por las tardes, para ofrecer deliciosos platillos típicos de la región, a los que acompaña con refrescantes bebidas preparadas con frutas naturales. Brinda siempre un trato amable, una buena sazón y alimentos hechos con ingredientes de la mejor calidad. Lleva realizando este trabajo por 3 años y empezó siendo ayudante de su madre quien ahora le dio el control total del negocio, es por eso que trabaja mucho, ya que además de trabajar también está estudiando y tiene que darse tiempo para dedicarse a sus labores académicas. Anteriormente vendía jugos y panes durante las mañanas, pero tuvo que cambiar de actividad debido a la importancia que representa para ella forjarse una carrera. Le gusta mucho lo que hace, ya que aparte de tener un tiempo disponible para otras funciones, también le genera muy buenas ganancias. Antes de poder realizar este trabajo tenía problemas con el pago de sus mensualidades en el instituto en donde estudia, pero ahora está más tranquila, ya que tiene un respaldo económico. Le gustaría mucho poder agrandar su negocio, poner más mesas, sillas e implementarlo con algunos utensilios que aun le faltan.

Este es su crédito número 5 con MFP y está muy contenta de saber que le brindan un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. Por su parte, se compromete, una vez más, a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual, así como lo hizo en sus créditos anteriores. Y está muy feliz de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus integrantes son muy amables y solidarios.

El monto solicitado, 800 nuevos soles, lo invertirá totalmente en la compra de ingredientes e insumos para sus comidas, como arroz, carne de pollo, aceite, aceitunas y frutas, además de dos mesas, ocho sillas, una docena de platos y otros utensilios que necesita para brindar una mejor atención.
texts.en:
Kelly is twenty years old and is a good, kind, and hard-working woman. She is single and doesn't have any children, since she would like to get an education before taking the plunge into motherhood. She lives in her parents' home, and shares with them the joy of being together and working to offer them a beter quality of life.

She works selling food. Every afternoon she goes out to the sidewalk in front of her home, and offers delicious regional dishes, which she serves with refreshing drinks made with natural fruit. She always treats her customers well, and offers them well-seasoned food, made with the highest quality ingredients. She has been in this business for three years. She started out as a helper for her mother, who has since put her fully in charge of the business. She works hard because, besides working, she also goes to school and has to allow herself time for schoolwork. She used to sell juices and bread in the mornings, but she had to make changes to the business because it is important to her to pursue a career. She enjoys her work very much, because besides having time available for other things, it also generates a very good profit. Before being able to work in this business, she had trouble making her monthly payments at the school she attends, but now she has more peace of mind, because she has financial backing. She would very much like to be able to expand her business, set up more tables and chairs, and stock up on some utensils she does not yet have. 

This is her fifth loan with MFP and she is very happy knowing they offer her financial support, because this gives her confidence in moving forward with her business. On her part, she is committed, once again, to making her payments in a timely fashion, as she did with previous loans. And she is very happy to belong to her communal bank, because all of its members are very kind and supportive. 

The entire amount requested, 800 nuevos soles, will be invested in purchasing ingredients and supplies for her food, such as rice, chicken, oil, olives, and fruit, as well as two tables, eight chairs, a dozen plates, and other utensils she needs in order to offer a better service.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients and supplies to make her food, and also tables, chairs, and kitchen utensils.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 66 años, es una mujer amable y muy trabajadora, madre de dos hijos de 46 y 42 años. Vive juntos a ellos, sus nietos y a su pareja, en la casa que lograron edificar como resultado de su trabajo y mucho esfuerzo. 
Ella se dedica a la venta de gaseosas y cosméticos. Su trabajo comienza en las mañanas, inicia su recorrido por su barrio y las principales calles de la ciudad ofreciendo todos los productos que tiene para vender, esta es una forma de conseguir nuevos clientes y mantener a los que ya tiene. Por las tardes regresa a casa y espera la llegada de sus clientes para atenderlos con mucha cordialidad y salgan comprando algún perfume, crema u otro artículo de su preferencia. La venta de gaseosas lo hace con ayuda de sus nietos cuando ella no se encuentra en casa, y el horario de mayor venta es por las noches, ya que su nuera se dedica a la venta de comida y esta es una oportunidad perfecta para que los clientes que acuden a saciar su apetito también consuman sus refrescantes bebidas. Le gusta mucho lo que hace, ya que le permite estar todo el día en constante actividad y se siente útil y con mucha energía para continuar trabajando por el bien de su familia. Ahora tiene muchos planes de mejorar la exhibición de sus productos, para eso necesita comprar algunos mostradores y otros accesorios.

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá más segura de avanzar con su trabajo. Se compromete, una vez más, a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas, como lo hizo en el crédito anterior. Y además está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, pues todos sus miembros son muy responsables y solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado, 600 nuevos soles, comprará más productos de perfumería y cuidado personal; como cremas, talcos, colonias y cosméticos variados. También comprará 10 cajas de gaseosas.
texts.en:
Rosa is 66 years old and is a friendly and very hard working woman. She is the mother of two children who are 46 and 42 years old. She lives with them, her  grandchildren and her partner in the house they they were able to build due to her work and to much effort. 

She makes a living selling soft drinks and cosmetics. Her work begins in the mornings. She begins her rounds through her neighborhood and in the main streets of the city, offering all of the products that she has to sell. This is her way of finding new customers and keeping those that she already has. In the afternoons she returns to her house and awaits the arrival of customers so she can attend to them with cordiality and they leave having bought some perfume, cream or other item of their preference. Her grandchildren help her in the sale of soft drinks when she is not in the house. At night is when there are the greatest number of sales because her daughter in law works selling food. This is the perfect opportunity for customers to satisfy their appetite and have refreshing drinks. 

She likes her work a lot because it allows her to be active throughout the whole day. She feels very useful and energetic to continue working for the good of her family. Now she has many plans to improve the display of her products. To do this she needs to buy some display cases and other items. 

This is her second loan with MFP and she is very happy to know that she has financial support. This is because she will now feel more certain of advancing with her work. She is once again committed to fulfilling her payments on time, like she did with the previous loan. She is also very happy to belong to her communal bank because all of the members are very responsible and supportive. 

With the amount requested (600 nuevos soles), she will buy more perfume and personal care products, including creams, powders and various cosmetics. She will also buy 10 boxes of soft drinks.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products to increase her stock, as well as soft drinks to continue selling.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
Raquel tiene 42 años, es una mujer buena, amable y muy trabajadora. Tiene una relación conyugal desde hace 3 años con Miguel, con él tiene un pequeño hijo de 2 años. Viven en una parte del terreno de su hermano, donde ha construido su casa y disfruta al lado de su familia con el deseo de mejorar su calidad de vida.

Se dedica a la venta de comestibles de consumo regular, como arroz, azúcar, huevos, leche, aceite, condimentos, frejoles, harina entre otros. Tiene un pequeño puesto que alquila en el mercado principal del distrito más concurrido de la ciudad. Realiza esta actividad desde hace 5 años y desde que empezó ha trabajado siempre sola y ha aprendido a salir adelante. Su faena se inicia desde las 4 de la mañana y culmina alrededor de las 9 de la noche, se ha acostumbrado a este horario de trabajo, aunque reconoce que al principio no le fue tan fácil. La atención al público es lo que siempre le ha gustado realizar y lo hace con mucho esmero sobre todo porque sabe que del fruto de su trabajo colabora con los gastos de su hogar y de esta forma apoya a pareja a sobrellevar las necesidades del hogar. Se siente muy tranquila por las ganancias que obtiene y espera más adelante tener un local más grande e implementar su negocio con mayor cantidad de productos. 

Este es su primer crédito con MFP y está muy agradecida con la personas que hacen posible que su préstamo sea una realidad. Se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales y espera trabajar con mucha responsabilidad y solidaridad junto a los miembros de su banco comunal. 
Con el monto solicitado, 600 nuevos soles, comprará más abarrotes (arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite, pan, harina, fideos, productos enlatados y otros) para continuar haciendo crecer su negocio.
texts.en: Raquel is 42 years old. She is a good woman, friendly and very hardworking. She has lived with her common-law husband Miguel for three years, and they have a small son who is two years old. They live on part of her brother's land, where she has built her house. She enjoys living next to her family, and this improves her quality of life. She sells groceries such as rice, sugar, eggs, milk, oil, condiments, beans and flour, among other things. She has a small stand that she rents in the main market of the district, which is the busiest in the city. She has been doing this for five years and ever since she started, she has been working on her own, and she has learned how to get better results. Her labor starts at four in the morning and finishes around nine at night. She has gotten used to these hours of work, although she acknowledges that in the beginning it was not very easy. She has always liked serving the public, and she does this with great care. Above all she knows that the fruit of her labor will make it easier for the couple to bring in all that is necessary for the household. She feels very content with her earnings and further down the road she hopes to have a larger store with a greater variety of products. This is her first loan with MFP, and she is very thankful to the people who are making it possible that this loan will become a reality. She promises to be punctual with her monthly repayments and plans to work responsibly and in solidarity with the other members of her communal bank. With the sum she is seeking, 600 nuevos soles, she will buy more groceries (rice, sugar, milk, oil, bread, flour, noodles, canned goods and other items) so she can continue growing her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries (rice, sugar, noodles, oil, etc.) to stock her store.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 57 años, es una mujer emprendedora, honesta y muy trabajadora. Fue madre a los 17 años, ahora su hija ya tiene 40 años. Actualmente vive sola en su casa propia y día a día pone todo el empeño en las cosas que hace para continuar su vida y generarse ingresos.

Su trabajo consiste en la venta de ropa, generalmente entrega por pedido, ya sea quincenal o mensual. Tiene clientes que se lo solicitan y ella se encarga de conseguir las prendas de otra ciudad. Sus ganancias por esta actividad son muy buenas, ya que la ropa que ofrece son de marcas de calidad y confeccionadas con buenos materiales. Empezó hace 5 años y afirma que no ha recibido ninguna queja por parte de sus clientes. Sin embargo, como toda persona emprendedora, comparte esta actividad con otro trabajo, que es la lavandería, se encarga de lavar la ropa, a mano, principalmente de policías y es un oficio que puede hacer en la comodidad de su hogar. Tiene una afección física en las piernas que le obliga a caminar con la ayuda de muletas, por lo que algunas veces necesita de ayuda, aunque por lo general siempre trabaja sola. Le gusta mucho lo que hace porque siente que les demuestra a las personas que a pesar de algunas dificultades siempre se puede seguir adelante. Ahora espera establecer algún otro negocio en su casa y desarrollar ambos trabajos con mayor eficiencia, quiere tener mostradores de ropa, maniquíes, colgadores, espejos y una buena lavadora.

Este es su crédito número 4 con MFP y está muy contenta de saber que nuevamente le brindan la confianza para seguir con sus actividades. Así mismo se compromete a seguir siendo puntual en sus pagos mensuales y continuar trabajando de manera responsable con los integrantes de su banco comunal, ya que todos son personas solidarias.

Con el monto solicitado, 1500 nuevos soles, comprará más mercadería (polos, camisas, blusas, shorts y pantalones de hombres y mujeres) para continuar trabajando. Otra parte del dinero lo invertirá en la compra de artículos de lavandería como detergente, jabón y lejía.
texts.en:
Rosa is 57 years old. She is an enterprising, honest, and very hard-working woman. She became a mother at seventeen, and her daughter is now forty. She currently lives alone in her own home and day after day she dedicates all her effort to what she does in order to get on with her life and generate her own income.

She works selling clothing, which she generally delivers by order, be it biweekly or monthly. She has customers who order from her and she sees about finding the clothing items in another city. This business yelds a very good profit, since she offers brand-name quality clothing that is made with good materials. She started out five years ago and says she has never received any complaints from her customers. However, like any resourceful person, she combines this work with a second business, which is a laundry service. She works washing clothing by hand, mainly for police officers, and this is a job that can be done from the comfort of her home. She suffers from a condition in her legs which forces her to walk on crutches, which is why sometimes she needs help, though she generally works by herself. She very much enjoys her work because she feels that it is her way of showing other people that in spite of some difficulties you can always get ahead. She now hopes to set up some other business at home and work both jobs more efficiently. She wants to have clothing display cabinets, mannequins, racks, mirrors, and a good washing machine.

This is her fourth loan with MFP and she is very happy knowing that they once again offer their trust for her to continue with her businesses. She also promises to continue making her monthly payments on time and to keep working responsibly with the members of her communal bank, since they are all supportive people.

She will use the requested amount, 1,500 nuevos soles, to purchase more merchandise (polo shirts, shirts, blouses, shorts, and pants for men and women) in order to keep working. She will invest part of the money in purchasing laudry items, such as detergent, soap, and bleach.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing to sell and supplies for her laundry business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Fatima Del Rosario

texts.es:
La Señora Fatima Habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposo e hijo sueñan con tener mejores condiciones de vida, ella comerciante de años, vende ropa usada y por encargo negocio que le da  muchos ingresos para sufragar parte de los gastos del hogar, tambien  labora para institucion y  su esposa la apoya economicamente ya que labora para una empresa privada, con este nuevo financiamiento comprara mercaderia: Pacas de Ropa para agrandar un  poco mas el negocio ya si poder cumplir uno de sus sueño que es terminar de construir su casa.
Agradece a Afodenic por el apoyo brindado con este credito y por confiar en ella.
texts.en: Fatima resides in the town of Ticuantepe with her husband and son. Their dream is to have better living conditions. She has been a merchant for years. She sells used and ordered clothing, a business that earns her a lot of profit so that she can cover part of their home expenses. She also works for an institution and her husband helps her financially, since he works for a private company. She will use this new financing to purchase merchandise: bales of clothing to expand the business a little, so that she can make one of her dreams come true, which is to finish building her home. She thanks Afodenic for the support they have offered with this loan and for trusting her.

loans.use: to purchase bales of used clothing to sell.
